The copy has the same stats as you, except for its hit points, as the copy disappears and the spell immediately ends if it takes any damage. The copy has its own turn, which can be immediately before or after your turn. You command what it does (actions, bonus actions, reactions, movement, etc.). It has no resources of its own, such as ammunition, ability uses, or spell slots, so every time it uses something that costs a resource, it uses the resources that you have. For example, if the copy casts a spell, it consumes one of your spell slots as though you had cast the spell yourself. The same principle applies to the use of potions, scrolls, and similar items. When you are targeted by an attack, spell, or ability that would damage you, you can instantly switch positions with the copy, which must be within 120 feet of you, so it takes the damage and other effects in your place, causing this spell to end automatically. If the damage dealt to the copy comes from a melee attack, the attacker must make a Wisdom saving throw, becoming stunned for 1 minute on a failure. A creature stunned in this way can make the save again at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on a success. You and your copy cannot be more than 120 feet apart, if that happens the spell ends automatically and the copy disappears.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 12d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 94 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Air Essence (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You can modify the air near you to create one the following effects:
• Emulate sounds, from a whisper to a scream, including your voice, someone else's voice, or any other sound. The sound continues throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends. A creature can discern the illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC.
• Move an object (up to 20 pounds) up to 30 feet through the air.
• Conceal shallow tracks or footprints by moving dirt around.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 95 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Ancestral Retraining (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a gem worth 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Ritual Caster, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Water)
spell.text:
Element: Water
As you cast the spell, the gem used as a material component is consumed to bring visions of the target's ancestors, blending them with the target's memories and unlocking new potential within the individual. However, some of the target's memories are lost in the process. The target may choose to change any or all of their subclass, feats, or features, provided they meet the prerequisites for the chosen options. Certain abilities that require additional resources, such as gold, experience points, or training, cannot be chosen unless the target possesses the necessary resources at the time of casting. Once the spell is complete, the chosen options are permanent, and they cannot be altered by this spell or similar effects again. The GM may impose restrictions or penalties to reflect the significant impact of the decision.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge can create a thin layer of water around the creature, granting it 9d6 temporary hit points for 10 minutes.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 95 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aquatic Form (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Ritual Caster, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Water)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You modify the bodies of up to six creatures, allowing them to survive underwater. They can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to their walking speed.
At Higher Levels: When cast as a spell of 4th level or higher, you affect an additional 3 creatures for each level above 3rd.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 5d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 95 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Beryl Slabs (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You create eight plates of pure beryl at points within range of the spell. Each beryl plate is 6 inches thick and 10 feet tall by 10 feet wide. You can distribute the plates in any way you choose within range. The plates are perfect squares and can be placed in any position (horizontal or vertical). Any adjacent slabs merge with each other, and each plate can act as a foundation for another, allowing for continuous constructions in any direction, such as bridges or ramps, as long as at least one of the plates is anchored to the earth to be stable. A plate cannot occupy the space of a creature or object. If a plate appears in a location occupied by a creature, it is pushed to any side of your choice. If you try to trap a creature between the plates, the creature can make a Dexterity saving throw and position itself outside on a success. Each plate has an AC of 16 and 180 hit points, disappearing magically if reduced to 0, possibly causing the collapse of adjacent plates at the GM's discretion. As a bonus action, you can dispense the plates at any time during the spell. If you maintain concentration for the entire duration of the spell, you can choose to keep the plates permanently, but they will turn into plates of slightly greenish rock, without any value other than stone. If you choose not to keep the plates permanently or lose concentration before the end of the spell, the plates disappear magically without a trace.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can create two more slabs for each slot level above 5th.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 40-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 8d6 acid damage plus 1d6 acid damage for each slot level above 5th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 95 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Blaze Light (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (an obsidian worth at least 50 gp)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You cast a small spark at a point within range and then it explodes into a wave of confusion in a 10-foot-radius sphere. All creatures in the area must make a Wisdom saving throw or become extremely disoriented on a failure. An affected target can't take reactions and must roll a d10 at the start of each of its turns to determine its behavior for that turn. At the end of each of its turns, an affected target can make a Wisdom saving throw. If it succeeds, this effect ends for that target.
Confusion Behavior: d10 | Behavior 1 | The creature uses all its movement to move in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a d8 and assign a direction to each die face. The creature doesn't take an action this turn. 2-6 | The creature doesn't move or take actions this turn. 7-8 | The creature uses its action to make a melee attack against a randomly determined creature within its reach. If there is no creature within its reach, the creature does nothing this turn. 9-10 | The creature can act and move normally.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the radius of the confusion wave increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 4th.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 7d6 fire damage plus 1d6 fire damage for for each slot level above 4th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 96 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Blazing Army (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a ruby worth at least 500 gp)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You ignite all weapons of all allied creatures within a 30-foot radius sphere within range. For the duration of the spell, all natural and wielded weapons are considered magical and deal an extra 2d6 fire damage.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 20-foot radius sphere centered on you and deals 11d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 96 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Blessing of the Earth (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a handful of sacred soil)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You create a square area immune to dispel magic, with a side of 60 feet, having one of the vertices at a point within the range of the spell. While within the area of the spell, all allied creatures, when making attack rolls and saving throws, can roll 1d4 and add the result to their roll, have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened, and any healing they receive within the area will consider results of 1 or 2 on the dice as 3. Hostile creatures within the area that make an attack or saving throw must roll 1d4 and subtract the value from the roll. Creatures within the area cannot be targeted by divination spells. The blessing also crosses planes, preventing any ethereal travel within the area and preventing extraplanar creatures from being summoned or conjured within the area.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 11d6 acid damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 96 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Blossom (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Plant
You manifest a series of flowers in the space you occupy, which immediately grow and bloom, releasing their pollen in a circular area with a 20-foot radius centered on you. Any charm or frightening effect affecting a creature in the area ends immediately. Additionally, any creature hostile towards you or your allies within the area must make a Charisma saving throw, and on a failure, they become indifferent to you and your allies until the end of the spell or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 2d6 poison damage and requires a Constitution saving throw instead of Dexterity.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 96 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Burning Dash (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
When you cast this spell, a flame that rises from your feet covers your entire body, increasing your speed and strength momentarily. As part of this spell, you can immediately move 40 feet in any direction you choose. During this movement, you can push objects up to five times your normal capacity (or 150 times your Strength score in pounds). If you collide with a creature, the movement ends, and the creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 40 feet back and fall prone. If the creature's movement is interrupted by obstacles, it will fall prone and suffer 4d6 bludgeoning damage in addition. If the path is blocked by another creature, that creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, suffering the same damage and falling prone on a failure.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 20-foot radius sphere centered on you and deals 10d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 96 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Burning Eyes (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You cause the eyes of a creature within range to glow like blazing embers. During the spell's duration, the target gains proficiency with Charisma (Intimidation). If it already has this proficiency, the target doubles its proficiency bonus on Charisma (Intimidation) checks, and those checks are made with advantage. Additionally, any creature that the target damages has disadvantage on its next attack roll against the target until the start of the target's next turn.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals fire damage, and on the damage roll, consider any result of 1 or 2 as a 3.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 97 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Burst of Embers (HB)
spell.components: S, M (a special coal worth at least 5 gp)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You magically create a glowing dust and blow it into a Burst of Embers that illuminates everything it covers. Any creature in the area that fails a Dexterity saving throw will be covered by this glowing dust for the duration of the spell. For the duration, covered creatures and objects shed dim light in a 10-foot radius. Any attack roll against a covered creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object can't benefit from being invisible.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals fire damage and on damage roll, consider any result of 1 or 2 as a 3.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 97 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Call Allies (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You can bring your allies to assist you. When casting the spell, choose up to four willing creatures. As long as they are within 1 mile of you, each of these creatures can be teleported from their locations to an unoccupied space closest to you. If there isn't enough free space for the creature to be within 10 feet of you, or if you are somehow unreachable, the creatures will know they were called but won't be able to teleport. Objects carried by the creatures are teleported along with them, but other creatures that were being carried are not.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 11d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 97 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Calm Mind (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You fill your mind with the calm that only water can achieve. For the duration, you become immune to psychic damage, any effect that may sense emotions or read thoughts, divination spells and the charmed and frightened conditions. Optionally, you can transform the effect into an aura, affecting willing creatures of your choice within 20 feet of you, but you must concentrate to maintain the spell in this way. In this option, the spell will last only until the start of your next turn, ending sooner if you lose concentration.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot radius sphere centered on you and deals 12d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 97 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Circle of Protection (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a hand sized glass or crystal, that shatters when the spell ends)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You choose a point on the ground within range and then a large rune appears there, emitting a cylindrical mystical barrier with a 10-foot radius and 30 feet in height. No spell of 5th level or lower cast outside the barrier affects creatures or objects within it, even if cast at higher levels. Creatures within the area can be targeted by spells, but do not suffer their effects, and area spells have their effects suppressed within the cylinder. You can also, as a reaction, deflect a spell of 3rd level or lower cast against a target within the barrier. Then you choose another creature within range but outside the area to be the target. If you do so, the spell ends.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a slot of 7th level or higher, you block spells of up to 6th level and can deflect a spell of up to 4th level.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 10d6 acid damage plus 1d6 acid damage for each slot level above 6th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 97 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Commandment of Fire (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You point to a creature within range and place a magical command in its mind. The command forces the creature to perform some task or abstain from some action or to take a course of activity as you decide. The creature must understand you to be affected, and if it does, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for the duration. Whenever the charmed creature takes actions against its will, it takes 1 level of exhaustion, but no more than 1 level per day. A creature that doesn't understand you is immune to this spell. You can issue any command you choose, short of an activity that would result in certain death. If you issue a suicidal command, the spell ends. You can end the spell early by using an action to dismiss it. A remove curse, greater restoration, or wish spell also ends it.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 7th-level or 8th-level spell slot, the duration is 1 year. When you cast this spell using a 9th-level spell slot, the spell lasts until it is ended by one of the spells mentioned above.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 8d6 fire damage plus 1d6 fire damage for each slot level above 5th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 98 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Compressed Air Image (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You create an illusion of an object, creature, or other visible phenomenon as if you had cast the major image spell. But when the image is attacked or comes into contact with a creature, it explodes into a burst of air affecting a 20-foot radius sphere. Creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take 3d8 thunder damage, are deafened, and are thrown 80 feet in the opposite direction of the explosion. A creature that succeeds on the saving throw takes half damage, is not deafened, and is thrown 20 feet. A deafened creature must make a Constitution saving throw at the start of their turn, ending the deafened condition on a success. A thrown creature that has their movement impeded takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet they are unable to move. If they are obstructed by another creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking the same damage on a failed save or no damage on a success.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 40-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 11d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 98 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Conjure Earth Guardian (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a small figurine encrusted with gems worth at least 100 gp)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You conjure an earth guardian, with the same appearance as the figurine used, that emerges from the ground in an empty 10-foot cube. Use the stat block of an earth elemental to characterize the guardian, which will remain for the duration of the spell or until reduced to 0 hit points, disappearing magically when the spell ends. The guardian obeys you to the best of its ability and acts after you in the initiative order. You can give simple courseof-action commands, such as attacking a target or running in a direction, as a free action. If you want to give a command the size of a phrase, you must spend a bonus action. If you lose concentration, the guardian will continue to follow the last command until completed. If the guardian completes the action and cannot hear or obtain new commands, it will use the Dodge action and preserve itself as best as possible. You can use an action to regain concentration on this spell a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge infuses your guardian with energy, allowing it to use an action to cast the elemental surge cantrip as if it were you, only once during the spell's duration, dealing 5d6 acid damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 99 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Counter Flood (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell, turning the magic power into healing droplets. If the creature is casting a spell of 4th level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 5th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails and has no effect. If this effect causes a spell to fail, a creature within range regains a number of hit points equal to 2d8 per spell's level.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you can automatically cancel a 5th-level spell slot per level above 7th.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 11d6 cold damage plus 1d6 cold damage for each slot level above 7th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 99 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Crown of the Sirocco (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Air)
spell.text:
Element: Air
Circles of hot and dry winds surround the targeted creature of this spell, creating a strong wind area with a 10-foot radius around it, granting a +2 bonus to AC and imposing disadvantage on ranged attack rolls made against it. Hostile creatures that start their turn or enter the area must make a Strength saving throw or be pushed out of the area on a failed save. During the target's turn, it can use a bonus action to make a ranged spell attack against a creature within 30 feet. If the attack hits, it deals 1d12 bludgeoning damage, and the attacked target must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it is pushed back 20 feet and fall prone; on a success, it is pushed back 10 feet and remain standing. If there is an obstacle in the way of the pushed creature, it takes 2d6 bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was pushed, and if the obstacle is another creature, that creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it takes the same damage and also fall prone. In addition, if a creature is targeted by an attack and the attacker or the target is within 30 feet of the area of this spell, the target can take a reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack by sending a gust of wind towards it.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone and deals 12d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 99 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Curse of Flames (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Fire)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You touch a creature, and it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration of the spell. The cursed creature feels terrible pain as if it were being burned. Every time you deal damage to the cursed creature, it takes an extra 1d6 fire damage. Additionally, at the start of its turns, the cursed creature must make a Constitution saving throw, and on a failure, the creature feels intense pain and wastes its action of that turn doing nothing.
At Higher Levels: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. If you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the duration is 8 hours. If you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is 24 hours. If you use a 9th level spell slot, the spell lasts until it is dispelled. Using a spell slot of 5th level or higher grants a duration that doesn't require concentration.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 7d6 fire damage plus 1d6 fire damage for each slot level above 4th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 99 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Deflection Air (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You summon the power of wind to protect yourself, preventing damage and even deflecting attacks. For the duration, damage from ranged attacks against you is reduced by an amount equal to 5 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier. If the damage is reduced to 0, you can take a reaction to deflect the attack toward another target within the original range of the attack. When deflecting, you make a ranged spell attack against the new target, applying the original damage to it on a hit.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 8d6 thunder damage plus 1d6 thunder damage for each slot level above 5th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 100 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Diamond Sword (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a diamond worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You create a magical sword made of pure diamond that rises from the ground. You and any creature who wields the sword are considered proficient with it. The sword's blade is incredibly sharp and is considered to be made of adamantine for damage reduction. In addition, it grants the creature who wields it a +3 bonus to attack and damage rolls, and any natural roll of 19 or 20 is considered a critical hit. The sword is versatile, able to be used with one hand dealing 2d8 slashing damage or with two hands dealing 2d10 slashing damage, and its damage cannot be healed by any means other than a rest. After the duration, the sword magically disappears.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 40-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 11d6 acid damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 100 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Disarray Terrain (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You disarrange the terrain in a 20-foot-radius area centered on a point within range. All creatures within the area at the time of its creation must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. After that, the area becomes difficult terrain for the spell's duration. During the spell's duration, you can use your bonus action to shake the disarranged area again, forcing all creatures within it to make a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals acid damage, and on the damage roll treat every 1 or 2 as a 3.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 100 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Disk of Dust (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You create a protective barrier in a point of your choice within range, forming a 5-foot-radius circular shield with 2 inches of thickness, made of dust and shimmering energy. The shield has 1d10+10 hit points and provides cover to you and any creatures directly behind it. If the shield hit points reaches 0 it is destroyed, ending the spell. While the spell is active, as a bonus action, you can move the shield up to 20 feet in any direction, and even shift it's orientation between vertical and horizontal, but you must remain within 30 feet of it or the spell will end. The shield will block any physical attacks or spells that would pass through it, as any solid barrier, but will not protect against area-of-effect spells or attacks that bypass physical objects. In addition, the shield may be used to carry objects up to 50 pounds or activate traps.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the shield's hit points increase by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals acid damage, affects a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide, on the damage roll treat every 1 or 2 as a 3, and deals an extra 1d6 acid damage for every 2 spell levels used above 1st.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 100 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Dragon Breath (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You are imbued with the breath of a brass dragon, releasing this breath upon casting and choosing one of the two breaths below:
Fire Breath: You spit out a 60-foot line of fire with a width of 5 feet. Creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 13d6 fire damage on a failure or half as much damage on a success.
Sleep Breath: You exhale a sleep-inducing gas in a 60-foot cone. Creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 10 minutes. This effect ends if the creature takes damage or another creature uses an action to wake it.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone area, and if you have used the fire breath, you use the sleep breath, but creatures in the area will sleep for 5 minutes. If you have used the sleep breath, you can do a 8d6 fire damage breath, which does not awaken affected creatures.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 100 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Earth Absorption (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You transfer some of the damage that would be caused to you to the earth. When you take damage from any source, you gain resistance to the type of damage that triggered the spell until the end of your next turn.
Elemental Flux: You channel your next elemental surge down your body to your feet and stomp the ground. All creatures in a 10-foot radius circle centered on you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 101 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Earth Armor (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a small amount of gravel)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Earth)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You create a thin layer of earth around the target and can choose to have one of the two effects below:
• Grant 1d6 + your Wisdom modifier temporary hit points.
• The target's base AC becomes 10 + its Dexterity or Constitution modifier (the target chooses the ability to use). If the target is yourself, also add your Wisdom modifier.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals acid damage, and on the damage roll treat every 1 or 2 as a 3.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 101 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Earth Embrace (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a diamond worth at least 50 gp)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You alter the gravity around up to six creatures of your choice within a 40-foot square within range. Each creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be affected by the spell for the duration. An affected creature has difficulty moving and suffers a penalty of -2 to its AC and to its Dexterity and Strength saving throws. Its movement and actions are limited (see below), allowing it to use only half of its movement and only an action or a bonus action on the same turn. The creature cannot maintain concentration on spells and if it attempts to cast a spell, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw; otherwise, the spell fails.
Limited Actions: The targets of the spell have limited but not prevented actions. If a creature wants to take a reaction, or use both its action and bonus action, or use its entire movement, it must make a Strength saving throw. On a success, it can use the chosen option as usual but suffers one level of exhaustion. On a failure, the creature only performs what this spell allows and suffers one level of exhaustion from the effort.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 3d6 acid damage, and if it hits a creature under the effect of earth embrace, it takes double damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 101 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Earth Essence (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You tap into the energy of the earth and are able to perform the following tricks. For this spell, the term earth includes sand, soil, stone, and similar terrains.
• You can create a small, harmless tremor that extends up to 15 feet in radius and lasts for 1 minute. This can be useful for creating distractions or triggering traps.
• You can move the earth underneath an object that weighs up to 15 pounds, causing it to move up to 5 feet in any unoccupied direction. This can be helpful for moving small objects or creating obstacles.
• You can create a small earth construct with an AC of 11, 10 hit points, and 15 feet of movement, up to 25 feet away from you. You can telepathically command the construct to perform simple tasks, such as carrying an object weighing up to 20 pounds. Note that the construct cannot make attacks and will dissolve after 10 minutes or when its hit points are reduced to 0.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 101 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Earth Imprison (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a powder composed of diamond, emerald, ruby, and sapphire dust worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You choose a creature that you can see and that is not native to the Material Plane and trap it within the earth. The chosen creature must make a Charisma saving throw or be swallowed by the earth, becoming trapped in a state of suspended animation underground until released. A trapped creature can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the creature accumulates 3 successes, it is freed, but is banished back to its original plane of existence. If it fails 3 times (including the initial one), the creature will remain trapped until it is released by another creature. A creature trapped for less than 1001 days that is unearthed exits the state of suspended animation and returns to its plane. A creature that has been trapped for more than 1001 days, when unearthed, is freed from the effects of the spell, but if it dies on the Material Plane within the next 1001 years, it will die permanently and not return to its plane of origin. After these subsequent 1001 days, the creature is free of any effects of this spell. You can release a trapped creature at any time with an action, as long as you are on the same plane of existence.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 11d6 acid damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 102 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Earth Maze (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a miniature maze made of stone)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You make the entire ground tremble in a 60-foot radius centered on you. A number of creatures of your choice, equal to your Wisdom modifier, that you can see within range, are swallowed by the ground, falling into a huge earth maze. Each of the creatures is sent to a different maze, so they can't find each other. To escape the maze, the creature must accumulate 3 successes in Wisdom checks, each of which must be made with their action at the beginning of their next turns. The DC of the Wisdom checks is equal to your spell save DC. For each failure, the creature takes 5d6 bludgeoning damage from small cave-ins in the tunnels. A minotaur or other creature with the Labyrinthine Recall special trait (or a similar one) automatically succeeds on this check.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 12d6 acid damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 102 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Earth Scales (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Earth)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
This spell transforms the skin of a creature into stone-like scales. Upon casting, you can choose to grant the target resistance to two of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, thunder, or nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 7d6 acid damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 102 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Earth Shelter (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Ritual Caster, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Earth)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
When you touch a silk scarf to a surface of rock or earth, you create a shelter for up to eight people. The entrance marked by the scarf can only be seen by those you designate and is invisible to others. Inside the 20-foot cube shelter is dry, has a comfortable climate, and a small crystal provides illumination that can be turned on or off with a word from anyone chosen. At the end of the spell, you can cast it again to maintain the same shelter, otherwise the spell ends. You can use an action to end the spell at any time, and when the spell ends, the void created fills and expels anything inside it out of it. The volume of available rock or earth must be compatible with the size of the shelter created, otherwise the spell fails.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge imbue the entrance with elemental energy, so that once during the spell's duration, when an undesired person enters the earth shelter, they must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 5d6 acid damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 102 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Elemental Frenzy (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You ignite the flames of rage in a creature you can see within range, forcing the creature to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, for the duration of the spell, the creature becomes frenzied and will always attack its nearest creature. If there are no creatures within reach, the affected creature will spend its entire turn moving to the nearest creature. The affected creature is also immune to the frightened and charmed conditions and cannot use spells or any spellcasting abilities, only making armed and unarmed attacks. Additionally, all of its attack rolls will have advantage, but all attack rolls against the affected creature will also have advantage. The affected creature can make a new saving throw at the beginning of its turns to break free of the effect on a success. If it has taken any damage since the end of its last turn, it will make the save with disadvantage.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge creates a burst, which affects a 10-foot radius circle centered on you and deals 5d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 102 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Elemental Surge (HB)
spell.text:
With an action, you release pure elemental energy from your hands in a 15-foot cone. You deal 1d6 damage of your primary elemental type, as shown on the table below. All creatures within the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking only half damage on a successful save. You can also focus all energy on a ray. In this case, you make a ranged spell attack with a range of 60 feet and deal the same damage that it would deal in a cone (or other shapes), even if empowered by Elemental Flux:
Cantrip Upgrade: This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).
Primary Elemental Types: Primary Element | Damage Type Air | Thunder Earth | Acid Fire | Fire Water | Cold
At Higher Levels: With this special cantrip, you can expend one of your spell slots to increase the damage it deals. The extra damage added depends on the level of the spell slot used, as shown on the table below. If you use a spell slot of 4th-level or higher, the range of the spell's area of effect doubles (30-foot cone) and if you use a 7th-level or higher spell slot, the range triples (45-foot cone).
Spell Level | Extra Damage 1st | 1d6 2nd | 2d6 3rd | 3d6 4th | 5d6 5th | 6d6 6th | 7d6 7th | 9d6 8th | 10d6 9th | 11d6
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 103 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Ether Confluence (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You commune with the element of air, and it answers your call. You can determine how the winds of up to 5 miles will behave, accelerating or stopping them. Each round that you accelerate or stop the winds, the winds in the area increase or decrease one stage on the Wind table:
Ether Confluence: Wind Stage | Condition 1 | Calm 2 | Moderate wind 3 | Strong wind 4 | Gale 5 | Storm
In addition, as a bonus action, you can cause a strong gust of wind to blow in a direction of your choosing, affecting a 120 square feet area. Any creatures that start their turn or enter the area must make a Strength saving throw or be pushed 40 feet in the direction of the wind and be knocked prone. A creature whose movement is impeded by obstructed spaces, such as walls or objects two size categories larger, takes 1d6 damage for every 10 feet it moved before having its movement impeded. If you choose to have the wind blow against the ground or a creature that cannot move due to a wall or other obstructed space caused by large or larger objects, a creature that fails the saving throw is knocked prone and restrained until the beginning of its next turn.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge creates a burst, which affects a 30-foot radius circle centered on you and deals 12d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 103 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Evanescence of Sue'en (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You connect your essence with that of the air. For the duration, your speed is doubled, you have advantage on any Dexterity ability checks and saving throws, and you don't provoke opportunity attacks for moving. In addition, when a creature makes an attack against you, you can take a reaction to dissipate into the air and avoid the attack. While dissipated, you are immune to all damage. At the start of your next turn, you rematerialize in any unoccupied space within 120 feet of the initial point. Creatures of your choice within 5 feet must make a Constitution saving throw, being moved 5 feet and incapacitated for 1 minute on a failure.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot radius circle centered on you and deals 14d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 103 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Fairy Dance (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You cast this spell and begin to dance, affecting a 30-foot radius sphere centered on you. You can choose a number of creatures equal to your Wisdom modifier to be immune to the effects of this spell, while all other creatures that start their turn or enter the area and can see you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they are charmed. A creature charmed by this spell begins to replicate your dance. While you use your action to dance, all charmed creatures dance along with you, losing their actions. If you move, the creatures move with you in the best way they can, expending their movement on their next turn. A creature that is more than 60 feet away from you, or who fails to see you for two turns or takes damage, is freed from the spell's effects.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 5d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 104 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Fields of Wind (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You force the wind to obey your command, lifting any number of willing creatures within 100 feet of you. Each affected creature gains a flying speed of 60 feet as long as it doesn't move more than 100 feet away from the spellcaster. If it does, the creature loses the flying speed and falls if it is still aloft, but it regains the flying speed if it enters within the spell's range again.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot-radius circle centered on you and deals 12d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 104 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Fire Collar (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You attempt to create a magical, non-burning collar of flames around the neck of a beast you can see within range. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or the collar forms around its neck and it is charmed for the duration. If you or creatures friendly to you are fighting it, it has advantage on the saving throw. While the creature is charmed, it understands your commands and will try to fulfill them to the best of its ability. You can give a simple command, such as attacking a creature or running in a direction, as a free action. Whether or not it carries out a more complex command depends on the creature's Intelligence and the judgment of the GM. If the creature completes the order and doesn't receive further instructions from you, it defends and preserves itself to the best of its ability. If you or an ally of yours deals damage to the creature, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the spell on a success.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell with a 5th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. When you use a 6th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 1 hour. When you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 8 hours.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 7d6 fire damage plus 1d6 fire damage for each slot level above 4th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 104 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Fire Crown (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You attempt to create a magical, non-burning crown of flames on the head of a humanoid creature you can see within range. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and if it fails, the crown forms on its head and it is charmed for the duration. If any ally or friendly creature is fighting against the target, it has advantage on the saving throw. While the crown remains on the target, as long as it can clearly hear you, it will obey your commands to the best of its ability. You can give commands for simple actions, such as attacking a target or running in a direction, as a free action. If you want to give an order of the length of a sentence, you must spend a bonus action. If the creature completes the action and can no longer hear or receive new commands, it will use its action to defend and preserve itself as best as it can. If you or an ally of yours deals damage to the creature, it may repeat the saving throw, ending the spell on a success.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 6th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 10 minutes. When you use a 7th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 1 hour. When you use a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the duration is concentration, up to 8 hours.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 8d6 fire damage plus 1d6 fire damage for each slot level above 5th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 105 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Fire Dragon Transformation (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a red, gold, or brass dragon scale, which the spell consumes)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You infuse flames into your body, transforming into a humanoid creature with draconic features. For the duration of the spell, your scales grant you an AC that cannot be less than 14 + your Constitution modifier, your senses grant you blindsight of 30 feet, your wings grant you a flying speed of 60 feet, and you become immune to fire damage but vulnerable to cold damage.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone, deals 11d6 fire damage and can be used as a bonus action.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 105 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Fire Essence (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You can create or manipulate fire to produce one of the following effects:
• You create a magic flame in your hand, which can take any form but can't be larger than 1 cubic foot. You can absorb non-magical flames within a range of 60 feet, extinguishing 5 feet of them, and transforming the flame in your hand into a magical and harmless source of light that sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.
• You can ignite an object or space up to 5 cubic feet in size, illuminating your surroundings. The flames can only be extinguished if you command them to do so or if they are covered by at least 1 liter of water from a magical source. You can create as many magic flames as you wish.
• You can make the flames take on simple shapes, such as the vague form of a creature or object, and animate them as desired, providing a fun and useful way to create illusions or entertain others.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 105 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Fire Lobotomization (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (any translucent gem worth at least 500 gp)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You point the gem at a creature you can see within range and cast a fiery-looking ray from your forehead, which pierces through obstacles and reaches the creature's mind. The creature must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a success, the creature falls unconscious and wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature uses an action to wake it. On a failure, the creature's Intelligence and Wisdom are reduced to 1. The affected creature can't cast spells, activate magic items, understand language, or communicate in any intelligible way, but it can still identify its friends, follow them, and protect them. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, and if it succeeds three times, it will overcome the effects of the spell. However, if it fails three times, including the first, it will be permanently affected by the spell. The effects of this spell can be ended by a heal, greater restoration, wish, or any similar spell or ability.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone and deals 12d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 105 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Fire Shackles (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You attempt to create magical, non-burning chains around the limbs of a creature of your choice that you can see within range. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and if it fails, the shackles form and it will be charmed for the duration. If an ally or friendly creature is fighting against the target, it has advantage on the saving throw. While the chains remain on the target, you have telepathic communication with it and always know where it is, even on another plane, and it will obey your commands to the best of its ability. You can give commands of simple courses of action, such as attacking a target or running in a direction, as a free action. If you want to give an order of a sentence length, you must use a bonus action. If the creature completes the action and receives no new commands, it will use the action to defend and preserve itself as best as it can. If you or one of your allies deals damage to the creature, it may repeat the saving throw, ending the spell on a success.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell with a 9th-level spell slot, the duration is concentration, up to 8 hours.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 12d6 fire damage plus 1d6 fire damage for each slot level above 8th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 106 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Fireheart Bond (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You try to awaken the warmth of friendship within another person. Choose a humanoid that you can see within range and that can clearly see and hear you. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails the saving throw, it is charmed by you until the spell ends or until you or your companions do anything harmful to it. The charmed creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. When the spell ends, the creature knows it was charmed by you.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals fire damage, affects a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide, and deals an extra 1d6 fire damage for each 2 slot levels above 1st.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 106 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Fissure (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You manipulate the earth, opening a fissure within range, starting at a point you can see. The fissure occupies a line 50 feet long and 10 feet wide. Within the line, a chasm opens up to a depth of 20 feet, and creatures within the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they fall into the chasm. The terrain inside the fissure is considered difficult, and its walls are sandy, making any Strength (Athletics) check to climb it to be rolled against your Spell Save DC. Starting at your next turn, you can close the fissure as an action. Creatures still inside it must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 6d12 force damage on a failure, or half as much on a success. Until the start of your next turn after closing the fissure, it is not fully sealed, and a creature trapped inside the fissure has total cover but is restrained and can use their action to make a Strength saving throw. On a success, they can use their full movement to try to climb out, ending the condition when they leave the fissure, but for every 1 foot of movement required, they must spend an additional 1 foot, emerging in an adjacent space to the fissure if the movement is sufficient. On a failure, they cannot move. At the start of the next turn after the fissure is closed, it is fully sealed, and all creatures still inside it are incapacitated and have their movement reduced to 0. Creatures with burrowing movement are immune to the effects of closing the fissure. The fissure closes automatically at the end of the spell or if you lose concentration.
Elemental Flux: With your next elemental surge, you stomp the ground. All creatures in a 20-foot radius circle centered on you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 10d6 bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 106 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Flame Body (HB)
Flame Hammer (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a ruby worth at least 400 gp)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Fire)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You infuse your hands, or the hands of a willing creature you touch, with a mystical blue flame, creating a magical hammer that deals 3d10 fire damage per attack. The creature wielding the hammer is considered proficient with it and can use their Strength, Dexterity, or Wisdom modifier for attack and damage rolls. As a bonus action, the creature can suppress or release the weapon at any time for the duration of the spell.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 11d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 107 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Flame Weapon (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Fire)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You touch a willing creature and for the duration of the spell, all of the creature's natural and wielded weapons are considered magical and deal an extra 1d6 fire damage.
At Higher Levels: When you use a 5th or 6th level spell slot, the extra damage increases to 2d6, and if you use a 7th level or higher spell slot, the extra damage becomes 3d6.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 5d6 fire damage plus 1d6 fire damage for each slot level above 3rd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 107 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Flames of Adoration and Fear (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a dragon scale, chromatic for fear or metallic for adoration)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You ignite your spirit with flames, emitting an aura that generates adoration or fear in a specific type of creature around you. You choose a type of intelligent creature as the target of this spell, and all of those within range are affected according to the chosen aura as follows:
Frightful Aura: This aura causes the chosen creatures within range to feel fear. Each creature of the chosen type that starts its turn or enters the aura must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you for the duration of the spell. A creature that succeeds the saving throw is immune to the effect for 1 minute. While frightened, the creature uses its movement to reach the safest place possible where it cannot see you and is out of range. When it is out of range and can no longer see you, the creature is no longer frightened. If the creature re-enters the range or can see you again, it becomes frightened once more. Whenever a creature takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Adoration Aura: This aura causes all chosen creatures within range to adore you as a revered entity. Each creature of the chosen type that starts its turn or enters the aura must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become charmed by you for the spell's duration. A creature that succeeds the saving throw is immune to the effect for 1 minute. A charmed creature approaches you as closely as possible and will adore you in the best way its culture or customs would venerate a figure of respect, as determined by the GM. Whenever a creature can no longer see you and is more than 60 feet away from you, it is free from the effect, but will become affected again if it sees you or is within 60 feet of you once more. If a creature takes damage, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone and deals 12d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 107 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Flames of Fear (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
All creatures you choose within the spell's range and that can see you must make a Charisma saving throw. A target automatically succeeds the saving throw if it is immune to the frightened condition. On a failure, the target is affected by the spell. Until the end of the spell's duration, you can, as a bonus action, specify a location that is not occupied by a creature where the creatures will believe that blazing flames are erupting, emitting extreme heat. At the start of their turns, each affected target within 30 feet of the chosen point must move away from the heat source at all its speed before taking any other actions. A creature that is forced to move by this effect may repeat the saving throw at the end of its turn, freeing itself from the effect on a success. A creature that does not move for any reason remains frightened until it moves away. A creature will not walk to a location that is obviously a mortal danger, such as a cliff, but it may provoke opportunity attacks during its movements.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 7d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 107 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Flames of Heart (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You kindle the flames of courage in the hearts of all willing creatures that you can see and that can see you within the spell's range. For the duration, affected creatures have resistance to psychic damage, are immune to being charmed or frightened, and have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws. It also dispels any ongoing effects of being charmed or frightened.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone and deals 14d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 108 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Flames of Heroism (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You ignite the fighting spirit of up to five willing creatures within the spell's range. An affected creature becomes immune to be frightened, gains a bonus of 1d4 on its attack rolls, and its armed and unarmed attacks become magical and cause an extra 1d6 fire damage.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 6th-level or 7th-level spell slot, the range of the spell increases to 60 feet and the extra damage increases to 1d8. If you use an 8th-level or higher spell slot, the range of the spell increases to 90 feet and the extra damage increases to 1d10.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 20-foot radius circle centered on you and deals 8d6 fire damage plus 1d6 fire damage for each slot level above 5th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 108 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Flames of Leadership (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You amplify the flames of leadership within you. For the duration of the spell, you have advantage on Charisma (Persuasion, Deception, and Intimidation) checks. Once during the spell's duration, you can give a one-word simple command to a creature within 60 feet, which must make a Wisdom saving throw, following the command on a failure. The command has no effect if the target is undead, if it doesn't understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it. After following the command, all other effects of the spell end. Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the GM determines how the target behaves. If the target can't follow your command, the spell ends.
Approach: The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.
Drop: The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.
Flee: The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.
Grovel: The target falls prone and then ends its turn.
Halt: The target doesn't move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 4th-level spell slot or higher, for the duration of the spell, you gain an extra use of the command for every 2 slot levels above 2nd that you use. The bonus to ability checks granted by this spell only ends when the last use of the command is used.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 2d6 fire damage plus 1d6 fire damage for each slot level above 2nd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 108 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Flash (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You swiftly clap your hands together, producing a strong flash of light with a 15-foot radius. All creatures within the spell's range and that can see the light must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature will be blinded until the end of its next turn.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 10-foot radius circle centered on you, deals fire damage, and on the damage roll, consider any result of 1 or 2 as a 3.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 108 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Fluid Sense (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
By invoking the power of water, you are able to sense all living creatures and water elementals. You know the exact location of these creatures within range, and you can determine its species and if the creature is losing liquid (such as from bleeding, for example).
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 40-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 8d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 108 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Focused Blast (HB)
spell.time: 1 reaction, which you take when you or a creature you can see within 60 feet of you becomes a target of a spell or effect that deals damage in an area
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You focus the energy of an area spell or effect that deals damage onto a single creature of your choice that was originally targeted by that spell or effect. The chosen creature must be within range of the spell or effect, and you must have a clear line of sight to it. The chosen creature takes an additional 1d6 damage of the same type as the original spell or effect, and the DC of any saving throws it makes against the spell or effect increases by 2. For example, if a fireball is about to detonate in a 20-foot radius around you and other creatures, you can use focused blast to redirect the full force of the fireball only to that creature. The target makes its saving throw as usual, but the original DC is increased by 2. If it fails, it takes an additional 1d6 of fire damage. You must have a clear line of sight to both the caster and the chosen creature. If you do not have a clear line of sight to either of these, the spell fails. This spell does not allow you to target a creature that was not in the original affected area.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 5d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 109 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Focused Image (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 5-foot cube. This image appears at a spot that you can see within range and lasts for the duration. Only one chosen creature can sense this image and it seems completely real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted. You can't create sufficient heat or cold to cause damage, a sound loud enough to deal thunder damage or deafen a creature, or a smell that might sicken a creature. As long as you are within range of the illusion, you can use your action to cause the image to move to any other spot within range. As the image changes location, you can alter its appearance so that its movements appear natural for the image. For example, if you create an image of a creature and move it, you can alter the image so that it appears to be walking. Similarly, you can cause the illusion to make different sounds at different times, even making it carry on a conversation, for example. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it. A creature that uses its action to examine the image can determine that it is an illusion with a successful Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the creature can see through the image, and its other sensory qualities become faint to the creature.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the spell lasts until dispelled, without requiring your concentration.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 2d6 thunder damage plus 1d6 thunder damage for each slot level above 2nd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 109 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Force of Wind (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You create a strong wind from a point of your choice within range, forming a 60-foot long, 10-foot wide, and 20-foot tall line that blows in the direction of your choice for the duration. Each creature that starts its turn in the line must make a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet in the direction of the wind and be knocked prone. Any creature standing in the line must spend an extra 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves in the direction against the wind. The gust also disperses gas or vapor and extinguishes unprotected flames such as candles or torches in the area, while protected flames like lanterns dance wildly and have a 50% chance of being extinguished. As a bonus action, you can change the direction of the wind or move the starting point of the wind.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 7d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 109 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Gale Gate (HB)
Granite Body (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a one-inch cube of granite)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Earth)

spell.name: Gravity Seal (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a diamond worth at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You greatly increase the effect of gravity on a creature that you can see within range. The target creature is not prevented from taking actions, but using its movement, an action, or a bonus action requires a herculean effort, causing the creature to take 2d12 force damage and suffer one level of exhaustion for each action taken. In addition, attacks that deal bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage deal double damage to the creature. For the duration of the spell, at the start of each turn, the target creature may make a Strength saving throw, and if successful, it is free from the effects of the spell for that turn, but it still retains all exhaustion levels gained from previous failures. If the target's Strength score is 10 or less, it automatically fails the saving throw.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone and deals 14d6 acid damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 110 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Ground Wave (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You stomp the ground with incredible force, creating a massive shockwave that travels through the earth. Each creature in contact with the ground and within a 90-foot cone from you is pushed back in the opposite direction from you. They are pushed away until they leave the area of the spell. Each creature that is moved in this way must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they fall prone and take 1d8 bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet they were pushed away. Creatures that succeed on the saving throw take half damage and are not knocked prone, but still are pushed away from you.
Elemental Flux: With your next elemental surge, you stomp the ground. All creatures in a 30-foot radius circle centered on you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw taking 11d6 bludgeoning damage and being knocked prone on a failed save.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 110 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Gust Fantasy (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a pinch of rice powder)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You alter the appearance of a number of willing creatures equal to your Wisdom modifier, all of which must be within a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range. You decide how they look, including height, weight, facial features, tone of voice, hair length, coloring, and distinctive features, if any. They can resemble a member of another species, although none of their statistics change, but you can choose one racial trait to grant to the transformed creatures. They also cannot resemble a creature of a different size, and their basic shape remains the same; if you are bipedal, you cannot use this spell to become quadrupedal, for example. At any time during the spell's duration, the affected creature can use its action to revert its appearance to normal, ending the effect on it.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 5d6 thunder damage plus 1d6 thunder damage for each slot level above 3rd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 111 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Harm Liberation (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a cup of water)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Water)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You purify a creature you touch, removing all afflictions upon it. If the creature is asleep, it awakens, and all wounds are removed, restoring the target to full hit points. The water also removes any diseases, curses, or conditions of charmed, frightened, paralyzed, or stunned. In addition, if the target is in the prone condition, it may use its reaction to stand up. Also, the creature gains 70 temporary hit points for 1 minute.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 14d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 111 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Healing Blast (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You unleash a burst of pure water at an allied creature, restoring 9d8 hit points and removing the charmed, blinded, or deafened conditions.
At Higher Levels: When you cast using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you increase the healing value by 1d8 for each level above 4th.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 7d6 cold damage plus 1d6 cold damage for each slot level above 4th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 111 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Healing Drops (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You harness the regenerative properties of the water element to restore 1d6 + Wisdom modifier hit points to a creature that you can see within range. If the amount healed exceeds the creature's maximum hit points, the excess value can be converted into temporary hit points for the next minute.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals cold damage, and on the damage roll, consider any result of 1 or 2 as 3.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 111 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Healing Rain (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You create a magical rain at a point of your choice within range, healing all creatures of your choice in a 20-foot cube centered on that point. You heal 4d8 hit points, which you can distribute as you see fit among the creatures in the area (minimum of 0 hit points per creature). This spell has no effect on undead or constructs. All creatures within the area of the spell become wet as if they have been bathed with 3 gallons of water.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 5d6 cold damage plus 1d6 cold damage for each slot level above 3rd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 111 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Healing Storm (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You manifest a large storm infused with the healing energy of water essence, covering an area of 20-foot cube. This storm heals up to 50 hit points, distributed as you wish among creatures within the area. Creatures healed by this spell are also cured of non-magical diseases and the blinded, deafened, and poisoned conditions at the cost of 5 hit points per effect from the storm's healing limit.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 8d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 111 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Healing Tempest (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You conjure a great storm imbued with the healing power of water essence, covering a 20-foot cube area. When you cast the spell and at the beginning of each turn for the duration, the storm heals up to 100 hit points, distributed as you choose among creatures within the area. Creatures healed by this spell can also be cured of non-magical diseases and the blinded, deafened, and poisoned conditions at the cost of 10 hit points from the healing limit of the storm per effect. This magic does not affect undead or constructs. Each of your turns, the amount of healing power of the tempest returns to 100 during the spell's duration.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone and deals 14d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 112 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Heat Vision (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a ruby worth at least 10 gp)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Fire)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You touch a willing creature to grant it the ability to see heat and discern objects and creatures through this vision. For the duration, that creature has darkvision out to a range of 90 feet.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 2d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 112 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hell Dragon Eye (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
Upon casting this spell, your eyes glow with an eerie light. At the start of each of your turns, you may choose any number of creatures you can see. Each one must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you. A creature frightened in this way must use its actions to move as far away from you as possible via the safest available route, unless it can't move. If it moves to a spot that is at least 60 feet away from you, it is no longer frightened. If the creature can't move, it must make another Wisdom saving throw at the end of its turn. On a failed save, it falls unconscious until it takes damage or until someone uses an action to awake it. A creature that was already frightened by this spell and is targeted again, it makes the saving throw with advantage.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 10d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 112 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hellfire Gaze (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a lump of coal)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
Your eyes convey the horrors of the creatures' worst nightmares. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and become frightened for the duration. While frightened by this spell, a creature must take the Dash action and move away from you by the safest available route on each of its turns, unless there is nowhere to move. If the creature ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to you, the creature can make a Wisdom saving throw. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 5d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 112 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Holy Stream (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a cup of holy water)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You choose a creature within range and create a blessed water current from your hands that purifies it. You can remove up to four of the following afflictions that may be affecting the target: one level of exhaustion, blinded, charmed, deafened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, one curse (including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item), any reduction in one of the target's ability scores, and an effect that reduces the target's maximum hit points.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 10d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 113 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Homing Spark (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Lightning
You condense the energy of lightning in your hand and gain the ability to shoot lightning bolts at your enemies. With a bonus action, you can make a ranged spell attack and shoot a bolt of lightning at a creature within range. On a hit, the creature takes 10d8 lightning damage and must make a Constitution saving throw, becoming stunned for the next minute on a failed save. A stunned creature can repeat the Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the condition. Attacks against a creature wearing metal armor, wielding metal weapons, or carrying large metal objects are made with advantage.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 80-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 14d6 lightning damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 113 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hurricane (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You can accelerate the wind to create a tornado that affects a cylinder with a 60-foot radius and 200-foot height centered on a point of your choice within range. Creatures that start their turn or enter the area, except for the caster and three creatures of their choice, must make a Strength saving throw or be sucked into the tornado. Flying creatures in the area must make the Strength saving throw with disadvantage, and flying creatures within 30 feet of the tornado must make a Strength saving throw to avoid being sucked into it. Unattended objects and items are also sucked into the tornado. Flying creatures can make another Strength saving throw, with disadvantage, at the beginning of their turn, freeing themselves from the effects until the start of their next turn. Creatures that are sucked into the tornado are pulled towards the center of the cylinder and lifted 40 feet in the air each turn. They are trapped in the tornado for the duration, considered incapacitated with a speed of 0. Buildings in the area take 20 points of bludgeoning damage at the start of your turns. If their hit points are reduced to 0, they are turned into debris and also sucked into the tornado. When the spell ends, each creature and object that was caught in the tornado is thrown 100 feet away in a random direction. To determine the direction, roll a d8 and assign a direction to each die face. If a creature is thrown in the same direction as debris from a building, it must make a Dexterity saving throw to avoid being crushed under the rubble. A creature hit by debris takes 5d6 bludgeoning damage.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 11d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 113 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Ignite Seal (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (gold, copper and ruby dust of a total value of at least 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Fire)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You carefully create a powerful glyph on a surface, which can be a wall, table, throne, book cover, shield, etc., as long as it has a surface area of 1 foot in diameter. If you choose a surface that conceals the glyph, the spell will not take effect. The glyph is apparent and bright and clearly magical. While you cast the spell, you must set a trigger that you desire for the glyph's effect, such as touching or stepping on the glyph or the approach of a certain type of creature within 5 feet of it. When the glyph is activated, choose one of the following effects:
Disintegration: The glyph destroys the object or location where it was placed, heating it to the point of disintegrating everything within a 10-foot radius around it. A creature that touches the object or is in the area being disintegrated must make a Constitution saving throw, reducing its hit points to 0 and turning to dust on a failure or taking 6d8 radiant damage and 6d8 fire damage on a success.
