Self-Destruction: The glyph self-destructs in a powerful explosion. All creatures within a 60-foot radius must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 40d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Eternal Heat: The glyph emits a lot of heat. For the next 1001 days, any creature that starts its turn or enters a space within 30 feet of the glyph takes 4d8 fire damage, and creatures that are beyond these 30 feet but within 60 feet of the glyph must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d8 fire damage on a failure.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone and deals 14d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 113 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Inner Fire (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You ignite the inner flames of a number of willing creatures within range, up to your Wisdom modifier. The affected creatures, which may include yourself, become immune to the frightened condition and any unarmed or melee weapon attacks they make deal an additional 1d4 fire damage.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals fire damage, and on the damage roll, consider any result of 1 or 2 as a 3.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 114 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Intertwining Roots (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Plant
Roots sprout from the ground, grabbing onto creatures within a 20-foot square centered on a point within range. For the duration, these roots turn the area into difficult terrain. A creature that enters or starts its turn in the area and fails a Strength saving throw is restrained until the end of the spell. The creature can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself. When the spell ends, the conjured roots vanish.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals poison damage and requires a Constitution saving throw.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 114 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Lava Floor (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Lava
You unleash a dangerous spell that covers a 30-foot square area with a thin layer of lava, making it difficult terrain. Any creature that enters or starts its turn in the area must make a Constitution saving throw or suffer the consequences.4 On a failed save, the creature takes 3d6 fire damage and has its walking speed, or any other speed that relies on contact with the ground, halved for a minute or until it takes an action to cool its feet outside the area. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and avoids the speed reduction.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 10-foot-radius circle centered on you. All creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. Targets take 7d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 114 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Leaf in the Wind (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
With a whisper, you surround yourself with the energy of Air, becoming one with the wind. For the spell's duration, you can move with incredible speed and agility, allowing you to use the Dash or Disengage action as a bonus action.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals thunder damage, and on the damage roll, consider every 1 or 2 as a 3.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 114 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Lesser Link (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Spirit
You create a spiritual connection with up to 3 willing creatures within range. For the duration of the spell, while a connected creature is within 15 feet of another, they have telepathic communication and you can use a reaction to grant advantage on an attack roll or saving throw of a connected creature within range.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals force damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 114 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Life Back (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a flask of holy water, which the spell consumes)
spell.classes: School: Transmutation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Water)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You purify the body of a dead creature with sacred waters, resurrecting the creature. The creature cannot have been dead for more than 10 days and revives with 1 hit point, free of any curses or conditions (except for exhaustion, which only recovers 1 level) that affected it at the time of its death. This spell does not restore lost parts and does not affect undead or constructs, or creatures whose soul does not want to resurrect, or creatures that have died from old age.
Elemental Flux: You can imbue your next elemental surge into the revived creature, which gains 5d8 temporary hit points lasting for 8 hours.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 114 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Life Swap (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You forge a powerful connection between two willing creatures of your choice within range, causing them to instantly swap their current hit points and maximum hit points. If a creature's hit points drop to 0 as a result of the swap, that creature falls unconscious and begins dying. In addition to the hit point swap, the two creatures can choose to exchange any of the following effects, provided both creatures agree:
Condition Swap: Choose one of the following conditions: blinded, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, or stunned. If one of the creatures is currently affected by the chosen condition, that creature is cured of the condition and the other creature becomes affected by it. This exchange lasts until the spell ends, at which point the conditions return to the originally affected creature.
Skill Swap: The two creatures choose one skill, tool, or language proficiency each and exchange the chosen proficiency for the duration of the spell.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the duration of the condition swap and skill swap increases by 1 extra hour for each slot level above 3rd.
Elemental Flux: If used for the duration of the spell, but before any other spell is cast, your next elemental surge deals 5d6 cold damage or grants 5d6 temporary hit points to creatures of your choice within the area of effect.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 114 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Life Synchronization (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You synchronize the energy fluids of 4 willing creatures, which you can see within range, to heal them. You can transfer any amount of hit points between them, as long as each one has at least 1 hit point and does not exceed their maximum hit points. At the end of the synchronization (hit point transfer), you heal an additional 2d8 hit points from each of the creatures that have transferred hit points (taken damage or regained hit points). Undead and constructs are not affected by this spell.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 8d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 115 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Lightning Arrester (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Lightning
You energize a target creature, forcing it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes restrained and vulnerable to lightning damage for the duration of the spell. The restrained creature can use an action to make another Constitution saving throw, and if it succeeds, it breaks free from the restraint.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals lightning damage and affects a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 115 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Lightning Burst (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a pair of magnets)
spell.text:
Element: Lightning
You empower up to six willing creatures within range, imbuing them with the power of lightning. Until the spell ends, the targets gain the following benefits:
• Their speed is doubled. • They gain a +2 bonus to their AC. • They have advantage on Dexterity and Strength saving throws. • Their melee attacks deal an extra 1d8 lightning damage. • They gain an additional action on each of their turns, which can only be used to take the Attack action (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 50-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 11d6 lightning damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 115 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Lightning Displacement (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Lightning
You gain the ability to teleport up to your speed, but every 5 feet of distance teleported spends 5 feet of your speed for the current turn (you must have at least 10 feet of movement remaining for the spell to work). You must teleport to a destination within your line of sight. For example, you could teleport to the top of a wall, but not to a point in mid-air unless you have a means of flight. When you teleport, you leave behind a trail of lightning that damages any creatures in its path. All creatures in a line between your starting point and your destination must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, they take 5d8 lightning damage. On a successful save, they take half as much damage.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 50-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 8d6 lightning damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 115 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Lightning Tunnel (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a piece of light fabric)
spell.text:
Element: Lightning
You weave together strands of lightning into an invisible tunnel that can be up to 120 feet long and 5 feet in diameter. The tunnel remains stationary once created and lasts for the duration of the spell. Each round, the first creature or object that enters one end of the tunnel becomes an invisible and silent electrical charge that instantly travels through the tunnel to the other end, reforming in its original form. Creatures and objects that pass through the sides of the tunnel take no damage and are unaffected by the spell. However, when a creature is transported through the tunnel, any other creatures standing inside the tunnel's area take 2d6 lightning damage as the energy arcs through them. This damage has no visible source, and creatures that are transported through the tunnel are immune to it.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the length of the tunnel increases by 30 feet and the diameter increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 5d6 acid damage plus 1d6 acid damage for each slot level above 3rd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 115 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Lightning Wall (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a copper wand worth at least 30 gp)
spell.text:
Element: Lightning
You create a barrier that looks like a net of pure energy. The barrier does not need to be sustained and can float in the air. It occupies an area of 60 feet in length, 20 feet in height, and one inch in thickness. Any creature within the area where the barrier was created must make a Strength saving throw, suffering 3d8 lightning damage on a failure and being thrown 10 feet in a direction of your choice. On a successful save, the target takes only half the damage and is expelled into the nearest free space, as chosen by the affected creature. The barrier magnetically affects an area of 15 feet around it. Inside this area, attacks made with metal weapons have disadvantage, and creatures made of metal or wearing metal armor move at half speed (moving 1 foot costs 2 feet of speed). A creature can attempt to pass through the barrier but must succeed on a Strength saving throw. On a failure, it takes 3d8 lightning damage and is thrown back 10 feet in a prone condition. On a success, it takes half damage and passes through the barrier.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 50-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 10d6 lightning damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 116 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Made of Lava (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Lava)
spell.text:
Element: Lava
You encase a touched creature with a barrier of lava, shielding it from attacks. For the duration, the creature is resistant to fire and cold damage. If the creature takes bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage from a creature adjacent to it, the barrier spews lava at the attacking creature, which must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 3d8 fire damage. Optionally, the creature protected by the barrier can take a reaction upon being hit by a melee attack to make the barrier explode, causing every creature within 15 feet, except itself, to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, creatures hit by the barrier take 6d8 fire damage. After using this reaction, the spell ends.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 11d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 116 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Magic Precipitation (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You create a magical precipitation area in a 20-foot-radius, 30-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range that you can see. Creatures within the rain area gain advantage on saving throws against spells and resistance to magical damage. Additionally, any spells that are in effect on the area or on creatures of your choice that are in or enter the area are dispelled. Furthermore, when a spell is cast within the area or affects any space within it, you can choose to absorb the magic to fuel the precipitation. The absorbed magic has no effect, and the precipitation then heals your chosen allied creatures within the rain for an amount of hit points equal to twice the level of the spell slot used to cast the absorbed spell. The healing effect of this magic does not affect undead or constructs.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone and deals 14d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 116 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Magma armor (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Lava)
spell.text:
Element: Lava
You touch a willing creature wearing medium or heavy armor and enchant their armor with the heat of magma. For the duration, every time another creature hits the target of the spell with a melee attack, it must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d10 fire damage.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 2d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 116 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Magma Chamber Heat (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (an obsidian worth at least 1000 gp)
spell.text:
Element: Lava
You heat up a circular area with a 100-foot radius centered on a point within range. The temperature in this area becomes unbearable. Creatures that enter or start their turn within it must make a Constitution saving throw or take 4d8 fire damage, or half as much on a success. Flammable materials not carried or held burn up in an instant. In addition, creatures that start and end their turn within the area must make another Constitution saving throw or suffer a level of exhaustion. Creatures wearing heavy armor make this saving throw with disadvantage. Creatures immune to fire are immune to the effects of this spell, and creatures resistant to fire automatically pass the saving throws.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone and deals 12d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 117 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Magma Glow (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a piece of charcoal)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Lava)
spell.text:
Element: Lava
You touch an object, causing it to emit a faint glow that is imperceptible in bright light and difficult to notice in dim light conditions. The object can be any item (magical or not) of your choosing, weighing no more than 10 pounds. While the spell is active, you can sense the location of the object as long as it is within 240 feet of you, even if it is behind walls, doors, or other barriers. The location is communicated to you as a general sense of direction (e.g., "northwest") and distance (e.g., "close", "very far"). You can dismiss the spell at any time as a bonus action, causing the glow to fade immediately. The DC to notice the glow is equal to your spell save DC. Only a creature specifically looking for the glow can use its action to make a Wisdom (Perception) check against this DC to notice the glow. The object can be hidden inside fabrics or other objects, making it impossible to directly see the glow, without hindering your ability to sense its location.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the weight limit of the object increases by 10 pounds for each slot level above 1st.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals fire damage and gains an extra 1d6 fire for each slot level above 1st.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 117 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Magma Servant (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a pinch of obsidian dust)
spell.text:
Element: Lava
You summon a lava spirit that appears in an unoccupied space within range. It takes physical form to serve you, using the stat block of an azer, but appearing as a humanoid creature made of magma. The magma servant is an ally and recognizes your allies as allies. It shares your initiative, acting immediately after you, but has its own turn. The magma servant will obey your commands to the best of its ability. You can give simple course of action commands, such as attacking a target or running in a direction, as a free action. If you want to give a command that requires a longer phrase, you must use a bonus action. If the creature completes the action and cannot hear or receive new commands, it will take the Dodge action to preserve itself to the best of its ability.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 5d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 117 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Mantle of Water (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a drop of water)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You surround a target creature within range with a thin layer of clean water, granting it the ability to breathe underwater and a swimming speed of 40 feet. While the spell lasts, the creature gains the following benefits:
• Immunity to the effects of non-magical fire, gasses and liquids, including harmful acids, poisons and smokes.
• You have advantage on saving throws made against harmful magic gasses (such as cloudkill and stinking cloud effects, and the breath weapons of some dragons).
• Resistance to fire and acid damage.
• Immunity to being grappled and restrained.
The water mantle continuously replenishes the water the creature breathes and is covered in, filtering out harmful substances. In addition, the creature can use a bonus action to end the spell and unleash a water gust attack against a creature within 60 feet. The water gust requires a ranged spell attack roll and deals 3d10 bludgeoning damage on a hit.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 7d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 118 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Marble Skin (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Earth)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You touch a creature and a seismic wave emanates from your fingers, enveloping it and imposing a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is restrained and its skin begins to turn to marble. On a success, the creature is unaffected. A creature with its skin turned to marble must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the creature accumulates three successes, it is free from the condition and the spell ends. If it accumulates three failures (including the initial one), the creature becomes petrified.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 10d6 acid damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 118 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Mass Curse of Flames (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
All creatures that you can see within range must make a Wisdom saving throw or be affected as if they were targets of the curse of flames spell cast with a 9th-level slot.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot radius circle centered on you and deals 14d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 118 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Massive Inflammation (HB)
spell.components: V, M (bee's wings or a drop of honey)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You ignite the spirit of a group of people by suggesting a course of action (limited to up to two sentences). You magically influence, at your discretion, a number of people equal to up to three times your proficiency bonus. The creatures must be able to see and hear you clearly and the suggestion must be phrased in a way that makes the course of action reasonable. Igniting them to do something against themselves, such as self-flagellation, negates the effects of the magic. Creatures that can't be charmed are immune to this effect. Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they pursue the course of action you described to the best of their ability. For the duration of the spell, the inflamed creatures are immune to the frightened condition and will continue to carry out the proposed course of action. If the activity can be completed in a shorter time, the spell ends when the target finishes what was requested.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 7th-level spell slot, the duration is 10 days. When you use an 8th-level spell slot, the duration is 30 days. When you use a 9th-level spell slot, the duration is a year and a day.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge creates a burst around you, which affects a 20-foot radius circle centered on you and deals 10d6 fire damage plus 1d6 fire damage for each slot level above 6th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 118 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Material Illusion (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You choose the stat block of a non-spellcaster creature with a CR of up to 12, then you create a dense air replica of that creature, within an unoccupied space that you can see within the spell's range. The replica uses all the statistics of the creature it duplicates, except that any damage dealt by the replica is psychic damage. However, the replica can only damage or affect in other ways creatures that failed the saving throw. It acts on its own turn and on its own initiative, but you can control its course of action. If the replica's hit points are reduced to 0, the spell ends, and it immediately dissipates.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone and deals 14d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 118 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Melt Rock (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a drop of mercury)
spell.text:
Element: Lava
You choose an area of rock and change its internal heat, melting it into lava. You affect a 40-foot cube of rock within range. The lava flows and ignites any flammable materials it touches. A creature that touches the lava takes 2d8 fire damage. If a creature has a limb or body part covered by lava, it takes this damage at the end of its turns for the next minute or until it takes an action to remove the lava. A creature that is partially covered by lava has its speed halved and takes 4d8 fire damage for the next minute or until it takes an action to remove the lava. A creature that is completely covered by the lava is restrained, takes 8d8 fire damage, and requires 2 actions to completely remove the lava, but if it spends only 1 action, it is still considered to be partially covered by lava.
At Higher Levels: When you use a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you melt an extra 20-foot cube of rock per level above 5th.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 8d6 fire damage plus 1d6 fire damage for each slot above 5th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 119 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Metal Barrier (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a pure metal ingot worth at least 100 gp)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You hold the piece of metal used in this spell and it disintegrates into metallic sand, swirling around a willing creature within range of the spell, granting them protection. A creature enveloped in this protection gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage, is considered to have half cover, and when subjected to a Dexterity saving throw to take half damage from an effect, they take no damage on a success. Once during the duration, as a bonus action, you can change the target of the spell to another willing creature within range and at least 30 feet from the original target.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 40-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 10d6 acid damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 119 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Mirage Mirror (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You conjure a duplicate of yourself from the energy of the wind, which appears in an unoccupied space within the spell's range. The duplicate has an AC equal to yours and one hit point, and it performs saving throws and ability checks as it were you. The duplicate does not move, but any action you take can also be simulated by the duplicate at your choice. A creature can make a Wisdom (Perception) check against your spell save DC to realize that the duplicate is not real. The duplicate disappears if you use a bonus action to dismiss it, if you move more than 60 feet away from it, or when its hit points are reduced to 0.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals thunder damage, and on the damage roll, consider every 1 or 2 as a 3.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 119 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Mineral Sculpt (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You manipulate earth and rocks to create objects within range. If using fresh earth (sand, clay, and general soils), you can create a large or smaller object (contained within a 10-foot cube, or eight connected 5-foot cubes), such as statues, bridges, passages, pillars, doors, etc., as long as there is enough earth to do so. If using metal or solid rock,.you can create only a medium or smaller object (contained within a single 5-foot cube), such as a weapon, idol, crown, etc. The objects are usually solid, without gears or hinges, and generally of good quality. However, the quality of objects, such as jewelry, statues, or any that require artistic or professional knowledge, may vary depending on your proficiency or the availability of the right tools.
At Higher Levels: When you use a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, you can make a huge object of fresh earth (contained within a 15-foot cube, or twenty seven connected 5-foot cubes) or a large object of solid material (contained within a 10-foot cube, or eight connected 5-foot cubes). When you use a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can mold a gargantuan object of fresh earth (contained within a 20-foot cube, or four connected 10-foot cubes, or sixty-four connected 5-foot cubes).
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 7d6 acid damage plus 1d6 acid damage for each slot level above 4th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 119 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Mirror Object (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a small polished gemstone)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Water)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You touch a non-magical object weighing no more than 5 pounds, causing its surface to become reflective like a mirror. During the spell's duration, the object captures all images and sounds within a 30-foot radius, as long as they are reflected on its mirrored surface. When the spell ends, the object reverts to its original state, and the captured images and sounds are retained, hidden within it. To access the captured images and sounds, the object must be submerged in any body of water large enough to completely cover it. Once the object is submerged, the captured images and sounds are displayed on the surface of the water and can be viewed as if you were on the location. The size of the water surface determines the size of the image, with a larger surface allowing for more details to be seen. The object can store the captured images and sounds for up to 1 year. However, once the object is submerged and the images and sounds are accessed, or if it is removed from the water before the end of it, the information is lost and cannot be recovered. The quality of the captured images and sounds depends on the quality of the object used as a mirror. Polished and well-maintained objects capture clearer and sharper images and sounds, while dirty and worn objects can produce blurred and distorted images and sounds.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the weight limit of the object increases by 5 pounds for each slot level above 2nd.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 2d6 cold damage plus 1d6 cold damage for each slot level above 2nd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 119 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Mountain Crush (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Earth)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You deliver a powerful shoulder strike to your target. Make a melee spell attack against it. On a hit, the creature becomes stunned for 1 minute. On a critical hit, the primary target is violently pushed back 15 feet and can hit a creature of your choice as a secondary target, provided it's in the same direction and range as the primary target was pushed. In this case, the secondary target is also stunned. Oozes are immune to this spell. Each stunned target must make a Constitution saving throw at the end of its turns. If they succeed, the stunned condition ends.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone and deals 12d6 acid damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 220 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Move like Air (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You and a number of willing creatures equal to your Wisdom modifier that you can see within the spell's range have their speed doubled, gain a +2 bonus to their AC, have advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and gain an additional action on each of their turns. The action can only be used to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 40-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 11d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 220 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Move Like Water (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You shield a willing creature of your choice that you can see within range, with the energy of the water element. For the duration, the creature does not provoke opportunity attacks, regardless of the action or movement they perform. Additionally, it gains a +1 bonus to AC.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals cold damage, and on the damage roll, consider any result of 1 or 2 as 3.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 220 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Mystical Flux (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a drop of water)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Water)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You touch another creature and send a wave of mystical energy to it, causing it to instantly recover a spell slot of the same level as this spell or lower. You can't use this spell on yourself.
At Higher Levels: When casting this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, it equally increases the spell slot level that can be recovered by the target.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 2d6 cold damage plus 1d6 cold damage for each slot level above 2nd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 221 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Natural Stream (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a drop of holly water)
spell.text:
Element: Water
A stream of water purifies the creature touched by it. You can remove one condition afflicting the target between blinded, charmed, deafened, paralyzed and poisoned.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 2d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 121 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Overcharge Lightning (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a pair of magnets)
spell.text:
Element: Lightning
You discharge energy that affects the nervous system of all creatures of your choice in a 20-foot square within range. A creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw, becoming paralyzed on a failure. On a successful save, the creature's nervous system is fatigued and on its next turn, it cannot use one of its actions, be it an action, bonus action, or movement. A paralyzed creature can make another saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the condition on a success but still being affected by the action restriction on its next turn. If your concentration is broken, paralyzed creatures are released but still suffer from the action restriction. A creature that has passed the action restriction is freed from the effects of the spell.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 80-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 12d6 lightning damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 121 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Overgrow (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Plant
You energize all your allies within a 30-foot-radius circle from a point of your choice within range with an aura of vitality. The aura grants each ally 4d8 temporary hit points, a bonus of +1 to their AC, and advantage on Strength and Constitution checks and saving throws for the next minute. If creatures are grappled, restrained, or poisoned and need to make a roll to escape the condition, they can use their reaction to make the check or saving throw at the moment you cast this spell.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 7d6 poison damage and requires a Constitution saving throw.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 121 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Petrify Nerves (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a small, straight piece of iron)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You freeze the nerves of a creature of your choice within range of the spell. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for the duration. This spell does not affect undead or constructs. An affected creature can make a saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 8d6 acid damage plus 1d6 acid damage for each slot level above 5th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 121 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Pour the Past (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You use the energy of the water to make it swirl counterclockwise and see the events that occurred in the location where you cast the spell. The manifested image shows the events that occurred within a 30-foot radius of the location where you cast the spell. You see all the events as if you were above the location observing them. You can quickly observe all events that occurred up to 1 year ago or choose a specific moment to observe and follow it for the duration of the spell. Talk to your GM to define what details are perceptible from your point of view and the way you witnessed the events unfold.
Elemental Flux: After the spell's duration, you can create an ice statue of a creature or object of up to medium size that you saw with your next elemental surge. The statue lasts 1 minute and then melts into snowflakes that disappear.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 121 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Primordial Pass (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Ritual Caster, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Air)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You create a bridge made of air that connects one point to another, provided there is no object obstructing the path between these points. When a creature enters this point, the winds carry them from one point to the other on gentle breezes. The crossing lasts only 1 minute and is completely safe, with air currents protecting creatures during the journey. The path can be used by both sides, but the path is only open in one direction at a time while the crossing is taking place.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone and deals 10d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 122 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Prodigium Duplication (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a small piece of clay)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Earth)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You touch a non-magical object weighing up to 10 pounds, causing it to briefly glow with an earthy light before splitting into a number of identical copies equal to twice your proficiency bonus (minimum of 4). Each copy has the same appearance, weight, and physical properties as the original object, including any markings or inscriptions. However, the copies created by this spell bear an unnatural aura that makes them immediately identifiable as magical constructs to anyone who inspects them closely. As a result, it is very difficult to use these copies to deceive others or pass them off as genuine items. The copies created by this spell last for 1 hour or until they are destroyed, at which point they crumble into a pile of dust. You can end the spell prematurely by using a bonus action to cause one or more copies to disappear. The copies created by this spell are mundane objects and do not possess any magical properties. Additionally, they cannot be used to create copies of items made of precious metals or gems, as their unique physical properties cannot be replicated by this spell.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the weight limit of the object increases by 10 pounds for each slot level above 2nd.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 2d6 acid damage plus 1d6 acid damage for each slot level above 2nd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 122 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Purging Flames (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a drop of oil)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You immolate a hostile undead or extraplanar creature (devil, demon, penumbral, etc.) that you can see within the range of the spell. The target creature must make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, nothing happens, but on a failure, it is consumed by flames and it is destroyed, leaving only ashes behind. If the target is an undead whose soul is trapped elsewhere (such as a lich and its phylactery or an undead created from a body whose soul was trapped), it must make a second Charisma saving throw. On a failure, it is immolated and destroyed. If the target is extraplanar, it returns to its home plane and must make another Charisma saving throw. On a failure, it is immolated and destroyed.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 14d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 122 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Quicksand (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You transform a 30-foot-radius circular area, centered on a point within range, into quicksand. The area becomes difficult terrain and every creature within it at the time of casting, or that starts its turn or enters the area, must make a Strength saving throw. On the first failure, the creature begins to sink in the sand and becomes restrained. On the second failure, the restrained creature sinks even further, becoming incapacitated. On a third failure, the incapacitated creature sinks completely into the sand and becomes stunned. Each time a creature succeeds on a Strength saving throw, it regresses one step in the number of failures, becoming unburied if it reaches 0 failures. A creature that is completely buried by this spell cannot breathe, is under total cover, has disadvantage on Strength saving throws, and suffers 3d10 bludgeoning damage for each failure it has on Strength saving throws. Failures beyond the third are added to the number of failures. Another creature that is adjacent to a buried creature and is not under any effect of the spell can use an action to help dig out the buried creature. The creature must make a Strength ability check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees the creature from the spell's effects, but on a failure, it is pulled into the area of effect and counts as having failed a Strength saving throw against the spell. A creature within the area of effect that tries to help another does so with disadvantage on the Strength check. When the spell ends, all creatures that are restrained suffer 3d10 bludgeoning damage, all creatures that are incapacitated suffer 6d10 bludgeoning damage, and all creatures that are stunned suffer 10d10 bludgeoning damage. Objects and creatures that are dead or die from the final damage remain buried, while surviving creatures are expelled from the ground. Objects that are not being held are automatically buried, and structures within the area suffer 30 bludgeoning damage when the spell is cast, and at the beginning of each turn that you maintain the spell.
Elemental Flux: With your next elemental surge, you stomp the ground. All creatures in a 30-foot-radius circle centered on you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, taking 14d6 bludgeoning damage and being knocked prone on a failed save. Each creature within the quicksand area that is hit by this elemental surge fails in the saving throw automatically, counting as a failure for the spell too.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 122 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Rally of Agility (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
Up to four willing creatures are surrounded by strong winds that assist their movements. While under this effect, the affected creatures have their Dexterity scores increased by 6 (up to a maximum of 26), and they have advantage on any attacks or ability checks that involve Dexterity. A creature under the effect of the spell is immune to the grappled, restrained, prone and paralyzed conditions. Additionally, attacks against the target are made with disadvantage.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone and deals 10d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 123 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Regenerating Cocoon (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Plant
You create a large flower at a location of your choice within range that can envelop a willing creature, up to Huge size, that is within 15 feet of it. The creature is immune to damage, has its movement reduced to 0, and is incapacitated while inside the flower. The creature can leave the flower at any time. While inside the flower, the creature is healed for 2d8 + its Wisdom modifier at the start of each of its turns. The creature also removes 1 level of exhaustion every 2 turns spent inside the flower and gets rid of one curse, disease, or poison for every 4 turns spent inside it. If the creature remains inside the flower for the full duration of the spell, it regains any lost limbs. The flower automatically dissipates, ending the spell's effects if the creature exits it, you lose concentration, or the flower's hit points are reduced to 0. The flower has an AC of 15, 80 hit points, is resistant to non-magical damage, and immune to poison damage.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 11d6 poison damage and requires a Constitution saving throw.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 123 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Regrowth (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (fruits, flowers, seeds, rare herbs, dragon parts and jewelry that weigh more than the target and are worth at least 25,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Plant)
spell.text:
Element: Plant
You touch a body or a body part that still exists of a creature that has been dead for no more than 500 years. The part of the creature and any material components turn into a seed that automatically sprouts into a plant, generating a bulb where the body of the creature is recreated and restored. After 8 hours, the bulb opens, and the creature is revived, healed of all wounds, any poisons removed, all diseases cured, and freed from any curses that afflicted it when it died. The spell fully restores the body, replacing missing parts. If the body of the creature no longer exists, the casting time doubles, and you must speak the creature's name, take an object that belonged to it, and, as part of this spell, bring its spirit, which will be mixed with the material components when forming the seed. If the spirit is not available, the spell fails, and no components are expended. The spell can even provide a new body if the original no longer exists. The creature then appears in an unoccupied space you choose within 5 feet of the plant.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge, instead of dealing damage, imbues the creature's body with an elemental soul, leaving it immune to diseases and curses for a number of days equal to 10d6 days.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 123 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Revert Life Flux (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a large bowl of holly water)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Water)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You harness a sacred water flow to reverse a loss of life in a body, resurrecting the creature. The creature cannot have been dead for more than 100 years, cannot be an undead or construct, must have a soul available for return to the body, and cannot have died of old age. At the end of the spell, the target creature returns to life with all wounds healed, regaining any lost limbs and free of any conditions, but it receives 4 levels of exhaustion. Additionally, the resurrected creature returns free of any non-magical diseases or curses. Magical diseases and curses will resume their effects if they are not removed beforehand. The flow of magic is very heavy and until a long rest is finished, you will receive two levels of exhaustion and have a -4 reduction to all attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.
Elemental Flux: With your next elemental surge, you imbue the creature targeted by this spell and yourself with elemental energy, granting both 6d8 temporary hit points that last for 10 hours.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 123 (Homebrew)

spell.name: River Protection (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You surround a willing creature that you can see within range with the healing energy of life, protecting its body from harm. The target creature cannot be a construct or undead. The target regains 4d8 hit points and gains immunity to the blinded, charmed, frightened, paralyzed, and poisoned conditions for the duration of the spell. If the creature was already affected by any of these conditions before the spell was cast, the effects are suppressed (but not ended) until the spell ends.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 10d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 124 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Rock Stubborn (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
For the duration, a willing creature that you can see within range and while in contact with the earth or rock, gains resistance to lightning and psychic damage, and has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 5d6 acid damage plus 1d6 acid damage for each slot level above 3rd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 124 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Sacred Fruits (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (seeds from 3 different trees)
spell.text:
Element: Plant
You plant the seeds and grow a small, glowing plant that produces four fruits. If not harvested within 1 hour, the fruits wither and disappear. Once harvested, the fruits last for 24 hours before disappearing. A creature that consumes one of the fruits can remove any curses or frightened conditions from itself, and for the next 24 hours, it is sufficiently nourished, it gains 2d10 temporary hit points, becomes immune to the poisoned and frightened conditions, and has advantage on Wisdom saving throws.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you create one additional fruit for each level above 6th.
Elemental Flux: With your next elemental surge, you imbue the fruits with elemental energy. Before eating a fruit, a creature must speak a magical word. If a creature eats a fruit without speaking the word, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 7d6 poison damage and is poisoned for 24 hours. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and gains no benefits from the spell.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 124 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Saving Seed (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Plant
You create a small plant that bears a single fruit the size of a cherry. If eaten, as a bonus action, the fruit serves as a full meal, instantly restores all of your hit points, and cures any disease, blindness, deafness, poisoning, and all levels of exhaustion. The magical fruit lasts for 3 days and disintegrates after this time. Due to the amount of energy expended in casting this spell, you need a recharge time and can only use this spell after 7 days.
Elemental Flux: With your next elemental surge, you imbue the fruit with elemental energy. Before eating the fruit, a creature must speak a magical word. If a creature eats the fruit without speaking the word, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 10d6 poison damage and is poisoned for 10 days. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and gains no benefits from the spell.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 124 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Scrape The Sky (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You create up to 4 pillars of 30 feet in height each occupying a 5-foot square space within the spell's range. A creature in the space where the pillar appears must make a Dexterity saving throw or be thrown 30 feet into the air, landing prone in an adjacent space to the pillar. If succeeded, the creature does not take damage but must choose an adjacent space to position itself. With a bonus action, for the next minute, you can topple the pillars in a direction of your choice, each occupying a 30-foot long and 5-foot wide line. All creatures within the line of the pillar's fall must make a Strength saving throw, taking 1d8 damage and becoming restrained on a failure. A restrained creature can use its action to make a Strength (Athletics) check against your spell save DC, freeing itself on a success. Huge or larger creatures are immune to this effect. If you do not topple the pillars, they will dissipate after 10 minutes.
Elemental Flux: With your next elemental surge, you stomp the ground. All creatures in a 20-foot radius circle centered on you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, taking 7d6 bludgeoning damage and being knocked prone on a failed save.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 124 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Seismic Quake (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a gem worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You take a gem in your hand that crumbles when using the spell. When its fragments touch the ground, you generate an earthquake with a radius of 120 feet and an epicenter of your choice within range, causing the entire area of effect to become difficult terrain. At the time of casting and at the beginning of each turn of a creature within the area, it must make a Dexterity saving throw, becoming prone on a failure. Creatures that are concentrating on other spells must also make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC, losing concentration on a failure. Structures within the area suffer 60 bludgeoning damage when you cast the spell, and at the beginning of each of your turns that you maintain concentration. If they reach 0 hit points, they collapse and may cause damage to creatures beneath them, at the GM's discretion. In addition, at the GM's choice, other effects may occur, such as fissures or shifting ground. When a fissure is formed, it can have a depth of 3d4x10 feet and a width of 1d4x5 feet. Creatures in the area of the fissure must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they fall into the fissure, or choose one of the edges to remain on the surface on a success. When the ground shifts, at the GM's discretion, a block may rise or sink 1d4x10 feet, taking everything on it along and causing structures it cuts through to collapse.
Elemental Flux: With your next elemental surge, you stomp the ground. All creatures in a 30-foot-radius circle centered on you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, taking 14d6 bludgeoning damage and being knocked prone on a failed save.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 125 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Shield of Overlife (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You create a thin layer of water over your body, making it impossible for a creature to perceive you except through magical means. This magical layer provides you with 60 temporary hit points. Whenever a creature attacks you in melee, your shield drains bodily fluids from the attacker, causing the creature to suffer 3d8 + your Wisdom modifier necrotic damage, and you add the same amount of temporary hit points to the pool generated by this spell. As a bonus action, you can make the shield drain a creature within 5 feet, causing 3d8 + your Wisdom modifier necrotic damage, and you gain the same amount of temporary hit points. The shield has no limit on temporary hit points and retains its temporary hit points for 1 hour after the spell ends.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot radius circle centered on you and deals 14d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 125 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Skin of Embers (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a pinch of charcoal powder)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You attempt to ignite the skin of a creature you can see within range of the spell. The target creature must have some type of skin or leather covering its body and, if so, must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, its skin or leather transforms into incandescent material like live coals. On a success, nothing happens. A creature with fiery skin gains resistance to fire damage and vulnerability to all other types of damage. It can move in extremely high temperature environments but suffers one point of exhaustion each turn it is in extremely cold temperatures (below 32 °F). Touching or coming into contact with this creature causes 1d6 fire damage and automatically ignites any flammable materials. The creature with ember skin can repeat the Constitution saving throw at the end of its turns, and if it succeeds three times, it is free from the effects. If you maintain concentration for 1 minute while the creature is under the effects of the spell, its skin will permanently be transformed into embers, making this effect permanent. This effect can be removed only by a wish or similar powerful spell.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 40-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 8d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 126 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Sky Blessing (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a feather of an eagle)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Air)
spell.text:
Element: Air
A touched willing creature receives the blessing of winds, acquiring exceptional speed. The creature gains a flying speed of 180 feet, becomes immune to being prone, has advantage on Dexterity ability checks and saving throws, ranged attacks against it have disadvantage, it does not provoke opportunity attacks when moving, and is not affected by any gas-related effects. In addition, the target can spend 5 feet of its movement to automatically escape non-magical restraints.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 8d6 thunder damage plus 1d6 thunder damage for each slot level above 5th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 126 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Sky Walker (HB)
spell.text:
Type: Air
By casting this spell, you grant the ability to walk on the winds to a creature you touch, giving it a flying speed equal to its walking speed. At the end of the spell, a creature that is still in the air descends safely to the ground.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 5d6 thunder damage plus 1d6 thunder damage for each slot level above 2nd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 126 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Spectral Vision (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Spirit
For the duration of the spell, you are able to see the spiritual aura of all creatures within sight, even when they are invisible. Each type of creature has a specific type of aura that you can see, but you cannot differentiate between them (e.g., an orc and a human have the same aura because they are both humanoids). Additionally, as a bonus action, you can focus on seeing the Ethereal Plane, gaining vision of it until the end of your next turn.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 2d6 force damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 126 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Speed Waltz (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
Three willing creatures you can see within range are propelled by the wind. You can move them up to 30 feet in any direction you choose. This movement ignores difficult terrain and does not provoke opportunity attacks, but if a creature is stopped in mid-air, it falls as normal and takes falling damage.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 2d6 thunder damage plus 1d6 thunder damage for each slot level above 2nd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 126 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Sphere of M'Cel (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a pearl worth at least 100 gp)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You expel all the air from a 30-foot radius sphere centered on a point within range, and the area remains airless for the duration. All creatures within the area at the time of casting who require air to breathe must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they suffer one level of exhaustion, as the air is sucked out of their lungs. Furthermore, creatures inside the sphere are subject to the normal rules for suffocation. They can hold their breath for a number of minutes equal to 1 + their Constitution modifier (minimum of 30 seconds), and then survive a number of rounds equal to their Constitution modifier (minimum of 1 round) before they drop to 0 hit points and begin dying. In addition, the airless area becomes difficult terrain for the duration of the spell, and any creature that starts its turn within the area or moves into it on its turn must make a Constitution saving throw, suffering one level of exhaustion on a failed save. Creatures within the area are considered deafened, and no sound can propagate within it. Additionally, creatures inside the sphere are immune to thunder damage, and no thunder damage can be caused inside the sphere.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the radius of the sphere increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 5th.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 8d6 thunder damage plus 1d6 thunder damage for each slot level above 5th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 127 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Spirit Form (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Spirit
You and up to five other willing creatures within range take a step on the border of the Ethereal Plane, entering the region that overlaps with the current plane. While on the border, you can move in any direction as if you had a flying speed equal to your walking speed. You can still see and hear the original plane, but everything appears grayed out and muffled, and you can't see anything beyond 60 feet. For the duration, as a bonus action, a creature under the effect can choose to move from the Ethereal Plane to the original plane and vice versa. The creature returns to the same mirrored location it was occupying on the plane it left (if it exits the Ethereal Plane in midair and without a flying speed, the creature will fall). While on the Ethereal Plane, you can only affect and be affected by other creatures on that plane. Creatures not on the Ethereal Plane cannot perceive you or interact with you, unless a special ability, magic item, or spell has given them the ability to do so. You can move through objects that are not on the Ethereal Plane, ignoring any objects and effects from the plane you originated from. When the spell ends, you and your allies return to the plane of origin in the same location you occupied at the time. If you occupy the same space as a solid object or creature when this happens, you will immediately be moved to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you were moved. This spell has no effect if you cast it while on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that does not border it, such as one of the Outer Planes.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 14d6 force damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 127 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Spiritual Air Beasts (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You summon up to five air spirits that take the form of beasts with a challenge rating of 1 or lower. They appear in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. A spirit disappears when it reaches 0 hit points or when the spell ends. They are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for each of them, which act on their own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you issue no commands, they defend themselves against hostile creatures, but they take no other actions. The GM can provide the statistics of the beasts.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 20-foot-radius circle centered on you and deals 10d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 127 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Spiritual Fading (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Spirit
For the next minute, at the end of your turns, if you are not grappled, you can choose to enter the Ethereal Plane, or when already there, return to the Material Plane. When you return to the Material Plane, you choose an unoccupied space within 20 feet of where you disappeared to reappear. While on the Ethereal Plane, you can see and hear the Material Plane, which appears in shades of gray, and you can't see anything there that is more than 60 feet away. You can only interact with and be affected by other creatures on the Ethereal Plane. Creatures that are not on the Ethereal Plane cannot perceive you or interact with you unless they have any means to do so.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 5d6 force damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 127 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Spiritual Flame (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (ruby dust worth at least 50 gp)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Fire)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
A black, blue or red translucent flame, equivalent in brightness to a torch, springs forth from an object that you touch. The flame is clearly magic and creates no heat and doesn't use oxygen. A spiritual flame can be covered or hidden but not smothered or quenched. With the object in hand, you can end the spell as a bonus action to emit a burst of intense light in a 30-foot radius around you, blinding all creatures within that area for 1 minute unless they succeed on a Constitution saving throw. You can choose to cast this spell consuming the ruby dust. If you do, spiritual flame is permanent and you cannot end its effect.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 2d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 128 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Spiritual Hex (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Spirit
You curse a creature within range, causing malevolent spirits to jinx its actions and turn its failures into catastrophes. For the duration of the spell, any time the target misses an attack, fails a saving throw, or fails an ability check, it suffers additional harm or negative effects. Whenever the target misses an attack roll or saving throw, it takes 3d8 necrotic damage. If the target fails an ability check, it suffers the worst possible negative consequence appropriate to the situation, as determined by the GM.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage from the missed attack rolls and saving throws increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 7d6 necrotic damage plus 1d6 necrotic damage for each slot level above 4th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 128 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Spiritual Immunity (HB)
spell.classes: School: Abjuration, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Spirit)
spell.text:
Element: Spirit
For the duration, a willing creature you touch becomes immune to acid, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, poison, psychic, and thunder damage.
At Higher Levels: If you cast this spell using a 9th-level spell slot, you can also affect an additional willing creature within 5 feet of the spell's initial target.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 12d6 force damage plus 1d6 force damage for each slot level above 8th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 128 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Spiritual Travel (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a mithral key encrusted with gems worth at least 500 gp)
spell.text:
Element: Spirit
You and up to six willing creatures within range of are transported to another plane of existence. You must have an object that is linked to the destination plane, have previously been to the plane, or have one of the willing creatures have been to the plane. If you do not meet at least one of these requirements, all of you vanish for one round and then reappear in the same location in a stunned condition until the end of your next turn. You can also use this spell to send a creature from another plane back to its home plane. You must make a melee spell attack against the creature. On a hit, the creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be sent back to its home plane in a random location.
At Higher Levels: If you cast this spell using an 8th-level spell slot or higher, you can affect two additional creatures for each level above 7th.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 40-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 11d6 force damage plus 1d6 force damage for each slot level above 7th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 128 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Spiritual Vision (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a glass sphere the size of an eye)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Spirit)
spell.text:
Element: Spirit
You touch a willing creature that gains truesight for the duration of the spell. In addition, it can see the ethereal plane and secret doors with a range of 120 feet.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 40-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 10d6 force damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 129 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Static Field (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Lightning
You create a 20-foot radius sphere centered on a point within range, charged with static electricity. Creatures that move within the area take 1d4 lightning damage for every 5 feet they move.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 2d6 lightning damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 129 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Steal Oxygen (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You suppress the air from the lungs of a creature within range that you can see. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw, receiving 3 levels of exhaustion and becoming paralyzed on a failed save. For the duration, at the start of each of its turns, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw, suffering an additional 3 levels of exhaustion on a failed save or ending the effects on itself on a success. This spell has no effect on creatures that do not need to breathe, such as constructs or undead.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone and deals 14d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 129 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Stone Hand (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a small, flexible wire)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Earth)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You touch a creature, causing a collection of stones to gather and form an arm of stone that connects with the target's torso. The stone hand can hold and manipulate objects just like a regular hand, but it is not capable of attacking or performing somatic components for spells. The target gains the following benefits while the spell is in effect:
• The target can wield a two-handed weapon or a versatile weapon with two hands, while still using the third hand to hold a shield or perform any other action that would normally require a free hand.
• The target can use the third hand to hold a card or other small object in a way that is hidden from view, granting advantage on Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) checks made to cheat at games of chance.
• The target can use the third hand to manipulate objects that would normally require the use of both hands, such as picking a lock or disarming a trap. If using three hands, the target gains advantage on any Dexterity checks made to interact with objects in this way.
• The target can use the third hand to retrieve or stow an object that is normally out of reach, such as a potion on a high shelf or a weapon on the ground. The hand can reach up to 10 feet away from the target and can manipulate objects weighing up to 5 pounds. It must still use the appropriate action to do so.
• The target can use the third hand to perform simple tasks, such as carrying a torch, holding a door open, or carrying a small object while using both of its regular hands for something else.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 2d6 acid damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 129 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Stone Heart (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a gemstone worth at least 50 gp)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Earth)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You touch a creature and grant it protection against death effects for the duration of the spell. When casting the spell, you can use one to four gems, each worth at least 50 gp, which will fuse with the target. For each gem consumed at the time of casting, the target has one use of the following effects:
• When reduced to 0 hit points, instead it remains at 1 hit point.
• When subjected to an effect that would kill it instantly without dealing damage, the effect is negated.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 7d6 acid damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 129 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Stone Imprisonment (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You create hands of stone on the ground to grasp any creatures of your choice inside a 10-foot-radius area within range. Each creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be restrained by one of the hands. A creature restrained remains in this condition until the spell ends or the hand grasping it is destroyed. Each hand has an AC of 16, 5 HP, is resistant to slashing and piercing damage, and immune to poison and psychic damage. If a hand reaches 0 hit points, it is destroyed.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 2d6 acid damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 130 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Stone Shield (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
When you are hit by an attack or forced to make a Dexterity saving throw, you can take a reaction to raise a shield of stone from the ground that protects you from attacks. Until the beginning of your next turn, you gain a +4 bonus to your AC and Dexterity saving throws, including against the triggering attack.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals acid damage, and on the damage roll treat every 1 or 2 as a 3.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 130 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Stone Sphere (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a glass sphere and a gravel of similar size)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
A sphere of stone envelops a creature or object of Large size or smaller within range of the spell. A non-voluntary creature must make a Dexterity saving throw, becoming trapped within the sphere on a failure. The stone sphere is magically reinforced, preventing any magical movement from inside to outside or vice versa. No sound passes through the stone, and those inside cannot see anything outside the sphere, including by magical means. They are under total cover and cannot be harmed by attacks and effects originating from outside. The sphere has an AC of 17 and 75 hit points, is immune to poison and psychic damage, and has resistance to any other type of damage except for damage from the disintegrate spell. It can support any amount of weight inside or on top of it and weighs around 1000 pounds, plus the weight of what is inside. Creatures capable of carrying or pushing the weight of the sphere can do so.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 7d6 acid damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 130 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Subtle Influence (HB)
spell.text:
Type: Fire
You manipulate the mind of a creature within range, subtly influencing their emotions and behavior. Choose one of the following effects to apply to the target.
• Aversion: The target develops a strong aversion to a creature or object of your choice, becoming slightly nauseous by its presence and avoiding it when possible.
• Change Mood: You can influence the person's mood, causing them to feel overall happy, angry, sad, or agitated, affecting their behavior accordingly. This will not force a creature to attack or stop a combat, but will influence its overall mood.
• Attraction: The target feels a strong attraction to a creature or object of your choice, seeking to approach and interact with it in a non-threatening manner. This effect does not end combat, but may make the target less likely to harm or kill the object of their attraction, not putting itself in danger while doing so.
• Anger: The target feels anger toward a creature or object of your choice, seeking to harm it or break it. In combat, if an enemy is chosen, the target may make this enemy a preferred target. The creature will not attack or do anything that would be against its principles or would endanger itself The target must make a Wisdom saving throw to resist the spell's effect. If the target fails the saving throw, they are affected by the chosen effect for the spell's duration.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell's duration increases to 2 hours (3rd level), 4 hours (4th level), 8 hours (6th level), 24 hours (8th level), or 7 days (9th level).
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 2d6 fire damage plus 1d6 fire damage for each slot level above 2nd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 130 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Summon Flame Dragon (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a ruby worth at least 500 gp)
spell.text:
Element: Fire
You summon a dragon spirit that manifests in the form of a dragon. The spirit's physical form uses the stat block of a young brass dragon, but its only breath attack available is Fire Breath. It has its own turn and place in initiative, and will assist you to the best of its ability for the duration. When you cast this spell, choose between red, brass and gold, and the spirit will take on the appearance of that type of dragon. If the dragon is reduced to 0 hit points or you lose concentration, the spell ends and the dragon disappears.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 11d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 131 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Summon Plant Servant (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a handful of leaves, mud and sticks)
spell.text:
Element: Plant
You conjure a plant servant. You choose an area rich in vegetation that fills a 10-foot cube within range. The vegetation joins together and forms a plant creature of CR 5 or lower in a space up to 10 feet from the point of origin. The plant obeys you to the best of its ability and acts after you in the initiative order. You can give simple action commands, such as attacking a target or running in a direction, as a free action. If you want to give a longer command, you must use a bonus action. If you lose concentration, the plant servant will continue to follow the last command until it completes it. If the plant servant completes its action and cannot hear or receive new commands, it will take the Dodge action and protect itself as best it can. You can use an action to regain concentration on this spell a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus. The plant disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge infuse your plant servant with energy, allowing it to use an action to cast the elemental surge cantrip as if it were you, only once during the spell's duration, dealing 5d6 poison damage and requires a Constitution saving throw
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 131 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Sweet Dreams (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You cause a creature within your line of sight to immediately fall asleep and have wonderful dreams. The creature can make a Wisdom saving throw to resist. If failed, it falls asleep. If the creature sleeps until the end of the spell's duration, the sleeping creature recovers as if it had taken a long rest. A creature affected by the effects of this spell can only be targeted again after completing a normal long rest. If cast before this condition is met, the spell has no effect. You can only benefit from another long rest after 24 hours.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge can create a thin layer of water around the creature, granting it 7d6 temporary hit points for 10 minutes.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 131 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Symbiosis (HB)
spell.classes: School: Transmutation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Plant)
spell.text:
Element: Plant
You touch a willing creature and create a symbiotic plant that intertwines with it. When the plant attaches to the target, it nullifies any poisoned condition it had before the spell.
