While attached to the plant, the target creature is immune to the poisoned condition and poison damage, and if it takes a short rest in a location illuminated by sunlight, all hit dice it spends during the rest heal the maximum value, and each die also adds the target's proficiency bonus to it. If the target takes any fire damage, the plant dies automatically.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 5d6 poison damage and requires a Constitution saving throw.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 131 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Terracotta Army (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You conjure spirits of the earth that take the physical form of terracotta soldiers. You can conjure up to 16 soldiers and each one uses the stat block of an animated armor. You have a telepathic link and all soldiers listen to your orders mentally. They all act after you in the initiative order and will follow your orders as best as they can. You can give simple course of action commands, such as attacking a target or running in a direction, as a free action. If you want to give a command the size of a sentence, you must use an action. If you lose concentration, the soldiers will continue to follow the last command until it is completed. If the soldiers complete the designated action and cannot obtain new commands, they will use the Dodge action to preserve themselves as best as possible. At the end of the spell, all the spirits turn to dust.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals acid damage and affects a 45-foot cone. Each terracotta soldier inside the area won't take this damage, absorbing the acid instead. If a terracotta soldier is reduced to 0 hit points, it will explode in acid, forcing all creatures within 5 feet of it to make a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 acid damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 131 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Through the Water (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You join your hands and focus, enveloping you and up to six willing creatures within 5 feet of you in a brilliant purple water. All the targets must be fully submerged in any liquid at the time of the casting, and they are teleported to another water source within 1 mile, through which you and the targets emerge. The destination is chosen by you and must be a known location.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 11d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 132 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Thunderburst (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You clap your hands, generating a 30-foot cone of thunderous shock. All creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw or become deafened. A creature deafened by this spell is also incapacitated. At the beginning of each turn, a deafened creature can make a Constitution saving throw to end the spell's effect on itself on a success. Undead, constructs, and creatures naturally deafened or already under the deafened condition are immune to its effects.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 7d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 132 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Tidal Investigation (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
During the spell's duration, you can use a bonus action to analyze an area within 60 feet of you, detecting any blood drops, small objects, and weapons hidden within the area. Whenever you detect blood drops, make an Intelligence (Investigation) check to determine what you have uncovered. You learn the following information based on the results of your check:
• 10 or more: You determine if any creature spilled blood and how many there are and their types.
• 13 or more: You determine the severity of injuries, knowing if each creature is dead or alive.
• 16 or more: You determine any weaknesses of the creature, if any.
In addition, for the duration of the spell, you gain advantage on your first attack each turn you make against a creature whose blood you analyzed for weaknesses, even if that creature has none.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals cold damage, and on the damage roll, consider any result of 1 or 2 as 3.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 132 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Tide of Bubbles (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You unleash a burst of bubbles in a 30-foot wide, 80-foot long line, affecting all creatures within. Creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw or be engulfed in a bubble. Once trapped, a creature is considered underwater, incapacitated, and vulnerable to lightning damage. Its speed is reduced to 0, except for swimming speed. At the start of each of its turns, the trapped creature can make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (its choice). On a successful save, it is no longer incapacitated but remains trapped inside the bubble. A creature can escape the bubble by destroying it. Each bubble has an AC of 17 and 30 hit points, is immune to acid, bludgeoning, cold, fire, lightning, poison, and psychic damage, and has resistance to non-magical slashing and piercing damage. Creatures outside the bubble can attack it, but if the attacker is Huge or smaller and uses a melee attack, it must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the attacking creature becomes trapped in another bubble that emerges from the first. If you lose concentration, the spell ends and all bubbles are destroyed. Creatures with a swimming speed automatically escape the bubble.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 11d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 132 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Torrential Rain (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Ritual Caster, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Water)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You are able to control the water element around you, harnessing the clouds to create a downpour in an area, affecting the entire spell area. During the casting and up to two hours after, the rain continues to lash the region, increasing about 5 cubic centimeters of water every 10 minutes of rain. The excessive amount of water will cause rivers to flood regions, entire lands to flood, and other effects from torrential rains. All creatures in the rain, except you, have their movement halved. Each turn a creature remains in the area, it must make a Strength (Athletics) check or become prone. All natural and magical fire sources up to 3rd level are extinguished and the area becomes lightly obscured for all creatures except you.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 11d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 132 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Tracing Thunder (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Lightning
When you cast this spell, you channel electricity into your feet. Until the end of your turn, your speed is doubled and you can take the Dash action as a bonus action. When you move, you do not provoke opportunity attacks and leave a trail of electrical energy in the spaces you pass through until the end of your next turn. A creature that enters one of the spaces through which you left a trail of energy must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 3d6 lightning damage and is restrained until the end of its turn.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 7d6 lightning damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 133 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Tread Tremor (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
You stomp the ground, creating a directed seismic wave in a cone, turning the entire affected area into difficult terrain. Each creature in the cone must make a Strength saving throw or be pushed 10 feet back, take 2d4 bludgeoning damage, and fall prone. Walls and structures in the area, depending on how well-built they are, may be weakened or destroyed at the GM's discretion.
Elemental Flux: With your next elemental surge, you stomp the ground. All creatures in a 10-foot radius circle centered on you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d6 bludgeoning damage and being knocked prone on a failed save.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 133 (Homebrew)

spell.name: True Levitation (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
24 hours You concentrate all your control over the force of the element, causing the power of the wind to lift entire locations and relocate them to another place. The spell affects a circular area of land within range with a half mile radius and 100 feet in depth, lifting the block of land, including everything it carries above it. Once in motion, the block moves 30 feet per turn, uninterruptedly in the last commanded direction. With a bonus action, you can make the block start moving, change the direction of movement, or stop it. The block of land can only move through spaces it can fit into. If the block has its movement interrupted by an object or volume of land equal to or larger than it for more than 1 minute, the spell ends. Once the spell ends, the block descends slowly until it lands on the ground. Once during the spell's duration, you can grant control (concentration) to another creature that has spellcasting. You can create a block of land that levitates permanently by casting the spell on the same block for a year and, on the last day, defining a creature that will receive control over its movement without needing to concentrate or have spellcasting abilities. If the creature dies or is willing, you can change the control to another creature with a new casting of this spell.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone and deals 10d6 thunder damage. If cast against the levitated block of land, it takes no damage but is pushed 90 feet in a direction of your choice.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 133 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Tunneling Arms (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a few hairs from a mole)
spell.text:
Element: Earth
Your limbs morph into powerful claws. For the duration of the spell, you gain a burrowing speed equal to your walking speed. If you come across pure rock terrain, you can burrow at half your speed. When you burrow, you leave behind a tunnel that can only be passed through by creatures of your size or smaller. The claws can also be used to attack, you are considered proficient with them and they deal slashing damage equal to 1d8 plus your Strength or Dexterity modifier.
Elemental Flux: With your next elemental surge, you stomp the ground. All creatures in a 10-foot-radius circle centered on you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw, taking 4d6 bludgeoning damage and being knocked prone on a failed save.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 134 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Unflinching Stream (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You imbue a willing creature with the essence of water. For the duration, the target gains 2d6 temporary hit points and advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws. If the target loses all these temporary hit points, they still retain the advantage on their saving throws for the duration.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals cold damage and affects a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 134 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Veil of Invisibility (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (an eyelash encased in gum arabic)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Air)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You change the air properties around a creature you touch, making it invisible to one other creature within 60 feet. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is also invisible as long as it remains on their person. If the target attacks or casts a spell, the spell ends.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can choose one additional target to be invisible to the same creature for each slot level above 2nd.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals thunder damage, affects a 20-foot line that is 5 feet wide, and deals an extra 1d6 thunder damage for every 2 spell levels used above 1st.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 134 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Visions from the Image (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You create an illusion of an object or person, similar to the major image spell. Additionally, while within the spell's range, you can see and hear as if you also occupies the space of the created image.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 7d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 134 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Volcano (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Lava
You create a volcano from a point on the ground within range. From the moment you cast the spell, a volcano begins to rise from the ground, growing in four distinct stages. Each round you maintain concentration on this spell, it produces additional effects of the next stage.
First stage: When you cast the spell, a 20-foot-radius sphere around the point you choose becomes extremely hot, and the ground becomes scorching hot. Creatures that enter or start their turn within the area must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 6d8 fire damage on a failure or half as much on a success.
Second stage: The ground within the area of the first stage rises, transforming the area into difficult terrain and beginning to release toxic gasses. All creatures within the area and a further 20-foot radius must make a Constitution saving throw or become poisoned due to the toxic gasses. Additionally, the effects of the first stage increase to a 40-foot radius.
Third stage: The raised area explodes in lava, and all creatures in the 20-foot-radius sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they take 8d8 bludgeoning damage and 3d8 fire damage, are thrown 20 feet in the opposite direction, and become coated in lava. A creature coated in lava takes 8d8 fire damage at the start of each of its turns for the next minute, or until it is doused with 3 gallons of water or uses an action to clean itself. In addition, the area affected by the second stage increases to a further 20-foot radius, and the area affected by the first stage increases to a total of a 60-foot radius.
Fourth stage: A 20-foot-radius pool of lava forms at the center of the volcano, rising to a height of 40 feet and beginning to launch magma spheres into the surrounding area. The magma spheres strike three locations of your choice within 100 feet of the center and affect a 10-foot-radius circle. Creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw or take 10d8 fire damage and become coated in lava on a failed save, or half as much damage and no coating on a successful save. Buildings within the affected area are destroyed, with the extent of the damage determined by the GM.
If you lose concentration on the spell, the volcano retreats, returning one stage per round, and ending after it retreats from the first stage.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a sphere of a 30-foot radius centered on you. All creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 14d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 134 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Waive Magic (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a cup of water)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You use water to neutralize spells. With an action, you can target a creature, an object, or a magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. Each spell of 4th level or higher requires you to make a Wisdom ability check (DC 10 + spell level), ending the spell on a success. When you cast this spell as a reaction, you can interrupt the casting of a spell, but you must still make the Wisdom ability check regardless of the spell's level, with disadvantage.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a 4th-level spell slot or higher, you automatically end spells of up to the same level as the slot used. When cast as a reaction, you gain a +2 bonus to the Wisdom ability check for each slot level above 3rd.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 5d6 cold damage plus 1d6 cold damage for each slot level above 3rd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 135 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Wall of Lava (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a hand-sized flame and ruby powder worth at least 50 gp, which the spell consumes)
spell.text:
Element: Lava
You sprinkle ruby dust over the flames, causing a barrier of pure magma to rise from the ground. You can choose the shape of the barrier to be either a straight line with a length of 60 feet, a height of 15 feet, and a width of 5 feet, or a circle with a diameter of 20 feet, a height of 15 feet, and a width of 5 feet. The barrier blocks the line of sight. When the barrier appears, every creature within its area is pushed to one side of it, as chosen by you, and must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d8 fire damage and being covered in lava on a failure, or taking half damage and not being covered in lava on a success. A creature that is covered in lava takes 2d8 fire damage at the end of each of its turns until it is either doused in at least 3 gallons of water or takes an action to clean itself. A creature can move through the barrier, but it is a painful and slow process. For every 1 foot moved, the creature must spend an additional 4 feet of movement. A creature that chooses to cross becomes covered in lava and must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 6d8 fire damage on a failure or half as much damage on a success.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 10d6 fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 135 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Wall of Spirits (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a translucent crystal or gem)
spell.text:
Element: Spirit
You create a translucent barrier at a point within range, for the duration. The barrier floats in the air and does not require support, appearing in any position you choose, either horizontal, vertical, or angled. It has a thickness of 1 inch and you can make it semi-spherical or spherical with a radius of up to 15 feet, or flat, creating up to ten panels of 10-foot by 10-foot, which must be contiguous. If the barrier appears in a creature's space that cannot pass through it (see below), the creature is pushed to one side of your choice. When creating the barrier, you can set one creature type or alignment (good, evil, chaotic, lawful) that cannot pass through the barrier. All other creatures or alignments can pass through it normally, but the chosen type cannot pass through the barrier in any way. Attacks and spells of the chosen creature type are neutralized by the barrier, which is indestructible for them, even affecting the Ethereal Plane. A creature that is not of the chosen type can choose not to pass through the barrier, so it can walk on the barrier as if it were solid ground, but once it does, it cannot go back on that decision.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 40-foot line that is 5 feet wide and deals 8d6 force damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 135 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Water Blessing (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You aid a willing creature. Whenever the target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw. Additionally, once during the spell's duration, the target can choose to roll another d20 for an attack or saving throw and use the new result, ending the spell.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 2d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 135 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Water Body (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a cup of clean water)

spell.name: Water Essence (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
You have the power to control water in all its forms within range, creating a variety of magical effects.
• You can alter the color and scent of up to 1 cubic foot of water, making it seem clean or dirty.
• You can instantly chill, heat, evaporate, or freeze any liquid with a volume of up to 1 cubic foot, as long as no creatures are inside it.
• You can create an instant and harmless sensory effect, such as the sound of rushing water, crashing waves, falling rain, a light mist, or even dampening or drying a surface. The effect must fit within a cube with a side length of 1 foot.
• You can drain moisture from a small object or plants, such as a flower or fruit, extracting clear, potable water.
You can dismiss these effects with an action.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 136 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Water Restoration (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
A creature absorbs the ambient water to restore itself. The creature regains 50 hit points at the moment of casting and an additional 50 hit points at the start of its turns until the spell ends. Additionally, if the target remains under the effect of the spell for an entire hour, the water can permanently regrow lost limbs and body parts, exactly as the original. If the target is in contact with a large body of water, such as lakes, rivers, and seas, the effects above are accelerated. If the target remains in contact since the end of its last turn, it regains all its hit points at the start of its next turn, and any lost limbs and other body parts are fully restored if the target remains in contact for at least 1 minute.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 45-foot cone and deals 12d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 136 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Water Tentacle (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Water
Your arms are enveloped in water, forming semi-solid tentacles. While the spell remains in effect, you can freely control the tentacles, increasing your reach by 15 feet, including for touch spells, and you are able to manipulate and drag objects as if they were your own hands. The tentacles can be used to attack, requiring a melee spell attack to hit and dealing bludgeoning damage equal to 1d10 + your Wisdom modifier. Additionally, as a bonus action, you can grapple a creature hit, which will also be restrained until the grapple ends (the difficulty to escape equals your spell save DC). While holding a creature, you cannot use the tentacles to obtain the other benefits of this spell.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 10-foot radius circle centered on you and deals 2d6 cold damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 137 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Whiff (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You blow air and create a whirlwind that travels in a 30-foot long, 5-foot wide, and 15-foot high line, stopping at walls or solid structures. All creatures in the area, Large or smaller, must make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, the creatures are pushed 20 feet in a direction of your choice. If their movement is obstructed by an obstacle, they suffer 1d6 bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet moved. The gust also disperses gas or vapor, extinguishes unprotected flames, and causes protected flames, such as lanterns, to dance wildly, with a 50 percent chance to be extinguished.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals thunder damage, and on the damage roll, consider every 1 or 2 as a 3.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 137 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Wind Cover (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Touch Spells, Elementalist (Tanares), Elementalist (Tanares) (Air)
spell.text:
Element: Air
A creature you touch becomes invisible until the start of the next turn. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target's person and the target can act normally.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge creates a burst, which affects a 10-foot radius circle centered on you and deals 2d6 thunder damage plus 1d6 thunder damage for each slot level above 2nd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 137 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Winds of Time (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You breathe the winds of time over a creature or object, altering the temporal flow by accelerating its natural processes. When you cast the spell, you can choose to accelerate the aging process of the targeted creature or object by a factor of twenty, causing it to experience twenty times the normal effects of the passage of time. For example, you could cause a plant to grow to maturity in a matter of hours, accelerate the onset of a poison to take effect within seconds instead of minutes, or end a magical effect with a minimum duration of one minute instantly. This spell can age a touched creature or object by 20 days in one. If the target is a creature, it can make a Constitution saving throw to avoid this spell's effect on a success. Note that the spell only affects natural and mystical processes related to time, and does not affect the actions or abilities of the target. The spell can be used to affect a wide range of effects related to time, but the GM should determine the limits of the spell's effects and the potential consequences of using it in creative ways.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge affects a 30-foot cone and deals 8d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 137 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Windstorm Point (HB)
spell.text:
Element: Air
You create a whirlwind at a location of your choice. The point remains stationary for the duration. Whenever a creature other than you comes within 5 feet of it, that creature must make a Strength saving throw or be flung away in the direction established by you when the spell was cast. The creature is thrown 40 feet high and 20 feet away in that direction.
Elemental Flux: Your next elemental surge deals 7d6 thunder damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 137 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Bioluminescent Secretion (HB)
spell.components: (1 Insanity Point, +1 point per 5 feet added to cone size)
spell.text:
As a bonus action, you can generate a glowing, bioluminescent substance. This secretion illuminates an area within 5 feet with dim light and leaves a luminous trail wherever you move. After 8 hours, the mutation ends, and the emission fades entirely. You can prematurely end this mutation to discharge a larger, slick amount of secretion over a 15-foot cone on the ground, rendering it as difficult terrain. All creatures within this area must pass a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature that either enters or ends its turn in this area must also make the Dexterity saving throw. The area stays illuminated and slippery for 8 hours. You can augment the size of the cone, up to a maximum of +25 feet, gaining 1 extra Insanity Point for every additional 5 feet. Your total Insanity Points cannot exceed the limit when enlarging the area. Also, you cannot use this power if you are at your Insanity Point maximum.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 150 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Dark Energy (HB)
spell.components: (1 Insanity Point, +1 per extra point of damage (see below))
spell.text:
Before rolling for an attack, you can, as a free action, infuse your weapons with dark energy. Until the start of your next turn, your next successful attack deals an additional 1d6 necrotic damage. Before the attack roll, you can choose to gain extra Insanity Points to bolster this damage, as long as the total points gained per use of this mutation do not exceed your madwalker level. For each extra Insanity Point you gain, add 1 to the necrotic damage roll. The total Insanity Points gained cannot exceed your current Insanity Point limit, except when using this mutation without gaining extra points. For instance, a 3rd-level madwalker using this power can gain 1 Insanity Point to deal an extra 1d6 necrotic damage, 2 points to deal 1d6+1, or 3 points to deal 1d6+2. However, she couldn't gain 4 points, as it would exceed her level. If the current Insanity Point total is 10 and the limit is 12, she can only gain 1 or 2 points on this power. Once she reaches 12 points, she can still use this power (+1d6) but can no longer increase its damage.
Note: This ability enables a madwalker to rapidly elevate her insanity level if she wishes to reach the Penumbral Shape sooner.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 150 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Elastic Limbs (HB)
spell.text:
With a bonus action, you can distort your limbs, elongating them. For the next 10 minutes, your melee attack reach increases by 5 feet, and your base walking speed increases by 10 feet. If you take bludgeoning damage, you may use your reaction to end this effect and reduce the damage by 2d8.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 150 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Horrid Tentacle (HB)
spell.text:
With a bonus action, you can conjure a grotesque tentacle from your back, extending up to 10 feet. This aberrant limb persists for 1 minute. The tentacle can execute only the following tasks:
• As an action, you can pull, drag, or lift an object or willing creature, or cling onto something. When performing these actions, you can carry twice the weight your Strength normally allows.
• As a bonus action, the tentacle can interact with objects. For instance, it can open or shut containers and doors, utilize keys, activate levers, push buttons, grasp small objects, and other similar tasks, subject to the GM's discretion.
• The tentacle can function as an auxiliary limb, granting you advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) or Strength (Athletics) checks.
• The tentacle can be used as a melee weapon endowed with light and finesse properties. It has a reach of 10 feet and deals 1d10 bludgeoning damage. If you're wielding a weapon in one hand, the tentacle can serve as a second light weapon for two-weapon combat.
• The tentacle cannot wield a shield.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 150 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Penumbral Echoes (HB)
spell.text:
With a bonus action, you can manipulate your vocal cords for 1 minute, granting you the ability to emit sounds otherwise impossible to replicate. You can mimic any sound you've heard, be it from creatures (voices, grunts, growls) or objects (hammer clang, door creak, drops falling). A creature hearing the sound can attempt a DC 18 Wisdom (Insight) check to identify it as an imitation. With an action, you can end this mutation and release a frightful roar that resonates across a 10-foot radius. Each creature within range must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or suffer 2d4 thunder damage and be frightened for 1 minute. An affected creature must attempt a new Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns. Upon success, the effect ceases and the creature becomes immune to it for the next 24 hours.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 150 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Penumbral Gaze (HB)
spell.text:
With a bonus action, you can channel penumbral energy through your eyes, causing them to appear large and ghostly white. For 1 hour, you have the advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on vision. Additionally, you gain darkvision with a range of 60 feet, or double the range if you already have darkvision. With an action, you can end these effects and direct a force blast toward a creature. Make a ranged attack roll against a target within 60 feet of you using your Dexterity modifier and proficiency bonus. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 force damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 150 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Space Distortion (HB)
spell.text:
With a bonus action, you can bend penumbral energy to conjure a small portal, enabling your hands to interact with distant locations. Until the end of your turn, you can manipulate objects or creatures up to 30 feet away and transport small items. While this mutation is active, you can make melee attacks against targets within 30 feet of you. These attacks ignore cover, and you add your Wisdom modifier to the attack rolls.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 151 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Noxious Attack (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Aberrant Arachnid Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Aberrant Arachnid Trail
With a bonus action, you sprout glands in your hands that generate a venom, coating your weapon for 1 minute. Each successful weapon attack deals an extra 2 poison damage and bestows a poison marker on the target (maximum of four markers). Creatures with at least one poison marker must make a Constitution saving throw at the beginning of their turns. On a successful save, they remove all poison markers. On a failure, they suffer 2 poison damage per poison marker.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 151 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Shadow Web (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Aberrant Arachnid Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Aberrant Arachnid Trail
With an action, you can create spiderwebs from your fingertips that last for 1 minute. The webs can stretch up to 60 feet, with varying effects:
• You can launch a web at an object and pull it towards you. If it is heavier than 10 pounds, you must pull it using your own Strength.
• You can affix the web to objects or solid surfaces, granting advantage on Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks when climbing.
• You can use the web to obstruct an area up to 20 feet in diameter between two solid objects; a creature entering the blocked area must succeed on a Strength ability check or become restrained until the end of its next turn.
• You can aim a web at a creature within range. If the creature fails a Dexterity saving throw, it is restrained for the duration of the effect. It can attempt a Strength saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the condition.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 151 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Mind Slash (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Nightmare's Augury Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Nightmare's Augury Trail
With your action, you unleash a surge of psychic power against a creature you can see within 60 feet of you, dealing 3d8 psychic damage. The target makes an Intelligence saving throw to reduce the damage by half. On a fail, the target also has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes until the end of your next turn.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 152 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Psychic Bond (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Nightmare's Augury Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Nightmare's Augury Trail
As a bonus action, you can establish a telepathic bond with an ally within 120 feet of you. The link lasts for 1 hour or until the creature moves beyond range. This bond allows you to communicate with the chosen creature as though engaged in normal conversation. Furthermore, for the duration of the link, both can use the Help action on Intelligence ability checks made even at a distance. Alternatively, this mutation can be used against a hostile creature to access its surface thoughts. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw; otherwise, you discern its emotional state, and it has disadvantage on all attacks against you until your the start of next turn.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 152 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Amphibious Skin (HB)
spell.text:
With an action, you can modify your skin to make it slippery, changing your base AC to 13 + your Dexterity modifier. This grants you advantage on ability checks and saving throws to escape the grappled condition. Additionally, you grow gills on your neck that allow you to breathe underwater, and your limbs are adapted to provide a swimming speed equal to your base walking speed. These effects last for 8 hours.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 152 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Body Shaping (HB)
spell.text:
With an action, you can alter your physical appearance for the next 8 hours. You can assume the form of any humanoid creature within your size category. Other attributes, such as your voice, scent, and mannerisms, remain the same. A creature must succeed on a DC 18 Intelligence (Investigation) check to discern that your appearance is a disguise. If you assume the form of a creature that has charmed or frightened another one, the affected creature is also considered charmed or frightened by you while you maintain this form or until it sees through your disguise. Alternatively, you may use this mutation to enhance your body, granting you 2d6 temporary hit points for 1 minute.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 152 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Penumbral Leap (HB)
spell.text:
As a bonus action, you can disappear into the Penumbral Plane and move instantly, reappearing in a space you can see up to 30 feet away. Alternatively, you can use the Penumbral Leap to get a brief glimpse of the Penumbra from your current position in the Material Plane. Make a Wisdom (Perception) check to gather information about the penumbral environment, creatures, and any other pertinent details you can glean at a quick glance, based on the DC set by the GM.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 153 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Shadow Clones (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, you can create two illusionary copies of yourself made of penumbral energy. They occupy the same space as you and move with you for 1 minute, mirroring your every action and randomly shifting positions around your body, making them indistinguishable from you. For the duration of this mutation, each time a creature targets you with an attack, roll a d20 to determine whether the attack instead targets one of your clones. With two clones, you must roll an 8 or higher. With one clone, you must roll an 11 or higher. A clone's AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier. If an attack hits a clone, it is destroyed. If a creature adjacent to you is attacked, you can take a reaction to confuse the attacker with one of your clones and impose disadvantage on the attack roll, destroying the clone. These are the only ways to destroy a clone, as it ignores all damage and effects. Creatures that don't rely on sight or can see through illusions (such as truesight) are unaffected by this mutation.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 153 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Warped Physique (HB)
spell.text:
With a bonus action, for the next 1 minute, you can distort and enhance your muscles and tendons, giving your legs exceptional strength and flexibility. Your long jump covers a distance equal to your walking speed, and your high jump covers a distance equal to half your walking speed. While this mutation is active, you have advantage on Dexterity (Acrobatics) and Strength (Athletics) checks involving jumps. Alternatively, before making a melee weapon attack, you can use all your leg strength to end this Mutation and augment the damage. On a hit, your attack deals an extra 2d8 damage of the same type of the weapon.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 153 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Pain Toxin (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Aberrant Arachnid Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Aberrant Arachnid Trail
As an action, you emit a toxic blast in a 20-foot cone. Every creature within this cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature is afflicted by the poison. At the start of each of its turns, an affected creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or spend its action writhing in pain. The effect ends when an affected creature succeeds on three (nonconsecutive) Constitution saving throws or uses an action to cleanse itself with fresh water. Creatures immune to poison are unaffected by this mutation. After succeeding on three Constitution saving throws, the creature becomes immune to the effect for 24 hours.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 153 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Venom Splash (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Aberrant Arachnid Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Aberrant Arachnid Trail
As an action, you unleash a blast of venom in a 20-foot cone. Any creature within the cone must make a Constitution saving throw, suffering 3d10 poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 153 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Mind Drain (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Nightmare's Augury Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Nightmare's Augury Trail
As an action, you try to touch a creature, making a melee attack roll. On a hit, you deal 5d8 psychic damage and regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt. If your target is grappled, your touch attack automatically hits.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 153 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Psychic Weapon (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Nightmare's Augury Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Nightmare's Augury Trail
When you hit a target with a melee attack, you can activate this mutation to deal an extra 2d6 psychic damage to it. Additionally, until the end of your next turn, the affected creature has disadvantage on any saving throw against the charmed or frightened conditions.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 153 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Aberrant Gaze (HB)
spell.text:
As a bonus action, multiple eyes sprout all over your body, enhancing your vision for 1 minute. During this time, you see in all directions, cannot be surprised, gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks related to sight, and receive a +2 bonus to your AC. Additionally, you can use an action to focus your eyes on a creature within 30 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be restrained for 1 minute. An affected creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on a success. Using this action ends the mutation.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 153 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Aberrant Spines (HB)
spell.text:
As a bonus action, you manipulate your bone structure to sprout spikes from your skin. For 1 minute, these spines can be used as light weapons, with the finesse and thrown properties (range 20/60), dealing 1d10 piercing damage. Upon hitting a creature, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or its speed is halved. At the start of each turn, the creature can attempt another saving throw to negate this effect for that turn. If the creature is near a wall or large object when hit, it becomes pinned to that surface, receiving the restrained condition. It can make a Strength saving throw at the start of each turn to free itself. Removing a spine requires an action and inflicts 1d8 slashing damage, but a DC 18 Wisdom (Medicine) check can avoid this damage. Additionally, you can launch spines into a wall or steep surface to form handholds, granting advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks for climbing. After a minute, the effect ends, and any remaining spines disintegrate.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 153 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Interplanar Vortex (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, you form a void portal under a creature within 60 feet of you. The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. If it fails, it plummets into the portal and suffers 6d10 necrotic damage from the penumbral energies within before being ejected against the ground by another portal that appears 30 feet above a chosen point on the ground within range, taking falling damage and landing prone. Any other creature at the landing point must also make a Dexterity saving throw or suffer the same falling damage and prone condition. If successful, it avoids the damage and becomes prone. Alternatively, you can control the harmful energies to allow an ally to pass through the portal to another one you create within 60 feet. In this case, the ally must succeed on a Constitution saving throw to avoid the necrotic damage, halving it on a failed save.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 154 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Shadow Control (HB)
spell.text:
With a bonus action, you can use your shadow to attempt to paralyze a creature up to 30 feet away. The creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. To maintain this effect, you must forfeit your actions, reactions, and movement, and can only use bonus actions. You cannot take damage, or the effect ends immediately. At the start of each turn, the paralyzed creature can make a Wisdom saving throw to end the effect. During this time, you can use your bonus action to create a shadowy tentacle that extends up to 5 feet from the paralyzed creature and attacks. The tentacle deals 2d6 necrotic damage on a hit, reducing the creature's maximum hit points until it finishes a long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 154 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Volatile Mutation (HB)
spell.text:
As a bonus action, you can alter your body, causing your muscles to swell and acid-filled pustules to form on your skin. For 1 minute, every attack you suffer triggers a 10-foot cone of acid in the direction of the attack. Each creature within this cone takes 1d6 acid damage. Additionally, during this period, you gain resistance to acid damage and have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 154 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Arachnid Legs (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Aberrant Arachnid Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Aberrant Arachnid Trail
You sprout four spider-like legs from your back that last for 1 minute, enhancing your speed by 10 feet. Their sharp and durable nature allows you to use them as weapons that deal 1d8 slashing damage. On a hit, the target must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the target takes an extra 1d8 poison damage and becomes poisoned. In addition, you can use your bonus action to make an extra attack with one of the spider legs.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 154 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Venomous Saliva (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Aberrant Arachnid Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Aberrant Arachnid Trail
As a bonus action, you can spit venom at a creature within 15 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 3d12 poison damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 155 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Telepathic Mindlink (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Nightmare's Augury Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Nightmare's Augury Trail
With a bonus action, you establish a mental link between yourself and a willing creature. The connection lasts for 1 hour or until you choose to end it or fall unconscious. During this time, you can telepathically communicate with the creature within your line of sight over any distance or up to 40 feet away when out of sight. If the creature is familiar to you, the communication range increases to 120 feet when out of sight. This ability is affected by effects that prevent magic or magical communication. You can maintain a bond with up to 3 creatures simultaneously; establishing a new link with a fourth creature breaks the connection with the first.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 155 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Waves of Headache (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Nightmare's Augury Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Nightmare's Augury Trail
Using your action, you emit mental pulses that affect all creatures within 15 feet of you. Each affected creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it suffers severe headaches, taking 6d6 psychic damage and falling prone from the pain. On a successful save, it takes half damage and remains upright.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 156 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Assassin's Stain (HB)
spell.text:
Using your bonus action, you can mark an enemy up to 30 feet away with penumbral energy, causing an extra 1d8 necrotic damage each time you hit this enemy with an attack over the next minute. Only one enemy can bear this mark at a time.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 156 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Bat Parts (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, you can take on the qualities of a penumbral bat, gaining a set of distortive wings that provide a flying speed of 30 feet, blindsight within a 60-foot radius, and clawed feet capable of grabbing objects and creatures up to one size larger than yours. While flying, you can use your bonus action to make a proficient melee weapon attack to grab a target on a hit, enabling you to carry items or creatures weighing up to 45 times your Strength score without penalties to your speed, or weighing above that to a maximum of 90 times your Strength score, but your speed is halved. This transformation lasts 10 minutes, and you can opt to extend its duration for an additional 10 minutes by gaining 3 more Insanity Points. If you're in the air when the effect ends and you don't extend it, you fall immediately.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 156 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Charge of Shadows (HB)
spell.text:
With a bonus action, you charge your held weapons with penumbral energy. For the following minute, your next successful attack deals an extra 2d8 necrotic damage. Additionally, the target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or become incapacitated for 1 minute, being able to make a new saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end this condition.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 156 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Penumbral Eruption (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, you manipulate penumbral energies to create two portals up to 30 feet apart. An eruption of penumbral energy streaks between these portals, forcing any creature within a 10-foot wide line extending the distance between the portals to make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, they suffer 4d8 necrotic damage and 4d8 force damage, taking half as much damage on a successful save. The portals vanish at the end of the turn.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 156 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Penumbral Fog (HB)
spell.text:
With an action, you can amplify the effects of the Penumbral Plane on the material world, creating a 20-foot radius sphere of fog centered on a point up to 60 feet away from you. All creatures within this zone, except you, must make a Constitution saving throw or suffer 3d6 psychic damage. The area remains heavily obscured to all creatures except you for 10 minutes.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 156 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Allergenic Spores (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Aberrant Arachnid Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Aberrant Arachnid Trail
As a bonus action, you emit a cloud of toxic spores, extending up to 10 feet in all directions. Any creature within the area must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer 2d6 poison damage and become poisoned, taking half damage and avoiding the poisoned condition on a successful save.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 156 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Pheromone Spray (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Aberrant Arachnid Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Aberrant Arachnid Trail
As an action, you alter your glands to produce potent pheromones that radiate up to 60 feet around you for the next hour. Any humanoid creature that enters or starts its turn in this area must make a Constitution saving throw. Creatures engaged in combat with you have advantage on this saving throw. Those who fail are charmed by you, viewing you as a friendly acquaintance, while those who succeed are unaffected. Creatures immune to poison or those that don't need to breathe automatically succeed. Winds of moderate or greater speed disperse your pheromones, negating this effect.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 156 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Minor Telekinesis (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Nightmare’s Augury Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Nightmare's Augury Trail
As a bonus action, you can manipulate objects up to 30 feet away from you, provided their total weight doesn't exceed 30 times your Wisdom score. If an object isn't worn or carried, you can move it up to 30 feet in any direction. Worn or carried items require the owner to fail a Strength saving throw for you to move them. Your telekinetic control also allows you to handle small objects delicately, open containers, retrieve or store items, or pour out the contents of a vial. This control lasts up to 10 minutes. Alternatively, as an action, you can use your telekinesis to hurl a creature up to one size larger than you up to 30 feet away in any direction of your choosing. If this creature collides with a solid structure or another creature, it suffers 6d10 bludgeoning damage and falls prone. The creature it collides with can make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage and to avoid falling prone.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 156 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Penumbral Attraction (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Nightmare’s Augury Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Nightmare's Augury Trail
With an action, you can hypnotize a humanoid creature within 60 feet of you, subjecting them to the effects of the dominate person spell for the next minute.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 157 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Deadly Tentacles (HB)
spell.text:
As a bonus action, you can sprout four tentacles from your back that last for 1 minute or until you retract them with another bonus action. You can use your action to attack with them, making four attacks, one with each tentacle. They have a 10-foot reach, use either your Strength or Dexterity for the attack and damage rolls, and deal 3d4 bludgeoning damage per hit. When a creature enters a space within reach of a tentacle, you can lash out with an immediate attack (as a free action) up to four times until the start of your next turn. Successful hits can be used to grapple the target, automatically dealing damage at the start of each of its turns. As an action, a grappled creature can attempt to escape with a successful Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check against a DC 20. A grappling tentacle cannot attack.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 157 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: In a Blink of an Eye (HB)
spell.text:
With a bonus action, you can forsake your movement to teleport adjacent to a visible enemy within 40 feet of you. Your attacks against this enemy have advantage until the end of your turn. When your turn ends, you can immediately teleport yourself to any other space within 40 feet of your current position.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 157 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Nefarious Dinner (HB)
spell.text:
You contort your facial muscles grotesquely, your jaw reconfiguring into a fanged maw capable of tearing a creature apart. Upon invoking this mutation, make a proficient melee weapon attack against a creature. On a hit, you bite the creature, dealing 7d8 slashing damage and 7d8 necrotic damage, and causing a bleeding effect. The bleeding creature takes 1d10 necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns and can attempt a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns to staunch the bleeding. If your bite damage reduces a Medium or smaller creature to 0 hit points, you can consume it with a bonus action, earning temporary hit points equal to half the bite damage. These temporary hit points last for 1 hour.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 157 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Nightmare Whirlpool (HB)
spell.text:
By activating this power, you invade the minds of all creatures within 15 feet of you, creating a mental link with them that persists for 1 minute. Each targeted creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw, or suffer 6d8 psychic damage and perceive you and your allies as incarnations of their deepest fears due to memories you implant. They remain frightened of you and your allies for the duration. Alternatively, you can forgo the damage to implant different types of memories in those who fail their saving throw. Consult with your GM for potential uses. Affected creatures can attempt a new saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 158 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Parasitism (HB)
spell.text:
With a bonus action, you attempt to attach yourself onto a nearby creature, forcing it to make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, you transform and graft yourself onto them, draining their vitality. The afflicted creature suffers 10d10 necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns, and you recover hit points equal to half the inflicted damage. The target's speed is reduced by 10 feet, and it can use an action to try to pry you off, making a Strength saving throw. On a success, you are dislodged and fall prone in an adjacent space. While leeching, you are unable to take actions, bonus actions, or reactions, and you are immobile, sticking to your host. Should the creature's hit points reach zero, your parasitic grip ceases, and you appear in an unoccupied adjacent space. At the start of your turn, while leeching, you can gain an extra Insanity Point to voluntarily detach and stand in a nearby unoccupied space.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 158 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Penumbra Blade (HB)
spell.text:
While making an attack, you can invoke this mutation to infuse your weapon with potent necrotic energy drawn from the Penumbral Plane. All attacks you make until the end of your turn deal an extra 4d6 necrotic damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 158 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Exoskeleton (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Aberrant Arachnid Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Aberrant Arachnid Trail
You use your action to create a penumbral energy exoskeleton that covers your body. For the next 10 minutes, all incoming damage (except psychic) is dealt to the exoskeleton's hit points first. It has 80 hit points and shares your damage resistances and immunities. If an attack dismantle your exoskeleton and its damage surpasses its residual hit points, the remaining damage is transferred to you.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 158 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Web Cocoon (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Aberrant Arachnid Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Aberrant Arachnid Trail
As an action, you adapt your body to emit a flood of webs at a creature up to one size larger than you within 20 feet of you. The creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or become restrained in the web cocoon, taking 3d8 bludgeoning damage at the end of each of its turns. The creature can be attacked as usual, with no effects on the cocoon. It remains trapped for up to 1 minute or until the cocoon is destroyed, which has an AC of 15, 30 hit points, and has vulnerability to fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 159 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Eye of Augury (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Nightmare's Augury Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Nightmare's Augury Trail
As an action, you close your eyes, which merge into a singular, large eye in the center of your face. For 1 minute, you gain truesight and can use your bonus action to take the Dodge or Disengage action. During this time, you can use an action to focus your eye on a creature within 40 feet of you, imposing a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, they suffer the effects of the confusion spell. Using this ability ends the mutation.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 159 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aberrant Mutation: Phantom of Penumbra (HB)
spell.classes: Madwalker (Aberrant Mutations), Madwalker (Nightmare's Augury Trail) (Aberrant Mutations)
spell.text:
Madness Trail: Nightmare's Augury Trail
As an action, you create a penumbral projection of yourself and launch it at a target within 30 feet of you. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 4d6 psychic damage and become stunned for 1 minute. The projection then moves to another creature within 20 feet of you and imposes the same conditions, repeating up to 4 times. If a creature succeeds on the saving throw, the effect ends. A creature affected by this ability can make the saving throw again at the end of its turns, ending the effect on a success.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 159 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Ammunition Eyes (HB)
spell.text:
When you cast this spell, you can make 1 to 20 arrows magically enchanted for the duration, making a special magical bond with each of them. You make any ranged attack using these arrows with advantage, as well as ignoring half cover and ¾ cover that protects the target of this attack. Also, for the duration of the spell, you always know where your enchanted arrows are, as well as you can use your action to magically see through one of those arrows of your choice, and continue to do so until you use your action to return to your normal senses. As long as you are seeing through the arrow, you are blind to your own senses. You will not be able to see through one of its arrows if it is more than 1 mile away from you. If one of these arrows breaks, the enchantment no longer affects it.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 280 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Amplify the Pain (HB)
spell.classes: School: Necromancy, Cleric, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You concentrate and gaze upon a creature within range, causing all of the pain it receives to be amplified for the duration of the spell. Whenever the target takes damage, it must make a Constitution saving throw or take an additional 1d8 necrotic damage. If this additional damage reduces the target's hit points to 10 or fewer, it must make a Strength saving throw or drop anything it is holding on a failed save.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 280 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Arena's Fervor (HB)
spell.text:
When you cast this spell, you instill in you and your allies the spirit of the arena. You and every willing ally within 20 feet of you has advantage on Strength ability checks, Strength saving throws and all saving throws against effects that cause the frightened condition. While a creature has this effect active, it deals +2 on all damage rolls it makes, including attacks and spells. The bonus is applied to each damage caused individually before any other modifier.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 280 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Aurora Heal (HB)
spell.text:
When you cast this spell,.you create a 20-foot radius aura around you. Allied creatures that start their turns within the area regain hit points equal to 1d6 + your proficiency bonus. Also, it supresses all magical effects that are causing a condition affecting allied creatures within the area. Lasting effects or conditions do not cease to affect the creature, but are only suspended for the duration of the spell.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 280 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Avelum's Force Spheres (HB)
spell.text:
You conjure five small energy spheres in range, each about 2 feet in diameter, spinning at high speed and affecting a spherical area with a diameter of 10 feet. Any creature that starts its turn or enters the area takes 3d6 force damage, or half damage with a successful Dexterity saving throw. As a bonus action, you can move each sphere up to 20 feet in any direction within the spell's range.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 280 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Banner of Inspiration (HB)
spell.text:
You create a fixed, 10 feet high, spiritual banner in a place within range, with a symbol you are currently defendeing. Allies within a 60-foot radius area around the banner and who can see it are inspired, and for the next 10 minutes, can add 1d6 to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw. Each ally can only use this extra die once, ending this effect for them after it is used. For all purposes, this die counts as a Bardic Inspiration die. This spell can only be cast once
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 280 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Beacon of Envy (HB)
spell.classes: School: Abjuration, Bard, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You become a catalyst of envy, pulling the luck of an enemy towards you. When an enemy you can see makes a roll, such as an attack or a saving throw, the target must succeed on a Charisma check. If it fails, you steal that result and store it. If you do so, the target must reroll the dice that was stolen. While maintaining concentration, you can spend the stolen value as one of your own rolls, thus ending the effect of the spell.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 280 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Bite of the Naga Queen (HB)
spell.text:
You transform one of your arms into a serpent for a moment, allowing you to make a melee spell attack against a creature within 10 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes piercing damage equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 10d8 poison damage and becomes poisoned. On a success, the creature takes half of the poison damage and is not poisoned. Alternatively, the serpent arm can spit the poison in a 10-foot cone, starting up to 10 feet from you, and all creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, they take 6d8 poison damage and become poisoned, taking 1d6 poison damage at the start of their turns. They can repeat the saving throw at the end of each turn, ending the condition on a success. Creatures poisoned by this spell cannot become poisoned by it again until they finish a long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 281 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Black Dragon's Mantle (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (small portion of any dragon's material)
spell.text:
You infuse the body of a willing creature you touch with black flames that cover its entire body. The target becomes resistant to fire and necrotic damage. Any other creature that touches the target takes 1d6 fire damage + 1d6 necrotic damage. If the target takes damage from melee attacks, the attacking creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw for each attack or take damage as if it had touched the target. In addition, the same damage is caused to a creature if the target hits it with melee attacks or manage to touch it in any other way.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 281 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Blinding Armor (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (medium armor or higher)
spell.text:
Your armor emits a strong pulse of intense light capable of blinding opponents. Any hostile creature within 15 feet of you that can see you must make a Constitution saving throw and becomes blinded for 1 minute on a failure. Blinded creatures can roll a saving throw at the end of each of their turns to regain their sight.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 281 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Carry the Flame (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a sacred symbol the other person could carry)
spell.text:
Choose a spell you are able to cast that is of 4th level or lower. For the duration, you grant a creature within range the ability to cast that spell one time. The target creature uses its Wisdom as its spellcasting ability for that spell and must expend the actions and components as described for the spell.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 281 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Chorus of the Furious Animal (HB)
spell.text:
You emit a swift melody with a frenzied rhythm, provoking a beast creature to unleash its fury upon its foes. For the duration, the beast can make one more attack with one of its natural weapons, and has resistance to slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 281 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Circle of Crystals (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a small citrine fruit worth at least 100 gp)
spell.text:
You and two other willing creatures of your choice that you can see within range gain resistance against two types of damage chosen from acid, bludgeoning, cold, fire, lightning, necrotic, piercing, poison. slashing, and thunder. If an affected creature already has resistance to a chosen damage type, it gain immunity to that damage for the spell's duration.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can affect one more creature for each slot level above 6th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 281 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Conjure Aberration (HB)
spell.text:
You call an aberrant creature of the penumbral plane to serve you. An aberration of challenge rating 5 or lower appears in an unoccupied space within range, creating a short distortion when it appears. The aberration is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the aberration, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the aberration, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions. If your concentration is broken, the aberration doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the aberration, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack. An uncontrolled aberration can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it. The GM has the aberration's statistics.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 281 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Corrosive Tears (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a small acid flask)
spell.text:
You conjure a green cloud that drops a corrosive acid rain, affecting a 30-foot radius, 30-foot high cylinder centered on a point within range. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature takes 2d8 acid damage, or half as much damage on a success. Objects not being carried and structures in the affected area, take double damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 282 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Cupid's Arrow (HB)
spell.text:
You shoot a spectral arrow establishing a connection between two humanoid creatures within range (you can target yourself). Unwilling creatures must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by the arrow. You make one or both of the affected creatures become charmed by the other (even if the other creature succeeded on the save). This can cause two creatures to become charmed by each other, or one creature to be charmed by the other, at your choice.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher you can charm any creature, not only humanoids.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 282 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Demigod Wings (HB)
spell.text:
You create six wings composed of condensed divine energy that sprout from your back. The wings grant you a flying speed of 50 feet for the duration of the spell. These wings have great powers and you can perform the following effects:
Wings of Mercy: As an action, you create an enormous gust of healing energy. All creatures in a 30-foot cone regains 5d10 hit points.
Wings of Vengeance: As an action, the wings emit a strong pulse of energy that affects a 30-foot-radius sphere around you, and hostile creatures in the area take 5d10 radiant damage.
Wings of Mercy: As a reaction, you can make the wings defend your body by folding around it. If you react to an attack, gain +10 to your AC until the start of your next turn. If you react to a spell, you gain advantage on the saving throw, or the bonus to your AC, if the spell requires an attack roll.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 282 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Echoing (HB)
spell.text:
You manipulate reality to create an echoing effect. As a reaction to the end of another creature's turn, you can cast this spell to replicate the effects of that turn. To use this spell, you must have witnessed the events of that turn within your line of sight. The replicated effects include spellcasting, attacks, damage, and the results of saving throws and ability checks. All targets remain the same, and any attacks or effects that become impossible, such as a target moving out of reach, will simply not occur. No additional dice rolls or checks are required, and the results of the replicated actions remain unchanged. It is important to note that casting echoing does not incur any additional costs or expenses, such as consuming spell slots or expending resources from abilities or spells. However, if the original action had any side effects on the caster, such as those caused by a wish spell, you will experience these side effects instead of the original creature, as if you had performed those actions yourself.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 282 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Edge of Mirrors (HB)
spell.text:
You create a number of small magic mirrors, equal to your spellcasting ability modifier, about half a foot square each, distributing them anywhere within the spell's range. The mirrors are invisible, but can be seen through spells such as detect magic, or by creatures that have true sight, or the like. You, and any creature you allow, are able to see the mirrors. When a creature that can see the mirrors is adjacent to one of them, it will be able to see what is reflected on all other mirrors. In addition, spellcasters who can see the mirrors, and are adjacent to any of them, can cast their spells as if they were positioned at the location of one of the other mirrors. The spell cast in this way cannot have the range of touch. Creatures that are in spaces adjacent to the space occupied by one of the mirrors can sense their presence with a successful DC 18 Wisdom (Perception) check. The mirrors have 5 hp, AC 13.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 282 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Electric Burning (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a bit of fur or wool)
spell.text:
You create a cone of energy that extends 30 feet from the palm of your hand. All creatures within the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 4d6 lightning damage plus 1d6 lightning damage per target that failed the saving throw or half as much damage on a successful one.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 283 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Execution Blade (HB)
spell.text:
A blade of radiant light falls from the sky and hits a 5-foot radius area within range. Creatures in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, a creature takes 10d6 radiant damage that ignores any resistances and immunities, and the creature also has disadvantage on any ability checks it makes until the end of its next turn. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and does not suffer the additional effect.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 283 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Force Armor (HB)
spell.text:
An energy armor forms around you, changing your AC calculation to 12 + Dexterity modifier + Intelligence modifier. Your AC cannot be increased or reduced in any other way while this spell is active, whether by you, allies, enemies, or even items. If a creature within 60 feet deals damage to you, you can use your reaction to shatter the armor into several shards that turn into 4 darts and launch towards the creature that damaged you. Each of the darts deals 1d4+1 force damage to it. Doing so ends the spell.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the spell creates one more dart for each slot above 2nd when you use the reaction.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 283 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Force Arrow (HB)
spell.text:
You imbue magic into a ranged weapon that uses ammo, and when used by you, it fires magical ammo created on each attack, each ammo dealing in addition to its normal damage an extra 2d12 damage and all damage dealt is force damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 283 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Force of Hope (HB)
spell.text:
You encourage and give hope to all friendly creatures within range. For the duration, they gain 2d8 temporary hit points and a +2 bonus to their AC, attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 284 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Force of Salvation (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a diamond worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes)
spell.text:
You hold a diamond and make a circular motion with your arm, saying the name of your god, creating a light on up to three willing creatures that you can see within range. Each creature regains 5d8 hit points and the conditions caused by magical effects afflicting it are ended.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell with a spell slot of 8th level or higher, you affect one more creature per slot level above 7th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 284 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Force Platform (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a jewel worth at least 20 gp)
spell.text:
You create eight cube-shaped platforms whose edge is 10 feet. You can position them as you wish, but at least one of them must be within 90 feet of you and they must all be connected to each other, with at least one of their sides necessarily touching the other of the cubes in order to connect them all. Each platform can hold up to 1000 pounds of load and the creatures can choose to walk on or walk through them. With a bonus action, you can move all of them up to 15 feet, rearranging them as you wish, while respecting the prerequisites mentioned above. Moving them this way causes creatures on top or inside of it to magically move this way. When the spell ends, all creatures on the platforms fall as usual.
At Higher Levels: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, you can create two more platforms for each slot level above 3rd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 284 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Healing Breeze (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a mint leaf or similar herb)
spell.text:
You create a light and gentle breeze that rushes through the area relieving pain, effects and healing an ally. A creature of your choice within range recovers 4d6 hit points and reduces its exhaustion level by 1, if any.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 284 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Huradrin's Rune of Frost (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a small stone rune)
spell.text:
When you cast this spell, a glowing rune appears on the ground in a 5-foot square you can see within range. The first time a creature enters the area on a turn, or if it starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be frozen for the duration. A frozen creature takes 10d6 cold damage at the start of each of its turns and is petrified. The cold damage ignores resistance. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, it is no longer frozen. If a frozen creature starts its turn outside the area (for example, if an ally moves it away), this saving throw is made with advantage.
