If a frozen creature suffers the cold damage from this spell on 5 consecutive turns, it remains petrified after the spell ends.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 284 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Huradrin's Rune of Life (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a small rune carved from a gemstone worth at least 500 gp, which the spell consumes)
spell.text:
You target a dead creature within range, and a glowing rune appears on the ground in a 5-foot square that is under the dead body. If the creature's soul is free and willing, the creature returns to life with 10 hit point, provided that it has been dead no longer than 24 hours. This spell can't return a creature to life that has died of old age or one that is an undead, nor can it restore any missing body parts. If the creature is lacking body parts or organs integral for its survival—its head, for instance—the spell automatically fails. Each time the restored creature ends its turn in contact with the rune, it regains 10 hit points.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 284 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Huradrin's Rune of Stasis (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a small stone rune)
spell.text:
When you cast this spell, a glowing rune appears on the ground in a 5-foot square you can see within range. The first time a creature enters the area on a turn, or if it starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a successful saving throw, it is no longer paralyzed. If the creature starts its turn outside the area (for example, if an ally moves it away), this saving throw is made with advantage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 284 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Huradrin's Rune of Storms (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a small stone rune)
spell.text:
When you cast this spell, a glowing rune appears on the ground in a 5-foot square you can see within range. The first time a creature enters the area on a turn, or if it starts its turn there, a bolt of lightning strikes the creature and it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, it takes 5d6 lightning damage and is unable to take reactions until the start of its next turn.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 285 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Huradrin's Rune of Transformation (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a small stone rune)
spell.text:
When you cast this spell, a glowing rune appears on the ground in a 5-foot square you can see within range. The first time a creature touches the rune after the spell is cast, the rune disappears and a willing creature is transformed for the duration. An unwilling creature may make a Wisdom saving throw; on a success, the spell ends and the creature is not transformed. You choose which transformation occurs when the rune is touched: Reptilian, Avian or Botanic.
Reptilian: The target becomes covered in scales, grows a long tail, and its mouth turns into a crocodilian maw.
• The maw is a natural weapon. The target can attack with it using your spell attack modifier, dealing piercing damage equal to 1d8 plus your spellcasting ability modifier on a hit.
• The scaly hide provides improved protection. While the target is not wearing armor its AC is 13 plus your spellcasting ability modifier.
• The tail has a reach of 10 feet. If a creature enters this reach, the target can take a reaction to attempt to trip the creature. Then, the creature must succeed on a Strength saving throw against your spell save DC, or it falls prone.
Avian: The target becomes covered in feathers, grows wings, gains bird-like reflexes and hawk-like eyes.
• The target gains a flying speed equal to its walking speed. • The target gains advantage on any perception checks based on sight. • When hit by an attack, the target may take a reaction to move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
Botanic: The target becomes covered in bark, and grows leaves and roots.
• The target's speed becomes 0. • The target gains resistance to non-magical bludgeoning damage. • The target gains vulnerability to fire damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 285 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Inner Greed (HB)
spell.text:
You create a small illusory energy globe that transforms into the object or person most coveted by a chosen target, visible only to it. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it becomes charmed by the object of its desire. While charmed by this spell, the creature is incapacitated and, on its turn, will move towards the illusion, regardless of any obstacles in its path. As a bonus action, you can move the globe up to 30 feet within the spell's range. The spell ends if another creature uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 285 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Locate Penumbral Portal (HB)
spell.text:
Component: V, S When casting this spell, you can feel the connections between this world and the Penumbral Plane, indicating where a nearby portal or rift to the Penumbral Plane may be located. You constantly sense the direction of the portal while it is within the spell's range. If you are playing outside of Tanares, you can find passages to the Shadowfell instead.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 285 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Longburrow's Comfortable Cottage (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a piece of bear skin)
spell.text:
When you cast this spell, a small cottage occupying a 20 foot square, with a height of 10 feet, appears in an unoccupied space on the ground within range. A small fire burns in the fireplace in the cottage, keeping the temperature at a comfortable level regardless of the weather outside. The cottage is made of wood, with a single door facing the caster, and one 5-foot square window adorning each side wall. The interior is furnished with 4 sets of bunk beds with comfortable bedding and a padded chair facing the fireplace. A pantry in the cottage and a barrel of ale in the corner contain enough ale and provisions to sustain 8 people for one day. At the end of the duration, the cottage and any remaining contents created by the spell vanish. For the duration, any creature that completes a long rest inside the cottage may reduce an extra level of exhaustion or remove a single condition afflicting it.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 285 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Longburrow's Cozy Campfire (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (some whipped sugar and gelatin)
spell.text:
You target a small non-magical campfire in range and magically transform it to be especially warm and inviting. Any creature that finishes a short rest within 30 feet of the fire while this spell is in effect may roll 2 dice for each Hit Die spent to recover hit points.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 286 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Longburrow's Homey Hearth (HB)
spell.text:
You target a fireplace within range and a warm and comforting fire erupts, which lasts for 8 hours. Any creature that completes a long rest in the same room of the fireplace while this spell is in effect regains all expended Hit Dice.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 286 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Melody of Nemesis (HB)
spell.text:
You play a haunting melody. Each creature other than you within range that can hear the tune must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature loses half of its current hit points, rounded down.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 286 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Memory Trial (HB)
spell.classes: School: Divination, Touch Spells, Bard, Ranger, Wizard
spell.text:
Upon touching an object, you gain insights from its past. There are two ways to use this spell:
• Recent Memory: Upon casting, you can perceive everything that has transpired around the object since it settled in its current location. For the next hour, you can see and hear all events in the vicinity of the object, regardless of how long it has been in that position. Minor adjustments to the object's location, like being shifted during cleaning, don't disrupt the spell's effect.
• Distant Memory: Alternatively, you can specify a particular moment within the past year. You then experience the same sensory effect as the first method.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 286 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Metal to Wood (HB)
spell.text:
You create a magical shock in a 20-foot cube within range, transmuting crafted objects made of metal into wood. Creatures within the area must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, all equipped and carried equipment made of metal is turned into wood. Objects and equipment that are not being equipped or carried are automatically transmuted. Nonmagical objects are transmuted permanently, while magic items are transformed for just 24 hours. Weapons transformed into wood are considered improvised weapons and have a -2 penalty to attack and damage rolls and transformed armors have a -3 penalty to their AC.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 286 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Mind Reshaping (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (between 100 and 1,000 gp of tameranium and bauronite equally divided, which the spell consumes)
spell.text:
In an elaborate ritual, you wipe clean the psyche of a humanoid creature and imprint a new directive, effectively making it almost irreversible. The targeted creature is required to be seated on an obsidian throne worth at least 5,000 gp atop a marble circle, both inscribed with arcane symbols. The creature must also be adorned with a tameranium bracelet on its right wrist and a bauronite bracelet on its left wrist. The spell carries significant side effects; however, these are mitigated by increasing amounts of tameranium and bauronite used. With a minimum of 50 gp worth of each material, you gain 2 levels of exhaustion and are unable to cast this spell for 48 hours. Utilizing at least 500 gp of each reduces the exhaustion to one level, but the spell remains unusable for 24 hours. If you use at least 1000 gp of each, you suffer no exhaustion but are unable to recast the spell for 12 hours. The spell fails if casted before the time above pass. The subject of the spell must remain seated for the entire casting time. Upon completion, you may choose to implement one of the directives Mindless Soldier, Berserker Beast, or Focused Servant on the target. The Mind Return option can be used on a target already affected by this spell to reverse its effects, which is the only way to do it besides the casting of a wish spell.
Mindless Soldier: The creature becomes dedicated to executing orders and will only comply with commands given by individuals bound to it during the casting. You can designate any number of entities that are part of the same organization known to the creature before the ritual.
Berserker Beast: The target operates on pure instinct and obeys only the caster's basic commands. The target loses speech capability and becomes exceptionally hostile. Also, it has advantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws, and it gains a +2 bonus on Strength-based damage rolls, while it has disadvantage on Intelligence ability checks and saving throws.
Focused Servant: The target concentrates all its proficiency on one particular field of knowledge. Choose one skill or tool. The creature gains proficiency in it, doubles its proficiency bonus for checks related to it, and gains advantage on these checks. However, it cannot apply its proficiency bonus to any other skill checks that aren't directly related to the chosen skill or tool.
Mind Return: For this effect, it is also necessary to provide an object that once belonged to the target, which the spell consumes. If done, you revert the target to its state before the spell was cast on it.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 287 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Nature Boon (HB)
Nightmare Hug (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a black pearl worth at least 100 gp)
spell.text:
You summon a shadowy shape behind the target creature that embraces it. The creature must make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, it suffers 1d4 levels of exhaustion and its respective effects for the duration of the spell. If the creature reaches the sixth level of exhaustion, it does not die but is unconscious for 24 hours, only suffering from 5 levels of exhaustion that remain even after the spell's duration. An affected creature that hasn't suffered all 6 levels of exhaustion can make a new save at the end of its turns, getting rid of this spell's effects on a success.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 287 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Notes of Biot (HB)
spell.text:
You conjure powerful notes that echo in a 60-foot radius sphere from a point within the spell's range. Hostile creatures that enter or start their turn in the area take 8d8 thunder damage and must make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, a creature takes only half as much damage. On a failure, a creature also must roll 1d8 to define which note ran through its body and which condition affected it, according to the following table. The condition lasts for 1 minute, and the affected creature can redo the save at the end of its turns, ending the condition on a success. If a creature receives more than one condition from this spell, it makes a single saving throw at the end of its turns, ending all conditions that have affected it on a success.
Notes of Biot: Dice | Note | Effect 1 | Do | The creature is Paralyzed 2 | Re | The creature is Charmed 3 | Mi | The creature is Stunned 4 | Fa | The creature is Restrained 5 | Sol | The creature is unable to speak or utter other sounds 6 | La | The creature is Blinded 7 | Si | The creature is Frightened 8 | Chord | +4d8 thunder damage and roll again on the table.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 287 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Offer (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (8 sp in incenses, which the spell consumes)
spell.text:
You make an offering to your god, asking him for guidance on the day ahead. For the next 24 hours, anytime you roll a d20 to determine the outcome of any action, you can choose to roll an additional d20 and choose which of the two results to use. You can declare you are using the extra d20 either before or after you make the first roll, but always before the GM declares the outcome. Once you use the roll the spell ends and can't be used again before the next dawn.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 288 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Penumbral Fissure (HB)
spell.text:
The caster opens a fissure of up to 60 square feet between the Material Plane and the Penumbral Plane to the fissure, allowing creatures to cross from one plane to the correspondent place in the other. Alternatively, you can close an existing fissure between these planes, as long as it does not exceed 60 square feet. A fissure created by this spell automatically closes if a penumbral creature comes within 5 feet of it, but reopens when there are no penumbral creatures within that range.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 288 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Phantom Vision (HB)
spell.classes: School: Divination, Touch Spells, Bard, Ranger, Wizard
spell.text:
You touch the target's eyes and they become yellow, allowing it to see creatures through solid objects, such as walls. For the duration, the target can see creatures, not objects, within a range of 20 feet through any obstacle up to 2 feet thick, regardless of the lack of light in the area. In darkness, the image of the creature is not sharp and its colors become only shades of red.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 288 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Prayer of the Desperates (HB)
spell.text:
You make a prayer asking your god to protect the desperate and heal the wounded. Choose up to three creatures within range to regain 1d6 hit points. In addition, if the creature had 0 hit points, it receives +2 to its AC until the start of its next turn, and can immediately choose to take a reaction to stand up from prone.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 288 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Pressure Empowerment (HB)
spell.text:
Upon casting this spell, the magic propels a piece of ammunition from your hand, in a grand arc towards a target, exerting immense pressure as it descends. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 8d6 force damage and is knocked prone. On a miss, the creature takes half as much damage and must make a saving throw, choosing between Strength or Dexterity, to avoid being knocked prone. Any other creature within 20 feet of the target must make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw (creature's choice). On a failure, the creature takes 8d6 force damage and is knocked prone. On a success, it takes half as much damage and is not knocked prone. Creatures of Large size or larger have advantage on the saving throw.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 288 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Pure Light Slash (HB)
spell.text:
You conjure an immense blade of pure luminescence overhead, which descends and morphs into one of the forms you select:
• A sweeping slash in a 15-foot cone in front of you, inflicting 3d4 radiant damage to all creatures within the area.
• A powerful thrust directly in front of you, causing 3d4 radiant damage to all creatures within its trajectory in a 25-foot line.
• Several shards of brilliant light, dealing 3d4 radiant damage to all creatures adjacent to you.
All creatures within the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking half as much damage on a success.
At Higher Levels: Casting this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher amplifies the damage by an additional 1d4 for each slot level above 1st.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 288 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Purge (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a diamond worth at least 2000 gp that has been blessed by a cleric, which is consumed by the spell)
spell.text:
You call down a beam of holy light to smite an enemy. The creature must succeed on a Charisma saving throw, taking 10d8 radiant damage plus 10d8 fire damage, is permanently blinded and becomes afflicted with the effects of the slow spell for a minute on a failure. On a success, it takes half as much damage, is blinded for 1 minute and is not slowed. If the target is native to a different plane of existence than the one you're on, he has disadvantage on the saving throw. A permanently blinded creature can only remove the condition by the spells greater restoration, regeneration, wish, or similar abilities.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 289 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Ray of Fear (HB)
spell.text:
You shoot a powerful beam of dark purple energy from your open hands at a creature within range. You make a ranged spell attack against the target, and if it hits, it takes 7d6 psychic damage and becomes frightened for 1d4 rounds. If you are in dim light or darkness, increase the damage by 3d6 and the target remains frightened for 2d4 rounds. The target can make a Wisdom saving throw at the end of each of its turns to end the frightened condition.
Frightened: • A frightened creature has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls while the source of its fear is within line of sight. • The creature can't willingly move closer to the source of its fear.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 289 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Reveal Hidden Steps (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, you exhale a luminous magical breath that reveals the tracks of passing creatures within 30 feet of you. For the duration of the spell, you gain a +10 bonus on Wisdom (Survival) checks to track creatures.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 289 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Rurik's Energy Shield (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Paladin, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You create a large shield of energy embellished with dwarven runes, which revolves around you and provides three-quarters of cover. Any creature that makes a melee attack against you takes 5d6 force damage. As a bonus action, you can transform the barrier made by the shield into a handaxe of arcane energy, which forms in your hand. You can make a ranged spell attack with the axe as an action against a creature within 60 feet of you. On a hit, the attack deals 5d6 force damage, and if the target is larger than you, it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone. For the duration, you can switch between the axe and the shield forms as a bonus action. If you take any damage, the spell ends.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 289 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Shadow Noose (HB)
spell.classes: Cleric (Chaos Domain (Tanares HB)), School: Necromancy, Druid, Ranger, Warlock
spell.text:
Upon casting this spell, beams of necrotic energy burst from the shadow of a target creature within range, seeking to ensnare it. The target creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, shadowy tendrils form around the creature for the duration of the spell, halving its speed and inflicting necrotic damage equal to 1d6 plus your spellcasting ability modifier. The ensnared creature may attempt a new saving throw at the end of each of its turns to free itself. Until it succeeds, it suffers necrotic damage equal to 1d6 plus your spellcasting ability modifier at the beginning of each of its turns. On a successful save, the spell ends.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 289 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Shadow Sword (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a onyx gem worth at least 25 gp, which the spell consumes)
spell.text:
You choose a target that you can see within the spell's range and create a sword of negative energy, which emerges from the target's shadow and attacks. Make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the sword stabs the creature, dealing 5d10 necrotic damage. The sword remains stuck to the target, and on subsequent turns, you can use your action to deal 4d10 necrotic damage to the target automatically. The sword dissipates and the spell ends if you use your action to do anything else. The creature cannot have its hit points restored by any means until the sword is removed or the spell ends. A creature can attempt to remove the sword using its action to make a Charisma saving throw. On a success, the sword is removed, the target takes 5d10 necrotic damage, and the spell ends. On a failure, the sword is not removed, and the target takes half as much damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 289 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Shield of Light (HB)
spell.text:
You manifest a radiant energy barrier that you can wield. For all purposes, it functions as a shield, but allows the execution of somatic components to cast spells.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the barrier becomes a +1 shield. When you use a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the bonus increases to +2, and, when you use a spell slot of 8th level or higher, the bonus increases to +3.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 290 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Silver Crown (HB)
spell.text:
A crown of gleaming silver energy appears above the target creature's head. For the duration, the target has +1 bonus to its AC, to any save DC, and to any ability checks in which the target adds its proficiency bonus.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 1st.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 290 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Song of life (HB)
spell.text:
You intone a beautiful chant. Up to five creatures of your choice that can hear you within range regain 6d8 hit points and have advantage on the next Constitution saving throw they make. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 290 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Sparks of Light (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Bard, Cleric, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You create small sparks of radiant light that surrounds a 20-foot-radius area. As long as the spell lasts, hostile creatures in the area have a -1 penalty to attack rolls, AC, and ability checks. At any time, the caster can use a bonus action to end this effect, bursting the sparks and dealing 1d4 damage to all hostile creatures in the area. They can make a Dexterity saving throw to avoid this damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 290 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Spiritual Calling (HB)
spell.text:
You cast this spell at a location to summon the spirit of a creature that has been there before, allowing it to provide you with information about the events that occurred there. The spirit remains for 1 minute. When invoking the spirit, roll 1d10 to determine its behavior and the amount of information it has, as shown in the table below:
Spirit Behaviors: d10 | Behavior 1 to 2 | The spirit is hostile, refusing to answer your questions or even providing false information. 3 to 4 | The spirit has vague information and is not very familiar with the place, but does not act in a harmful manner. 5 to 8 | The spirit acts in a friendly manner. It knows the place, but only has rumors and incomplete information about what happened there. 9 to 10 | The spirit acts in a friendly manner and has detailed knowledge of the location. It can provide accurate information about events that took place there.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 290 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Spiritual Healer (HB)
spell.text:
You conjure a floating spectral spirit within range. When you cast this spell, the spirit can perform a healing touch on a creature adjacent to where it appears, restoring hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. As a bonus action, you can move the spectral spirit up to 30 feet to a space you can see and use its healing touch on a different creature.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for every two slot levels above 3rd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 290 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Spore Blow (HB)
spell.classes: Druid (Bloom (Tanares HB)), School: Evocation, Druid, Ranger
spell.text:
You use natural energy to release dozens of magical spores that affect a 20-foot radius sphere within range. Any creature other than you that enters or starts its turn in the affected area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, 2d4 spores stick to the creature, or half as much on a success. The attached spores explode if the creature takes any damage. The creature then takes 1d4 poison damage for each exploded spore and must succeed on a Constitution saving throw to not become poisoned for 1 minute. As long as the spores have not exploded, a creature can, as an action, make a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check against your spell save DC to remove 1 of the spores attached to itself or another creature, but on failure, all spores explode.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 290 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Static Bolt (HB)
spell.text:
You shoot a bolt of static energy against a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target, dealing 1d8 lightning damage on a hit. Subsequently, the target takes 1d8 lightning damage for each 5 feet it moves, willingly or not, until the end of its next turn. The subsequent damage cannot exceed 5d8.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the initial damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 291 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Stone Bow (HB)
spell.text:
When you cast this spell, you become a conduit for magical earth energy that makes projectiles you launch charged with it. For the duration, your ranged attacks made with a weapon deal an extra 1d6 damage of the same type as the weapon or ammo. Also, whenever a creature is hit by one of these attacks, it must make a Strength saving throw. On failure, it is pushed 10 feet straight away from you. Large or larger creatures have advantage on this saving throw.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 291 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Taram's Life Bond (HB)
spell.text:
When you cast this spell, you create a mystical bond between yourself and up to two creatures within range. Each targeted creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it becomes linked to you for the duration of the spell. When you take damage and a bonded creature is within 120 feet, the damage is divided between you and the creature. You take half the damage (rounded down), and the bonded creature absorbs the remainder, inflicted as psychic damage. If both bonded creatures are within range, both take half of the damage. For example, if you would take 10 damage, you take only 5 and both creatures take 5 each.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, you can bond to one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 291 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Terror Clone (HB)
spell.classes: School: Conjuration, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
You choose a creature within range, and it must succeed on a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, you cause its shadow to detach and become a separate creature with the same statistics and equipment as the original. The shadow acts on the same initiative turn as the original creature but takes its turn immediately after. The shadow will attack the original creature with all its might for the spell's duration or until one of them drops to 0 hit points, which also ends the spell.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 292 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Thalia's Acceleration Rescue (HB)
spell.text:
This spell causes up to 5 willing creatures of your choice in a 30-foot radius sphere to gain a speed increase of 5 feet and can take the Dash action as a bonus action.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 292 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Threshold Impacts (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (three circles of silver and bone dust of a penumbral creature)
spell.text:
You open 3 portals through the Penumbral Plane in 3 locations of your choice within range. For the duration, as a bonus action, you can enter one of them and exit through any of the other two of your choice. Alternatively, if you are adjacent to one of them, you can channel penumbral energy from the portal and shoot it against an enemy up to 60 feet away, making a ranged spell attack that deals 4d6 necrotic damage on a hit. Other creatures cannot pass through a portal, but they can block the exit. If you pass through the portal and decide to exit through a blocked one, both you and the creature blocking the exit take 4d6 force damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 292 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Thunder Weapon (HB)
spell.text:
You conjure a resonating, spectral lute in your hand. This lute can be used to make melee spell attacks, dealing thunder damage equal to 1d10 plus your spellcasting ability modifier on a hit.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 292 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Thunderous Spear (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (one javelin and a bottle of water collected from a storm)
spell.classes: School: Enchantment, Cleric, Druid, Paladin, Ranger, Warlock
spell.text:
You call forth a spear of solid lightning to skewer an enemy. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be marked as the target of three spears that rain down from a cloud created up to 20 feet above the creature's head. Whenever the creature is hit by an attack for the first time on a turn, one of the spears strikes down, dealing 4d4 piercing damage and 4d4 lightning damage. The spell ends when all three spears are used.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the spell creates one aditional spear for each two slot levels above 3rd.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 292 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Tranquil Grove (HB)
spell.text:
You create a restful environment in a 20-foot radius around you, making it an ideal place for a long rest. A long rest taken in this area only requires half the usual time, and the creature resting recovers from the effects of one additional level of exhaustion. A creature can only benefit from this spell once per long rest, and must take at least one long rest outside of this area before it can benefit from the spell again.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 292 (Homebrew)

spell.name: True Light Palm (HB)
spell.text:
You channel the purest light through your hand to punish or save your targets. If you use it against a hostile creature, make a melee spell attack against the target. On a hit, the creature takes 7d6 radiant damage, and the light spreads and consumes the creature's essence, imposing disadvantage on all its saving throws for the next minute. If you cast it on an ally, it regains 7d6 hit points, and the light ignites its essence, granting advantage on all its saving throws for the next minute.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 292 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Uster's Necrotic Comet (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (dozens of bones or a pile of corpses)
spell.text:
You channel the necrotic energy from bones or a piles of corpses, creating a green cloud in the sky. On your next turn, you can use your action to transform the cloud into bones made of necrotic energy, which then fall, affecting a 30-foot radius sphere centered on a point within range. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 12d6 necrotic damage, or half as much damage on a successful one. If this damage reduces a creature to 20 hit points or fewer, it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or die, rising as a zombie under your control, as if you had cast the animate dead spell. If the creature is reduced to 10 hit points or fewer, it makes the saving throw with disadvantage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 292 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Veil of Bravery (HB)
spell.classes: Cleric (Courage Domain (HB)), School: Abjuration, Bard, Cleric
spell.text:
You can turn your allies' courage into a powerful protective energy. Choose up to 3 willing creatures within range. While under this spell, you and those creatures get +1 on all saving throws, plus the following effect: When a creature affected with the veil of bravery takes damage, it can take a reaction to reduce the damage by 1d6 for each creature within 20 feet of it that is also affected by this spell. Each creature can use this spell's effect only once; then the spell ends for it.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage reduction die increases by one step for every two slot levels above 2nd, reducing 1d8 for a 4th level, 1d10 for a 6th level, and 1d12 for an 8th level.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 292 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Wildpath (HB)
spell.classes: Druid (Bloom (Tanares HB)), School: Conjuration, Druid, Ranger
spell.text:
You create an opaque wall of magic bushes on a solid surface within range. You can make a wall up to 30-foot long, 5-foot high and 5-foot thick or a ring wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 5 feet high and 5 feet thick. Each creature within the area when the wall appears, and, subsequently, any creatures that pass through the spaces it occupies, must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failure, the creature must roll 1d6 to determine which effect on the table happens to it.
Wildpath Effects: d6 | Effect 1-2 | The twigs and vines ensnare the creature, which becomes restrained for the duration. The creature can use an action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer restrained. 3-4 | The branches and vines begin to whip the creature, dealing 2d6 slashing damage per turn as long as it remains in the area. 5-6 | Branches, roots, and leaves sway around the creature, blocking its movement and vision. Terrain occupied by the wall of bushes is considered difficult terrain. While within the area, the creature has disadvantage on attacks and Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 292 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of Courage (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The blessed creature gains a +2 bonus to saving throws against fear effects.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of Endurance (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The blessed creature gains a +2 bonus to saving throws against receiving or increasing exhaustion levels.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of Fortune (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
If the blessed creature is continuously attuned to this blessing for one month, they gain a 5% chance to unexpectedly gain 1d10 gp. There is no way to know if the gain of gold is caused by this blessing or not.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of Health (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The blessed creature gains a +2 bonus to saving throws against poisons and diseases.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of Life (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The blessed creature gains a +1 bonus to death saving throws.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of Love (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The blessed creature gains a +3 bonus to Charisma ability checks made when interacting with people they truly love.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of Sobriety (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The blessed creature never becomes inebriated from drinking alcoholic beverages. This has no effect on magical liquids or other substances such as poisons.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of the Crafter (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The blessed creature gains a +2 bonus to all ability checks made with artisan's tools.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of the Green (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The plants that the blessed creature plants and takes care of produce 30% more food when harvested.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Minor Blessing: Blessing of Tidiness (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 5+
The blessed creature's clothes never get dirty or stained. They can still be damaged or ruined in other ways.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of Action (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
The blessed creature gains +2 on initiative checks.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of Consistence (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
When the blessed creature makes an attack or ability check, they can forgo rolling the d20 to consider a roll of 10 on the die. This can be used only once and recovers after a long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of Elemental Protection (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
When this blessing is given, the redeemer must choose one element (fire, cold, lightning, thunder, or acid). When the blessed creature would take damage from that element, it may use a reaction to reduce that damage by 1d6.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of Eyesight (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
The blessed creature gains +2 on Wisdom (Perception) checks that are based on vision.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of Light (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
As an action, the blessed creature can start to emit light as the light spell. This has no time limit and can be ended at any time with a bonus action.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of Resilience (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
Once per day, when the blessed creature suffers a critical hit, it can use a reaction to turn that into a normal hit.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of the Archer (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
When shooting arrows or bolts, the blessed creature can create energy versions of the ammunition that disappear after hitting their target. It is not considered magical and has no magical properties, but allows for an endless amount of ammunition to shoot. Arrows and bolts the blessed creature shoots never break when hitting an enemy. They can still be broken as usual in other ways. Blessing of Elemental Protection: When this blessing is given, the redeemer must choose one element (fire, cold, lightning, thunder, or acid). When the blessed creature would take damage from that element, it may use a reaction to reduce that damage by 1d6.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of the Desert (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
The blessed creature needs to drink water only once every 5 days, and gains advantage on saving throws to resist the effects of heat from hot climates.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of the Prey (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
Wisdom (Survival) checks made to track the blessed creature have disadvantage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Simple Blessing: Blessing of Vigor (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 7+
The blessed creature's maximum hit points are increased by 3.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of Air (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
When falling, the blessed creature descends only 60 feet per round and takes no fall damage.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of Power (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
The DC of saving throws imposed by the blessed creature are 1 point higher.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of Recovery (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
The blessed creature can use an action to make a target creature it touches regain 4d6 hit points. This can be used once and recovers after a long rest.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of Reflex (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
When the blessed creature is hit by a weapon attack, it can use a reaction to reduce the damage taken by 1d6.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of Secrecy (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
The blessed creature has advantage on all Dexterity (Stealth) checks.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of the Weapon (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
One weapon the blessed creature holds can be considered a +1 weapon (can be changed at the start of the creature's turn). The redeemer can pay three times the blessing cost to instead make this Blessing apply to all weapons the creature uses, including natural weapons and unarmed attacks.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 190 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of Tongues (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
The blessed creature can understand any language as if affected by comprehend languages.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of War (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
The blessed creature gains +1 to weapon attack rolls.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Major Blessing: Blessing of Water (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 9+
The blessed creature can breathe underwater as if it were air.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of Evasion (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
The blessed creature has advantage on Dexterity saving throws.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of Protection (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
The blessed creature gains +1 to AC.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of Salvation (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
If the blessed creature would die, it stays alive with 1 hit point, all failed death saves are removed, and it becomes conscious if it wasn't already. This blessing is completely lost when used. This blessing uses two attunement slots instead of one.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of Speed (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
The blessed creature's speed increases by 20 feet.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of Spell Resistance (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
The blessed creature has advantage on saving throws against spells.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of the Elements (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
The blessed creature gains resistance to two elements chosen randomly from cold, fire, acid, lightning, or thunder when the blessing is given.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of the Mystic (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
The blessed creature gains a +2 bonus to its spell attack modifier and spell save DC, but its maximum hit points are reduced by 4 while attuned to this blessing.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of the Skies (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
The blessed creature can activate this blessing for up to 4 hours per day as a bonus action. Once activated, the creature gains a flying speed equal to its walking speed. Each activation has a duration of 1 minute, and when it expires, the creature descends at a rate of 30 feet per round until it lands.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Greater Blessing: Blessing of the Superior Weapon (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 11+
One weapon the blessed creature holds can be considered a +2 weapon (can be changed at the start of the creature's turn). The redeemer can pay three times the blessing cost to instead make this Blessing apply to all weapons the creature uses, including natural weapons and unarmed attacks.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of Avoidance (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
All attacks against the blessed creature are made with disadvantage. If the creature takes damage, this benefit is lost until the start of its next turn. This blessing has no effect if the creature is incapacitated, restrained, or otherwise unable to move.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of Haste (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
The blessed creature can make one weapon attack as a bonus action on each of their turns.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of Regeneration (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
The blessed creature regains 1d6 hit points every 10 minutes, provided it has at least 1 hit point. If the creature loses a body part, it regrows and returns to full functionality after 1d6+1 days, as long as it has at least 1 hit point the whole time.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of the Giant (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
The blessed creature's Strength score increases by 2, and their maximum Strength score increases by 2 as well.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of the King (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
The blessed creature's Charisma score increases by 2, and their maximum Charisma score increases by 2 as well.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of the Mind (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
The blessed creature's Intelligence score increases by 2, and their maximum Intelligence score increases by 2 as well.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of the Shield (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
The blessed creature's Constitution score increases by 2, and their maximum Constitution score increases by 2 as well.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of the Soul (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
The blessed creature's Wisdom score increases by 2, and their maximum Wisdom score increases by 2 as well.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of the Supreme Weapon (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
One weapon the blessed creature holds can be considered a +3 weapon (can be changed at the start of the creature's turn). The redeemer can pay three times the blessing cost to instead make this blessing apply to all weapons the creature uses, including natural weapons and unarmed attacks.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Supreme Blessing: Blessing of the Wind (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Redeemer Level 13+
The blessed creature's Dexterity score increases by 2, and their maximum Dexterity score increases by 2 as well.
Source: Player's Guide to Tanares p. 191 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Blood Curse: Blood Curse of the Draining Cloud (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Order of the Mosquito
As a bonus action, you can mark one creature you can see within 30 feet of you to become the nexus of a life-draining swarm for the duration of the curse. The first time the marked creature deals damage with an attack, the attack inflicts additional Necrotic damage equal to your Hemocraft die roll. Simultaneously, you regain hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.
Amplify: When you choose to amplify this blood curse, the creature gains vulnerability to necrotic damage for the duration of the curse. Additionally, the radius of the draining swarm's influence expands to 10 feet around the cursed target. The amplified curse concludes when any creature takes necrotic damage from the Draining Cloud.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 7 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Blood Curse: Blood Curse of the Mosqo (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 15th level, Order of the Mosquito
As a bonus action, you can target one creature you can see within 30 feet of you. A giant spectral mosquito attaches itself to the target, causing it to have disadvantage on attack rolls against anyone except you. Furthermore, any damage the cursed creature takes heals the attacker by an amount equal to half of the damage dealt. The curse lasts until the end of your next turn.
Amplify: When you amplify this blood curse, the spectral mosquito drains the very essence of the target. After the curse ends, the target suffers one level of exhaustion as a result of the draining torment.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 7 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Acquired Tolerance
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you gain resistance to poison damage. In addition, you automatically succeed on saving throws against your own apothecary spells, and never take damage from your own apothecary spells.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 136 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Adrenaline Surge
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
A creature at 0 hit points who regains hit points from a spell you cast using an apothecary spell slot gains resistance to all damage and has advantage on saving throws until the end of its next turn. It gains advantage on the first attack roll it makes on its next turn.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 136 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Anatomical Precision
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
When you make a weapon attack, you can use your Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the attack and damage rolls.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 136 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Anesthesiology
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 14th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You can cast hold person without expending a spell slot or requiring material components. You must finish a long rest before you can use this theory on the same creature again.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Bedside Manner
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You gain proficiency in the Insight and Persuasion skills. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of these skills.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Caustic Formulae
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
Once per turn when you deal damage to a creature or object with an apothecary spell, you can expend an apothecary spell slot to deal 2d4 extra acid damage to that target, plus another 2d4 per level of the spell slot.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Clinical Conditioning
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You gain proficiency in Constitution saving throws.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Combat Medic
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You gain proficiency with martial weapons and shields.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Corrosive Compound
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
When you deal poison damage with your apothecary spells, you can choose to deal half the spell's damage as poison damage and half the spell's damage as acid damage instead.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Cosmetic Surgery
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You can spend 8 hours performing an occult surgical procedure upon a willing creature, permanently transforming its appearance. You decide what the creature looks like, including facial features, the sound of its voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, but none of its game statistics change. You can't alter the size of a creature, and its basic shape stays the same. The resulting transformation is non-magical, however, a greater restoration spell or similar magic cast upon the creature can restore it to its original appearance.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Critical Condition
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
When a creature rolls a natural 1 on a saving throw made against one of your apothecary spells that deals damage, roll all of the spell's damage dice twice and add them together. Then add any relevant modifiers as normal to determine the damage that creature takes from the spell.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Diagnosis
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You can take the Help action as a bonus action on your turn.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Doctor's Note
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You can cast the sending spell at-will. You must finish a long rest before you can use this theory to contact the same creature again.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Double Dose
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
When you cast an apothecary spell using an apothecary spell slot that targets a single creature and restores hit points to that creature, you can target an additional creature within range.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Extracurricular Research
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You learn two additional cantrips of your choice from any class's spell list. These cantrips become apothecary cantrips for you.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Inoculation
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You have resistance to necrotic damage, and your hit point maximum can't be reduced. In addition, you are immune to diseases
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Interdisciplinary Practice
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 14th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
When you use your action to cast a spell, you can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Laboratory Assistant
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You learn the spell find familiar, and always have this spell prepared. It doesn't count against the number of apothecary spells you can prepare.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Liability Insurance
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 14th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You can cast contingency once on yourself without material components. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Medical Expertise
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You gain proficiency in the Medicine and Nature skills. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of these skills.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Medical Lexicon
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You learn six languages of your choice. You can cast detect poison and disease at will.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Nerve Agent
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
When you deal poison damage with your apothecary spells, you can choose to deal psychic damage instead.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 137 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Noxious Blood
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
When a creature hits you with a melee attack while within 5 feet of you, it takes poison damage equal to 1d6 + your Constitution modifier.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Pharmacology
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
When you cast a spell using an apothecary spell slot or your Greater Formula feature which restores hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Physiological Analysis
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
If you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside combat, you can learn certain information about its physiology. The Game Master reveals to you two of the following characteristics of your choice:
• Any one ability score • Armor Class • Current hit points • Resistances (if any) • Immunities (if any) • Vulnerabilities (if any)
Alternatively, you can spend 1 minute observing a corpse. After 1 minute, you determine the cause of death.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Practical Resuscitation
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
When you cast a spell that has the sole effect of restoring a creature to life (but not undeath), such as raise dead, you don't need material components to cast the spell if the creature has died within the past hour
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Putrefaction
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
Your apothecary spells and abilities ignore undead creatures' resistance or immunity to poison damage and immunity to the poisoned condition.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Rapid Response
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
When you cast an apothecary spell that restores hit points to a creature, before or after casting the spell, you can move your speed without provoking opportunity attacks.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Routine Procedure
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You can cast lesser restoration at-will without expending a spell slot.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Stolen Secrets
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You learn one spell from any class's spell list. It must be of a level for which you have apothecary spell slots or lower. The spell is treated as an apothecary spell for you, and doesn't count against the number of apothecary spells you know.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Subject Preparation
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
When you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack, that creature has disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes against an apothecary spell you cast before the end of your next turn.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Surgeon's Instinct
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You have blindsight out to a range of 10 feet.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Surgical Strikes
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the Attack action on your turn.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Toxicology
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You add your Intelligence modifier to the damage rolls of spells that deal poison damage.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Triage
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
You learn the spare the dying cantrip if you don't know it already. When you cast this cantrip, it has a range of 60 feet.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Unfailing Focus
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
When you fail a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration on an apothecary spell, you can choose to succeed instead. Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Venomous Instruments
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, the creature takes extra poison damage equal to your Intelligence modifier.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Virulence
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
When you roll a 1 on a damage die for an apothecary spell that deals poison damage, you can reroll the die. You must use the new result, even if the new roll is a 1.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Vital Signs
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 1st-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you fails a saving throw or death saving throw, you can use your reaction to add your Intelligence modifier to the creature's roll, potentially turning a failure into a success. You must finish a short rest before you can use this theory on the same creature again.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Esoteric Theory: Vivisection
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 6th-level Apothecary (Drakkenheim)
Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a 19 or 20.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 138 (Third Party)

spell.name: Acid Burn (HB)
spell.text:
You magically produce a spray of acidic formula in a 15-foot cone in front of you. All creatures in the cone must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 acid damage.
Cantrip Upgrade: This spell's damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 186 (Third Party)

spell.name: Acid Rain (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a pinch of sulfur and ground coal)
spell.classes: School: Conjuration, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Apothecary (Drakkenheim), Druid (Circle of Contamination)
spell.text:
Until the spell ends, acid rain falls in a 40-foot-tall cylinder with a 40-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range. The area is lightly obscured, and exposed flames in the area are doused. Chemical pools accumulate on the ground in the area, making it difficult terrain. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it takes 3d6 acid damage and must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, it falls prone in the pools, taking an additional 3d6 acid damage.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the acid damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 5th.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 191 (Third Party)

spell.name: Acrid Orb (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (A vial of stomach acid and a pinch of sulfate)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Apothecary (Drakkenheim), Ranger, Warlock, Wizard, Sorcerer
spell.text:
You create an orb of acid gel and fling it at one creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 acid damage. Whether the attack hits or misses, the orb explodes. The target and each creature within 5 feet of it must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 2d6 acid damage.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the exploding acid damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 187 (Third Party)

spell.name: Bacterial Barrage (HB)
spell.text:
You attack a creature in range with a quick spreading infection that takes advantage of existing conditions. Make a ranged spell attack against a target, on a hit the infection does 1d8 necrotic damage to the target. If the target is suffering from the poisoned condition or a disease, it instead takes 1d12 necrotic damage.
Cantrip Upgrade: The spell's damage increases by one die when you reach 5th level (2d8 or 2d12), 11th level (3d8 or 3d12), and 17th level (4d8 or 4d12).
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 186 (Third Party)

spell.name: Banish to the Space Between Worlds (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a delerium fragment worth 100gp, which the spell consumes)
spell.text:
This is a Contaminated Spell. When you cast this spell, you gain 1 Contamination Level.
You banish a creature that you can see within range into the Space Between Worlds. Upon this roiling plane of chaotic potential, the target wanders incomprehensible vistas searching for a way back via strange and absurd exits. The target remains there for the duration or until it escapes. The target can use its action to attempt to escape. When it does so, it makes an Intelligence check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it escapes, and the spell ends. On a failed check, the target takes 4d6 psychic damage. When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or, if that space is occupied, in the nearest unoccupied space. Time passes differently for the target within the Space Between Worlds, and it perceives its time spent there as having lasted hundreds or perhaps thousands of years, even if it was only gone for rounds or minutes in the mortal world. A creature which dies in the Space Between Worlds does not return.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 198 (Third Party)

spell.name: Biohazard (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a withered root and a drop of vinegar)
spell.classes: School: Conjuration, Apothecary (Drakkenheim), Apothecary (Drakkenheim) (Pathogenist), Druid (Circle of Contamination), Druid, Ranger, Sorcerer, Wizard
spell.text:
You coat a 15-foot-wide cube with toxic sludge for the spell's duration. The area is difficult terrain and filled with dangerous fumes. A creature that enters the area or starts its turn there must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature takes 1d8 poison damage and is poisoned until the start of its next turn. Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or don't need to breathe.
At Higher Levels: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 187 (Third Party)

spell.name: Blood Worm (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a jar full of leeches)
spell.classes: School: Necromancy, Apothecary (Drakkenheim), Apothecary (Drakkenheim) (Pathogenist), Bard, Druid, Warlock
spell.text:
You infect a creature you can see within range with a magical disease in the form of a malignant parasite. Once per turn when a creature hits the infected target with a weapon attack, that attack deals an additional 4d6 necrotic damage, and the attacker regains hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. Each time the infected target takes this necrotic damage, it makes a Constitution saving throw against the spell. If the saving throw succeeds, the spell ends.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the necrotic damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 4th
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 189 (Third Party)

spell.name: Breath of Nightshade (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a pair of deadly nightshade flowers)
spell.classes: School: Conjuration, Apothecary (Drakkenheim), Warlock, Wizard, Bard
spell.text:
You exhale a 60-foot-cone of lethal poison. Each creature in the area when you cast the spell must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes poisoned for 1 hour. While poisoned by this spell, the creature is paralyzed. The spell ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 193 (Third Party)

spell.name: Caustic Grip (HB)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Apothecary (Drakkenheim), Wizard, Warlock, Sorcerer
spell.text:
For the spell's duration, your hand secretes sticky burning acid which you can use to hold a creature in a painful clutch. When you cast this spell, and as an action on your turn until the spell ends, you can make a melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, you deal 4d4 acid damage to the target, and the creature is restrained in your acidic grip until the end of your next turn. You can attack the same target round after round, or choose a new one at any time. If you switch targets, the prior target is no longer affected by the spell. A creature restrained by your grip can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC. If it succeeds, it is no longer restrained. Each time a creature ends its turn restrained by this spell, it takes an additional 4d4 acid damage.
At Higher Levels: If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 2nd.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 188 (Third Party)

spell.name: Comet Shards (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a delerium chip worth 10gp, which the spell consumes)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Sorcerer (Delerium Soul), Sorcerer, Wizard, Warlock
spell.text:
This is a Contaminated Spell. When you cast this spell, you gain 1 Contamination Level.
You shatter the delerium fragment in your hand into three glowing comet-like motes of magical force which you hurl at your foes. Each comet hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A comet deals 2d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier force damage to its target and pushes it 10 feet away from you. The comets all strike simultaneously, and you can direct them to hit one creature or several.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the spell creates one more comet for each slot level above 1st.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 194 (Third Party)

spell.name: Contaminated Hands (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (a delerium fragment worth 100gp, which the spell consumes)
spell.classes: School: Evocation, Sorcerer (Delerium Soul), Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
This is a Contaminated Spell. When you cast this spell, you gain 1 Contamination Level.
You create two Large hands of shimmering, octarine force in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. The hands last for the spell's duration. Both hands move at your command, mimicking the movements of your own hands. Each hand is an object that has AC 20 and hit points equal to your hit point maximum. If one or both of the hands drop to 0 hit points, the spell ends. Each hand has a Strength of 26 (+8) and a Dexterity of 10 (+0) and occupies its space. When you cast the spell, and as an action on your subsequent turns, you can move the hands up to 60 feet and then cause one of the following effects with each. Both hands can perform the same action, or different ones. The two hands must move to remain within 30 feet of each other.
• Arcane Slam. The hand strikes one creature or object within 5 feet of it. Make a melee spell attack for the hand using your game statistics. On a hit, the target takes 4d12 necrotic damage. If you direct both hands to attack the same target, they gain advantage on the attack roll.
• Forceful Throw. The hand attempts to push a creature within 5 feet of it in a direction you choose. Make a check with the hand's Strength contested by the Strength (Athletics) check of the target. If the target is Medium or smaller, you have advantage on the check. If you succeed, the hand pushes the target up to 5 feet plus a number of feet equal to five times your spellcasting ability modifier. The hand moves with the target to remain within 5 feet of it. If both hands are used against the same target, you can throw them ten times your spellcasting ability modifier, and gain advantage on the check against a Large or smaller target.
• Eldritch Grip. The hand attempts to grapple a Huge or smaller creature within 5 feet of it. You use the hand's Strength score to resolve the grapple. If the target is Medium or smaller, you have advantage on the check. If both the hands are used against the same target, they can grapple a creature regardless of its size, and you have advantage on the grapple check against a Large or smaller target.
• Contaminated Crush. You can have a hand crush a target it is grappling. When you do so, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to 2d12 + your spellcasting ability modifier. In addition, the target must make a Constitution saving throw or gain 1 Contamination Level. If both the hands are grappling the same target, you can have them rip the grappled target limb from limb. They deal an extra 4d12 necrotic damage.
At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage from the arcane slam and contaminated crush options increases by 2d12 and the damage from the eldritch grip increases by 2d6 for each slot level above 5th.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 197 (Third Party)

spell.name: Contamination Immunity (HB)
spell.components: V, S, M (an eldritch lily mixed into 250 gp worth of purified fluids per target, which the spell consumes)
spell.classes: School: Abjuration, Touch Spells, Bard, Cleric, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard, Paladin
spell.text:
Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is immune to necrotic damage and cannot gain Contamination Levels. The affected creature may rest normally within the Haze. This spell ends immediately if the creature casts a contaminated spell.
Researching the Spell: A character who can cast 7th level spells, knows the neutralizing field spell, and who has visited the Delerium Heart can research contamination immunity.
Source: Sebastian Crowe's Guide to Drakkenheim p. 192 (Third Party)

spell.name: Controlled Mutation (HB)
spell.classes: School: Transmutation, Druid (Circle of Contamination), Sorcerer (Delerium Soul), Bard, Druid, Sorcerer, Warlock, Wizard
spell.text:
This is a Contaminated Spell. When you cast this spell, you gain 1 Contamination Level.
You weave contaminated energy to temporarily imbue a creature within range with a beneficial mutation. Choose one of the following effects; the target gains that effect until the spell ends.
• Strength. The target has advantage on Strength attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. The target can choose to gain a Contamination Level. If it does, its melee weapon attacks deal an additional 2d6 necrotic damage for the spell's duration.
• Constitution. The target has advantage on Constitution checks and saving throws. The target can choose to gain a Contamination Level. If it does, it gains resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage for the spell's duration.
• Dexterity. The target has advantage on Dexterity attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws. The target can choose to gain a Contamination Level. If it does, its attacks with ranged and finesse weapons score a critical hit on an 18–20 for the spell's duration.
• Intelligence. The target has advantage on Intelligence ability checks and saving throws, as well as spell attack rolls. The target can also choose to gain a Contamination Level. If it does, for the duration of this spell, while the target is concentrating on a spell it has cast, it's concentration can't be broken as a result of taking damage.
• Wisdom. The target has advantage on Wisdom ability checks and saving throws, as well as spell attack rolls. The target can also choose to gain a Contamination Level. If it does, for the duration of this spell, it gains blindsight to a range of 60 feet and can't be surprised while it is conscious.
• Charisma. The target has advantage on Charisma ability checks and saving throws, as well as spell attack rolls. In addition, the target can choose to gain a Contamination Level.
