Further increases add a +1 bonus to the weapon's damage roll. If the weapon being modified has 2 damage dice (such as a greatsword or a firearm), the scale is instead:
2d4 → 2d4 + 1 → 2d6 → 2d6+1 → 2d8 → 2d8+1 → 2d10 → 2d10 + 1 → 2d12
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 79 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Apprentice): Fist (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork melee weapon with the Light property. You can apply any number of Apprentice properties to a masterwork weapon.
This weapon gains the Fist property.
Fist: Attacks made with this weapon are treated as unarmed strikes.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 79 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Apprentice): Foregrip (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork ranged weapon with the Ammunition property that doesn't have the Two-Handed property. You can apply any number of Apprentice properties to a masterwork weapon.
This weapon gains the Foregrip property.
Foregrip: This weapon can be used with one or two hands. If used in two hands, its normal range increases by 50 feet and its long range increases accordingly.
Changing Weapon Ranges: A ranged weapon's long range is either three times its normal range or four times its normal range, depending on the type of projectile it fires. When a masterwork property changes a weapon's normal range, change the long range by three or four times the amount, as appropriate to the weapon. You can't apply a weapon property if it would reduce a ranged weapon's normal range to 0 feet, and you can't remove the Ammunition or Thrown properties from a ranged weapon.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 79 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Apprentice): Heavy (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork martial or exotic weapon with the Two-Handed property that doesn't have the Double property. You can apply any number of Apprentice properties to a masterwork weapon.
This weapon gains the Heavy property. If it is a melee weapon, its damage die increases by one step. If it is ranged, its normal range increases by 20 feet and its long range increases accordingly.
Heavy: Creatures that are Small or Tiny have disadvantage on attack rolls with heavy weapons. A heavy weapon's size and bulk make it too large for a Small or Tiny creature to use effectively.
Damage Steps: If a masterwork property increases or decreases a weapon's damage, it is moved up or down one step on the following scale, down to a minimum of 1d4:
1d4 → 1d6 → 1d8 → 1d10 → 1d12 or 2d6
Further increases add a +1 bonus to the weapon's damage roll. If the weapon being modified has 2 damage dice (such as a greatsword or a firearm), the scale is instead:
2d4 → 2d4 + 1 → 2d6 → 2d6+1 → 2d8 → 2d8+1 → 2d10 → 2d10 + 1 → 2d12
Changing Weapon Ranges: A ranged weapon's long range is either three times its normal range or four times its normal range, depending on the type of projectile it fires. When a masterwork property changes a weapon's normal range, change the long range by three or four times the amount, as appropriate to the weapon. You can't apply a weapon property if it would reduce a ranged weapon's normal range to 0 feet, and you can't remove the Ammunition or Thrown properties from a ranged weapon.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 79 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Apprentice): Blaster (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork ranged weapon with the Loading or Reload property that doesn't have the Tension property. You can apply any number of Apprentice properties to a masterwork weapon.
This weapon loses the Ammunition, Loading, and Reload properties, as well as any damage die increases associated with those properties. (It regains these properties if you later remove Blaster.) It gains the Blaster property and deals radiant damage instead of its normal damage type. If this weapon wasn't previously a firearm, its damage die increases by four steps and moves to two damage dice, if possible. The weapon's normal range increases by 20 feet and its long range increases accordingly.
Blaster: A weapon with the Blaster property is a ranged weapon that requires no ammunition. Blasters are considered firearms for the purpose of class features and abilities. Like firearms, you don't add your ability score modifier to blasters' damage rolls.
Damage Steps: If a masterwork property increases or decreases a weapon's damage, it is moved up or down one step on the following scale, down to a minimum of 1d4:
1d4 → 1d6 → 1d8 → 1d10 → 1d12 or 2d6
Further increases add a +1 bonus to the weapon's damage roll. If the weapon being modified has 2 damage dice (such as a greatsword or a firearm), the scale is instead:
2d4 → 2d4 + 1 → 2d6 → 2d6+1 → 2d8 → 2d8+1 → 2d10 → 2d10 + 1 → 2d12
Changing Weapon Ranges: A ranged weapon's long range is either three times its normal range or four times its normal range, depending on the type of projectile it fires. When a masterwork property changes a weapon's normal range, change the long range by three or four times the amount, as appropriate to the weapon. You can't apply a weapon property if it would reduce a ranged weapon's normal range to 0 feet, and you can't remove the Ammunition or Thrown properties from a ranged weapon.
Blaster Notes: In high-tech settings, such as the Dark Matter campaign setting, many weapons release blasts of energy instead of conventional projectiles. The Blaster property replaces the Firearm property in such settings. All rules that apply to firearms apply to blasters as well. For the purpose of applying masterwork properties, blasters count as ranged weapons with the Ammunition and Reload properties. You can also apply the Overheat and Variable properties listed below to blasters.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 80 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Apprentice): Variable (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork exotic ranged weapon with the Blaster property. You can apply any number of Apprentice properties to a masterwork weapon.
This weapon has a variable power cell. As a bonus action, you can change the damage type of the blaster to cold, fire, lightning, necrotic radiant, or back to its normal damage type.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 80 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Journeyman): Overheat (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork martial or exotic weapon with the Blaster and Heavy properties. You can apply only one Journeyman property to a weapon at a time. You can't apply a Journeyman property to a weapon that already has one.
This weapon gains the Overheat property and its damage die increases by two steps.
Overheat: Once you make an attack with this weapon, it can't be used again to make an attack until the end of your next turn.
Damage Steps: If a masterwork property increases or decreases a weapon's damage, it is moved up or down one step on the following scale, down to a minimum of 1d4:
1d4 → 1d6 → 1d8 → 1d10 → 1d12 or 2d6
Further increases add a +1 bonus to the weapon's damage roll. If the weapon being modified has 2 damage dice (such as a greatsword or a firearm), the scale is instead:
2d4 → 2d4 + 1 → 2d6 → 2d6+1 → 2d8 → 2d8+1 → 2d10 → 2d10 + 1 → 2d12
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 80 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Apprentice): Light (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork weapon that doesn't have the Two-Handed or Versatile properties. You can apply any number of Apprentice properties to a masterwork weapon.
This weapon gains the Light property and its damage die decreases by one step.
Light: A light weapon is small and easy to handle, making it ideal for use when fighting with two weapons.
Damage Steps: If a masterwork property increases or decreases a weapon's damage, it is moved up or down one step on the following scale, down to a minimum of 1d4:
1d4 → 1d6 → 1d8 → 1d10 → 1d12 or 2d6
Further increases add a +1 bonus to the weapon's damage roll. If the weapon being modified has 2 damage dice (such as a greatsword or a firearm), the scale is instead:
2d4 → 2d4 + 1 → 2d6 → 2d6+1 → 2d8 → 2d8+1 → 2d10 → 2d10 + 1 → 2d12
Changing Weapon Ranges: A ranged weapon's long range is either three times its normal range or four times its normal range, depending on the type of projectile it fires. When a masterwork property changes a weapon's normal range, change the long range by three or four times the amount, as appropriate to the weapon. You can't apply a weapon property if it would reduce a ranged weapon's normal range to 0 feet, and you can't remove the Ammunition or Thrown properties from a ranged weapon.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 80 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Apprentice): Loading (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork ranged weapon with the Ammunition property that doesn't have the Reload property. You can apply any number of Apprentice properties to a masterwork weapon.
This weapon gains the Loading property and its damage die increases by one step.
Loading: Because of the time required to load this weapon, you can fire only one piece of ammunition from it when you use an action, bonus action, or reaction to fire it, regardless of the number of attacks you can normally make.
Damage Steps: If a masterwork property increases or decreases a weapon's damage, it is moved up or down one step on the following scale, down to a minimum of 1d4:
1d4 → 1d6 → 1d8 → 1d10 → 1d12 or 2d6

2d4 → 2d4 + 1 → 2d6 → 2d6+1 → 2d8 → 2d8+1 → 2d10 → 2d10 + 1 → 2d12
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 84 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Master): Serrated (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork exotic weapon that deals slashing damage. You can apply only one Master property to a weapon at a time.
When a creature takes damage from serrated weapons twice or more in a single turn, it takes an extra 1d8 slashing damage.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 84 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Master): Slaying (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork exotic weapon. You can apply only one Master property to a weapon at a time.
When you apply this property, choose one creature type other than Humanoids. This weapon deals an extra 1d12 damage to creatures of the chosen type.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 84 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Master): Vampiric (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork exotic weapon. You can apply only one Master property to a weapon at a time.
This weapon deals an extra 1d4 necrotic damage on a hit. When you hit a hostile creature with this weapon, you regain hit points equal to the extra necrotic damage dealt by this property.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 85 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Master): Venom (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork exotic weapon. You can apply only one Master property to a weapon at a time.
This weapon deals an extra 1d8 poison damage on a hit.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 85 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Legendary): Crushing (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork exotic weapon that deals bludgeoning damage. You can apply only one Legendary property to a weapon at a time.
When you hit a creature that has natural armor or is wearing armor, the target takes a cumulative - 1 penalty to the AC its armor offers. Armor reduced to an AC of 10 in this way is destroyed. A creature can repair its armor or heal the damage dealt to its natural armor over the course of a long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 85 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Legendary): Deadly (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork exotic ranged weapon with the Firearm property. You can apply only one Legendary property to a weapon at a time.
When you make an attack with this weapon as part of an action, you can add your ability modifier to its attack and damage rolls, instead of just to its attack rolls.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 85 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Legendary): Magical (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork exotic weapon. You can apply only one Legendary property to a weapon at a time.
This weapon becomes magical and gains a +1 bonus to its attack and damage rolls. This benefit stacks if you apply the Magical property at different levels.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 85 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Legendary): Penetrating (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork exotic weapon with the Ammunition or Thrown property that deals piercing damage. You can apply only one Legendary property to a weapon at a time.
This weapon pierces through its targets. When you make a ranged attack with this weapon and don't have disadvantage, you can target all creatures in a straight line within this weapon's normal range. You don't make an attack roll for this attack. Instead, each creature in the line must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take damage as if it were hit by the weapon.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 85 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Legendary): Seeking (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork exotic ranged weapon. You can apply only one Legendary property to a weapon at a time.
When you make an attack roll that doesn't have disadvantage with this weapon and miss, you instead hit the target and deal 5 damage of the weapon's type. This damage can't be increased in any way, and no other effects can be applied to the hit.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 85 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Legendary): Threatening (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork exotic melee weapon. You can apply only one Legendary property to a weapon at a time.
When you make an opportunity attack with a threatening weapon, you can do so without using your reaction. You can't make more than one opportunity attack per turn.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 85 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Legendary): Vorpal (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork exotic weapon that deals slashing damage. You can apply only one Legendary property to a weapon at a time.
When you attack a creature that has at least one head with this weapon and roll a 20 on the attack roll, you cut off one of the creature's heads. The creature dies if it can't survive without the lost head. A creature is immune to this effect if it is immune to slashing damage, doesn't have or need a head, has legendary actions, or the GM decides that the creature is too big for its head to be cut off with this weapon. Such a creature instead takes an extra 6d8 slashing damage from the hit.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 85 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Weapon Properties (Legendary): Whirlwind (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork exotic melee weapon with the Finesse property and the Double property or Light property. You can apply only one Legendary property to a weapon at a time.
When you use your bonus action to make an additional melee attack with this weapon-such as when you engage with two-weapon fighting or use a double weapon-you can make an attack with it against any number of creatures within 5 feet of you, with a separate attack roll for each target. You can't move between these bonus attacks.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 85 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Apprentice): Cleated (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of medium or heavy armor. You can apply a maximum of three Apprentice properties to a suit of armor.
When you would be moved by an effect against your will while wearing this armor, reduce that movement by 10 feet.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 86 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Apprentice): Climbing (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic light armor. You can apply a maximum of three Apprentice properties to a suit of armor.
This armor is outfitted with integrated climbing gear. While wearing this armor, as long as you have one hand free, you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 86 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Apprentice): Comfortable (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of armor. You can apply a maximum of three Apprentice properties to a suit of armor.
You can sleep in this suit of armor with no ill effect.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 86 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Apprentice): Environmental (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of armor. You can apply a maximum of three Apprentice properties to a suit of armor.
While wearing this suit of armor, you can tolerate temperatures as cold as -100 degrees Fahrenheit or as warm as 200 degrees Fahrenheit.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 86 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Apprentice): Exotic (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of armor that isn't exotic. You can apply a maximum of three Apprentice properties to a suit of armor.
This armor becomes exotic armor, and you have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing it. No class, other than the craftsman, gains proficiency with exotic armor.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 86 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Apprentice): Integrated (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic armor. You can apply a maximum of three Apprentice properties to a suit of armor.
You can integrate a weapon directly into your armor, or you can integrate two weapons (one into each arm) if neither has the Two-Handed property. When you draw an integrated weapon, it snaps to your hand and you can't be disarmed of it. When you stow it, it retracts back into your armor. You can switch which weapons are integrated over the course of a long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 86 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Apprentice): Quick-Change (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of armor. You can apply a maximum of three Apprentice properties to a suit of armor.
You can don or doff this suit of armor as an action.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 86 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Apprentice): Retractable (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic medium or heavy armor. You can apply a maximum of three Apprentice properties to a suit of armor.
One of the gauntlets on this suit of armor has a retractable shield set into it. While wearing this armor, you can don or doff this shield as a bonus action.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 86 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Apprentice): Scaled (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic light armor. You can apply a maximum of three Apprentice properties to a suit of armor.
This armor is covered in heavy, hardened scales. The AC provided by this armor increases by 3. However, you only add your Dexterity modifier to a maximum of +2 when determining your Armor Class while wearing it.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 86 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Apprentice): Spiked (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of heavy armor. You can apply a maximum of three Apprentice properties to a suit of armor.
This suit of armor is bristling with spikes. While wearing this armor, creatures who are in contact with you (either by grappling you, being grappled by you, or having swallowed you whole) take piercing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier at the start of your turn.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 86 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Journeyman): Adamantine (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic heavy armor. You can apply only one Journeyman property to a suit of armor at a time.
This suit of armor is reinforced with adamantine, one of the hardest substances in existence. While wearing it, any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 86 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Journeyman): Arcane (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic armor. You can apply only one Journeyman property to a suit of armor at a time.
This armor is covered in arcane etchings. When you apply this property to a suit of armor, choose two cantrips from the wizard spell list. While wearing this armor, you can cast those cantrips. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these cantrips.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 87 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Journeyman): Arrow-Catching (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic medium or heavy armor. You can apply only one Journeyman property to a suit of armor at a time.
Whenever an attacker makes a ranged attack against a target within 5 feet of you, you can use your reaction to become the target of the attack instead.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 87 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Journeyman): Diving (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic armor. You can apply only one Journeyman property to a suit of armor at a time.
This suit of armor is equipped with webbed fins, a mask, and an air bladder containing 8 hours of breathable air. While wearing it, you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. Additionally, while breathing from the air bladder, you can breathe normally underwater or in a vacuum, and you ignore the effects of inhaled poisons. The suit's air supply can be refilled over the course of a long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 87 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Journeyman): Juggernaut (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic heavy armor. You can apply only one Journeyman property to a suit of armor at a time.
This suit of armor is fitted with massive plates and a heavy, reinforced helmet. While wearing this armor, you count as an obstacle providing three-quarters cover, instead of half cover. You must have a Strength score of 16 or higher to wear this armor.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 87 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Journeyman): Maneuvering (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic light or medium armor. You can apply only one Journeyman property to a suit of armor at a time.
This armor contains a set of spring-loaded, automatically retracting grappling hooks. As a reaction when you fall, or as a bonus action on your turn, you can project a grappling hook at a target location you can see that is no farther away than walking speed. If the target location can hold your weight, you are pulled there, expending movement as normal. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks. You must have a Dexterity score of 16 or higher to wear this armor.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 87 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Journeyman): Mithral (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of medium or heavy armor. You can apply only one Journeyman property to a suit of armor at a time.
This suit of armor is made of mithral, a light and flexible metal that is as strong as steel. Armor made of mithral weighs half as much as normal, has no Strength requirement, and doesn't impose disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. If the armor is medium armor, the maximum Dexterity modifier you can apply to your Armor Class increases to 3, instead of 2, and the armor can easily be worn hidden under normal clothing.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 87 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Journeyman): Resistance (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of armor. You can apply only one Journeyman property to a suit of armor at a time.
When you apply this property to a suit of armor, choose any damage type other than bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, or psychic. While wearing this armor, you have resistance to that damage type.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 88 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Master): Animated (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic heavy armor. You can apply only one Master property to a suit of armor at a time.
This armor is enchanted with powerful transmutation magic. As an action, you can doff the armor, which animates, as per the spell animate objects, becoming a Medium animated object. The armor's AC equals your own while you wore it, and it uses your own melee attack bonus instead of its own. As normal, the animated armor has 40 hit points. If you were holding a weapon when the armor became animated, it can make one attack with that weapon instead of its normal slam attack. The armor remains animated for 1 minute, or until it is reduced to 0 hit points or you use your action to end this effect early. When you do so, if the armor is within 30 feet of you, you can command it to return to you and be donned as part of the same action. Once you use this property, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 88 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Master): Cloaking (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic light armor. You can apply only one Master property to a suit of armor at a time.
This armor can easily hide the wearer when needed. While wearing this armor, you can cast the invisibility spell without expending a spell slot or material components. Once you use this property to cast the spell, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 88 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Master): Clockwork (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic heavy armor. You can apply only one Master property to a suit of armor at a time.
This suit of armor has dozens of clockwork mechanisms integrated into it, granting you a number of benefits. While wearing this armor, your jump distance is tripled, and you have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks (other than grapple checks). Additionally, your armor locks down when you take the Dodge action, causing your AC to become 22, if it was lower.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 88 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Master): Glamoured (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic armor. You can apply only one Master property to a suit of armor at a time.
This armor doesn't impose disadvantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. You can also use a bonus action to cause the armor to assume the appearance of a normal set of clothing or some other kind of armor. You decide what it looks like, including color, style, and accessories, but the armor retains its normal bulk and weight. The illusory appearance lasts until you use this ability again or remove the armor.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 88 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Master): Trollskin (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic medium armor. You can apply only one Master property to a suit of armor at a time.
This suit of armor is made of or lined with troll hide. While wearing this armor, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your craftsman level. Once you use this property, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 88 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Master): Winged (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic light armor. You can apply only one Master property to a suit of armor at a time.
This armor has a set of wings that you can extend from it or fold back into it as a bonus action. While wearing this armor with the wings extended, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 88 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Legendary): Colossal (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic heavy armor. You can apply only one Legendary property to a suit of armor at a time.
This suit of armor doubles in size when donned. While wearing this armor, you gain the effect of the "Enlarge" option of the enlarge/reduce spell.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 88 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Legendary): Etherealness (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic armor. You can apply only one Legendary property to a suit of armor at a time.
This suit of armor is infused with ectoplasm. While wearing this armor, you can use your action to gain the effect of the etherealness spell, which lasts for 10 minutes or until you use an action to end it. Once you use this property, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 88 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Legendary): Fleet (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic light armor. You can apply only one Legendary property to a suit of armor at a time.
This armor is designed to maximize the wearer's speed. While wearing this armor, your speed increases by 10 feet, you have advantage on initiative rolls, and opportunity attacks against you are made with disadvantage.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 89 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Legendary): Immortal (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic medium or heavy armor. You can apply only one Legendary property to a suit of armor at a time.
When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. If you succeed, you drop to 1 hit point instead. You can use this ability three times, and you regain all expended uses of it when you finish a long rest. Additionally, you have advantage on death saving throws.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 89 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Legendary): Mirrored (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic light armor. You can apply only one Legendary property to a suit of armor at a time.
While wearing this armor, you can cast the mirror image spell as a bonus action without expending a spell slot. Once you use this property to cast the spell, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 89 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Legendary): Spellguard (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic armor. You can apply only one Legendary property to a suit of armor at a time.
This armor is covered in protective sigils and charms. While wearing this armor, you have advantage on saving throws against spells.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 89 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Armor Properties (Legendary): Warding (HB)
spell.text:
Components: Masterwork suit of exotic medium armor. You can apply only one Legendary property to a suit of armor at a time.
This suit of armor generates a field of force, protecting its wearer from harm. As a bonus action on your turn, you can gain temporary hit points equal to half your craftsman level.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 89 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Amphibious Adaptation
spell.text:
Cost: 400 gp Donor: Any creature with the Amphibious trait Slot: Head
You have grafted the gills of an aquatic creature to your neck, allowing you to breathe both air and water. Additionally, you attach minimal fins and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 370 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Arcane Synapses
spell.text:
Cost: 1,000 gp Donor: Any creature with the Spellcasting or Innate Spellcasting trait Slot: Head
You have stolen a bit of arcane potential from a creature by inserting some of its nerves into your brain. You learn one cantrip of your choice from the wizard spell list. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for this cantrip. By harvesting a second creature, you can improve this graft and learn an additional wizard cantrip of your choice.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 370 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Beast's Hide
spell.text:
Cost: 250 gp Donor: Beast of Large size or larger Slot: External
You have transplanted the thick (and possibly furry) hide from a wild Beast onto your body. When you aren't wearing armor, your base AC is 13 + your Dexterity modifier. You can use your Beast's Hide to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your Beast's Hide.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 370 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Bestial Weapons
spell.text:
Cost: 200 gp Donor: Beast, Dragon, or Monstrosity with Bite or Claw attack Slot: Arms or Head
You have surgically implanted either the teeth or claws from a monster into yourself, which are natural weapons that you can use to make unarmed strikes. By harvesting a second creature, you can improve this graft to gain both the claws and teeth. You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack rolls of your unarmed strikes made using your teeth or claws. If you hit with them, you deal damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (as appropriate to the attack roll), instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. Your claws deal slashing damage and take up the Arms slot, whereas your teeth deal piercing damage and take up the Head slot.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 370 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Charging Hooves
spell.text:
Cost: 350 gp Donor: Any creature with a Charge trait or a Gore or Hooves attack Slot: Legs
You have replaced your legs with those of a creature known for running down its foes. Once on each of your turns, when you move at least 15 feet in a straight line, you can move up to 10 additional feet in that direction without spending additional movement.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 370 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Climbing Apparatus
spell.text:
Cost: 1,250 gp Donor: Beast, Humanoid, or Monstrosity with a climbing speed Slot: Legs
You have replaced or complemented your limbs with those of a climbing creature. You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 370 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Darkvision
spell.text:
Cost: 300 gp Donor: Any creature with darkvision Slot: Head
You have replaced your own eyes with those of a monster with keen nightvision. You gain darkvision, the ability to see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 370 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Doppel-Blooded
spell.text:
Cost: 1,000 gp Donor: Any creature with the shapechanger tag Slot: Internal
You transform your appearance for up to 1 hour. You decide what you look like, including your height, weight, facial features, sound of your voice, hair length, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics, if any. You can make yourself appear as a member of another race, though none of your statistics change. You also can't appear as a creature of a different size than you, and your basic shape stays the same; if you're bipedal, you can't use this ability to become quadrupedal, for instance. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 370 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Draconis Fundamentum
spell.text:
Cost: 1,000 gp Donor: Dragon, Humanoid, or Monstrosity with a Breath Weapon Slot: Internal
You have installed the mighty source of breath weapons into yourself, and as an action on your turn, you can exhale a wave of energy. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). On a failed save, the creature takes 1d6 damage for each point of your proficiency bonus, or half as much damage on a successful one. The breath weapon's damage type is the same as the donor's breath weapon. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 371 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Dragon's Hide
spell.text:
Cost: 2,250 gp Donor: Dragon of Large size or larger Slot: External
You've transplanted the scaly, diamond-like hide of a Dragon onto your body. While you aren't wearing armor, this natural armor provides you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You can use your natural armor to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your natural armor. You also gain resistance to one of the following damage types to which the donor dragon was immune: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage. You can only install this graft if you are proficient with heavy armor.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 371 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Energetic Suture
spell.text:
Cost: 500 gp Donor: Celestial, Dragon, Elemental, Fey, or Fiend with immunity or resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage Slot: External
You have managed to capture the essence of extraplanar resistance to magic. You gain resistance to one of the following damage types to which the donor was immune or resistant: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 371 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Fiend's Hide
spell.text:
Cost: 1,500 gp Donor: Fiend of Medium size or larger Slot: External
When you arent wearing armor, your base AC is 15 + your Dexterity modifier (maximum 2). You can use your Fiend's Hide to determine your AC if the armor you wear would leave you with a lower AC. A shield's benefits apply as normal while you use your Fiend's Hide.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 371 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Heart of Steel
spell.text:
Cost: 2,250 gp Donor: Any Construct Slot: Internal
You have replaced your heart with the core from a Construct. As a result, you can ignore the effects of 1 level of exhaustion, and you can finish a long rest in 4 hours.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 371 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Horns
spell.text:
Cost: 350 gp Donor: Any creature with a Gore, Horns, Ram, or Tusk attack Slot: Head
You attach a sturdy pair of horns or tusks onto your body, which are a natural weapon that you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength modifier, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike. Your horns deal the same type of damage as the donor (usually bludgeoning or piercing damage). Additionally, if you move in a straight line for 10 feet immediately before hitting a creature with your horns, that creature must make a Strength check contested by your Strength check. If you succeed, the creature is knocked prone.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 372 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Indiscernible Anatomy
spell.text:
Cost: 1,250 gp Donor: Aberration of Medium size or larger Slot: Internal
You have spliced aberrant genetics into your body, which have subsequently altered the placement and composition of your internal organs. Any critical hit against you becomes a normal hit.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 372 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Leaping Legs
spell.text:
Cost: 400 gp Donor: Any creature with the Pounce or Standing Leap trait Slot: Legs
You have replaced or modified your legs with the muscular limbs of a bounding creature. Your jump distance doubles. Additionally, you can jump your full distance with or without a running start.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 372 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Olfactory Implants
spell.text:
Cost: 200 gp Donor: Any creature with the Keen Smell or Keen Hearing and Smell trait Slot: Head
You have replaced or modified your nose with that of a creature with keen smell. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 372 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Oversized Arms
spell.text:
Cost: 1,500 gp Donor: Giant Slot: Arms
You have replaced your arms with a giant's massive limbs. The reach of your melee attacks increases by 5 feet, unless the attack is made with a weapon that already has the Reach property. If you are Small, you can wield heavy weapons with which you are proficient without penalty. Additionally, you have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws you make to maintain your grip on objects.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 372 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Prehensile Tail
spell.text:
Cost: 350 gp Donor: Any creature with a Tail attack Slot: External
You surgically attach a muscular, prehensile tail, which is a natural weapon that you can use to make unarmed strikes. You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack rolls of your unarmed strikes made using your tail. If you hit with it, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (as appropriate to the attack roll), instead of the damage normal for an unarmed strike. Additionally, you can hold and manipulate objects and weapons with your tail, but you can't make attacks with weapons held by your tail or wield a shield with your tail and gain its benefits.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 372 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Regenerating Marrow
spell.text:
Cost: 500 gp Donor: Any creature with the Regeneration trait Slot: Internal
You have replaced your bone marrow with that of a regenerating creature. On your turn, you can use a bonus action to regain hit points equal to 1d10 + your Constitution modifier. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 373 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Replacement
spell.text:
Cost: 400 gp Donor: Any Slot: Any
One or more of your organs or limbs have been replaced with a part harvested from a monster. A replacement can effectively solve any amputation or organ failure, but they can't return to life someone that has died; such work is solely the domain of necromancy. Replacement limbs can resemble the original limb or can demonstrate obvious monstrous characteristics, depending on the donor. A replacement organ or limb takes up one body slot relevant to it; for example, a troll's hand takes the Arms slot and a replacement kidney takes up the Internal slot.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 373 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Stench
spell.text:
Cost: 400 gp Donor: Any creature with the Stench trait Slot: Internal
As a bonus action, you can release a foul liquid contained within an organ taken from the donor creature. Each creature within 10 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw (DC equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus) or be poisoned until the end of its next turn. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 373 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Tentacles
spell.text:
Cost: 500 gp Donor: Any creature with a Tentacles or Tendrils attack Slot: Arms
You surgically replace or modify one or both of your arms with a flexible tentacle or tendril, which is a natural weapon that you can use to make unarmed strikes. You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack rolls of your unarmed strikes made using your tentacle, and it has a reach of 10 feet. If you hit with it, you deal bludgeoning damage equal to 1d6 + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (as appropriate to the attack roll), instead of the damage normal for an unarmed strike. Additionally, when you hit a target with your tentacle as part of the Attack action, you can use your bonus action to attempt to grapple the target.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 373 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Venom Sac
spell.text:
Cost: 350 gp Donor: Any creature with a natural weapon or trait that can deal poison damage or cause a creature to become poisoned Slot: Internal
You have installed a gland that secretes poison from your body. As a bonus action, you can coat a weapon you are holding or a natural weapon, if you have one, in basic poison. The save DC for the poison equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 373 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Voice Box
spell.text:
Cost: 150 gp Donor: Any creature with the Mimicry trait Slot: Head
You have augmented your own vocal folds with those of a creature that can mimic sounds. You can mimic any sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a successful Wisdom (Insight) check, contested by your Charisma (Deception) check.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 373 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Graft: Webspinner Apparatus
spell.text:
Cost: 500 gp Donor: Any creature with a Web action Slot: Internal
You have installed spinnerets from a spiderlike creature into your body, allowing you to produce webs. You can cast the web spell without using spell slots or spell components (DC equals 8 + your Constitution modifier + your proficiency bonus). Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 373 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Abyssal Concort (HB)
spell.text:
You can cast might of the abyss once using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 260 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Crimson Investigator (HB)
spell.text:
You can cast the blood print spell at will, without expending a spell slot.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 260 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Eldritch Claw (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 5th level Warlock
When you cast a cantrip that requires one or more ranged spell attacks, you can make melee spell attacks instead.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 261 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Fell Flight (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 15th level Warlock
Your patron grants you the power to fly: this manifests as a pair of wings (of varying types), a dark aura, or some other sign appropriate to your patron. While you aren't wearing medium or heavy armor, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 261 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Lurker in the Threshold (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 9th level Warlock
You can cast protect threshold at will, without expending a spell slot or material components. The spell ends early if you use this invocation to cast the spell again.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 261 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Mantle of Mist (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 12th level Warlock, Pact of the Cloak feature
You can cast misty step without using a spell slot by vanishing into your pact cloak, leaving behind a cloud of smoke. You can use this invocation a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of once). You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 261 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Monstrous Carapace (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 12th level Warlock, Pact of the Skin feature
Your already tough form becomes almost impenetrable. When you take bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage from a nonmagical attack that isn't silvered, you can use your reaction to halve the damage taken.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 261 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Pale Horse (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 3rd level Warlock
You can cast the spell find steed once using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 261 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Pandemonium Spark (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: eldritch blast cantrip, Pact of the Flame feature
When you roll a 10 on the damage die for your eldritch blast, you can roll an additional d10 and add its damage to the total, rolling again if this die is also a 10, and so on. You can roll a total number of four damage dice for this damage roll, or eight damage dice on a critical hit.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 261 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Sigil of Protection (HB)
spell.text:
You can cast transient bulwark once using a warlock spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 261 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Sinister Snare (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Pact of the Skin feature
Creatures within your reach provoke opportunity attacks from you even if they take the Disengage action before leaving your reach.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 261 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Surge of Chaos (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 9th level, Pact of the Flame feature
As an action, you can set off an uncontrolled magic spark to cast a random spell. Spend a warlock spell slot and roll on the following table. Each entry gives a list of spells from a particular school of magic; you must choose to cast one of the spells from the list rolled using your warlock spell slot, without consuming expensive material components. New spells are marked with an asterisk.
Surge of Chaos: d8 | Spells 1 | Abjuration. Aid, protection from energy, stoneskin, antilife shell. 2 | Conjuration. Web, conjure animals, dimension door, cloudkill. 3 | Divination. Detect thoughts, geomantic discernment,* divination, scrutinize foe*. 4 | Enchantment. Suggestion, curse of blades, * confusion, hold monster. 5 | Evocation. Gust of wind, fireball, ice storm, wall of force. 6 | Illusion. Mirror image, major image, greater invisibility, seeming. 7 | Necromancy. Ray of enfeeblement, bestow curse, blight, contagion. 8 | Transmutation. Heat metal, haste, polymorph, animate objects.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 261 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Invocation: Wisp of Shadow (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: Pact of the Cloak feature
While wearing your pact cloak, you do not take any damage from falling.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 261 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Bishop's Maneuver (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th level Warmage (Valda), House of Bishops
You can take the Disengage action as a bonus action. When you do so, your walking speed increases by 10 feet until the end of your turn.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 161 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Blasting Cantrip (HB)
spell.text:
Once on each of your turns, when you deal force damage to a creature with a warmage cantrip, you can push the creature up to 10 feet away from you in a straight line.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 161 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Blinding Light (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: light cantrip
When you use the light cantrip to target an object you are holding, you can direct a flare at a creature you can see within 10 feet of you, which must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the target is blinded until the start of your next turn. After a creature has failed a saving throw against this trick, it has advantage on all saving throws against it for the next 24 hours.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 161 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Castle (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th level Warmage (Valda), House of Rooks
As an action, you can choose a willing Small or Medium creature you can see within 120 feet of you. You both teleport, swapping places. Once you use this trick, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 161 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Chivalrous Presence (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: House of Knights
You gain proficiency in the Insight and Persuasion skills, and you have advantage on ability checks you make to interact with nobility. Additionally, other creatures can always discern when you're telling the truth.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 161 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Cloak of Feathers (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: House of Rooks
While you aren't wearing armor or wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Intelligence modifier.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 161 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Commander's Steed (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: House of Kings
You learn the find steed spell and can cast it at will without expending a spell slot. Your steed is more resilient than most; its hit point maximum is increased by an amount equal to your warmage level.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 161 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Corrosive Cantrip (HB)
spell.text:
Once on each of your turns, when you deal acid damage to a creature with a warmage cantrip, you can cause the acid to erode the target's defenses. The next time a creature makes an attack roll against the target before the start of your next turn, the target takes a penalty to its Armor Class equal to half your warmage level (up to a maximum of -5) for that attack.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 161 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Directed Momentum (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th level Warmage (Valda), House of Lancers
Once on each of your turns, when you deal acid damage to a creature with a warmage cantrip, you can cause the acid to erode the target's defenses. The next time a creature makes an attack roll against the target before the start of your next turn, the target takes a penalty to its Armor Class equal to half your warmage level (up to a maximum of -5) for that attack.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 161 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Draining Cantrip (HB)
spell.text:
Whenever you deal necrotic or poison damage to a hostile creature with a warmage cantrip, you can siphon some of its life force. You gain temporary hit points equal to half your warmage level, which last for 1 minute.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 161 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Encryptogram (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: cryptogram cantrip
Your knowledge of ciphers has improved your magically clandestine communications. When you cast the cryptogram cantrip, its limit is 20 characters, instead of 8, and only the specified recipient can read the message.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 162 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Explosive Cantrip (HB)
spell.text:
Once on each of your turns, when you deal fire damage to a creature with a warmage cantrip, you can cause it to explode. Each creature within 5 feet of the target, except you and the target, must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or take half the fire damage dealt to the target.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 162 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Extended Range (HB)
spell.text:
Whenever you cast a warmage cantrip that has a range of 5 feet or greater, its range is doubled.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 162 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Field Medic (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: House of Bishops
You learn the spare the dying cantrip, which doesn't count against your number of cantrips known. Additionally, when you cast spare the dying on a creature that has 0 hit points, the target regains 1 hit point and gains temporary hit points equal to your warmage level, which last for 1 minute. Once a creature regains hit points from this trick, it can't do so again until it finishes a long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 162 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Flexible Range (HB)
spell.text:
Being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on your ranged spell attack rolls. Additionally, when you cast a warmage cantrip that requires a melee spell attack, its range increases to 10 feet.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 162 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Fold (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th level Warmage (Valda), House of Cards
You have learned to graciously accept defeat using your Deck of Fate. As a reaction when you are hit by an attack, you can play your entire hand to cast the shield spell without expending a spell slot. Once you use this trick, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 162 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Gamble (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: House of Cards or House of Dice, cheat cantrip
You are always under the effects of the cheat cantrip. Additionally, when you miss with an attack roll, or you fail an ability check or saving throw, you can reroll the d20 and must use the new roll. Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 162 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Infinite Variation (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: prestidigitation cantrip
You have become exceptionally skilled at using the prestidigitation cantrip to mimic other spells. When you cast prestidigitation, you can use it to emulate the effects of any other cantrip that doesn't deal damage, even one that is not on the warmage spell list. To do so, you must succeed on a DC 15 Intelligence (Arcana) check, otherwise the spell fails. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for a cantrip cast using this trick, and it counts as a warmage cantrip for you.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 162 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Icy Cantrip (HB)
spell.text:
Once on each of your turns, when you deal cold damage to a creature with a warmage cantrip, you can numb the target with a frigid blast. The first time the target makes an attack roll before the end of its next turn, subtract half your warmage level from the attack roll.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 162 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Knight's Aegis (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th level Warmage (Valda), House of Knights, force buckler cantrip
When you cast the force buckler cantrip, you can concentrate on it for up to 1 minute. The spell doesn't end early if you are hit by an attack.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 162 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Leading Edge Tactics (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: House of Lancers
You always have a plan when engaging the enemy. Attacks against you have disadvantage during the first round of combat. You can't use this feature when you are surprised.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 163 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Lieutenant's Demand (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th level Warmage (Valda), House of Kings
You can cast the spell command at will without expending a spell slot.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 163 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Mage Hand Knack (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: mage hand cantrip
Your skill with the mage hand cantrip allows you to use it as an extension of yourself. When you cast the spell and as a bonus action on your subsequent turns, you can use one of the following effects with the hand:
Press: The hand pushes against a Large or smaller creature within 5 feet of it. Choose a direction away from that creature. Every foot of movement in that direction while the hand is pressing against it costs the creature 1 extra foot of movement. The hand continues to push against the target until the spell ends or you use your bonus action to use a different effect with the hand.
Punch: The hand strikes one creature or object within 5 feet of it. Make a melee spell attack for the hand. On a hit, the target takes 1d6 force damage.
Seize: The hand grabs a Small or smaller creature and attempts to grapple it. The creature must succeed on a Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) check (its choice) against your spell save DC or be grappled by the hand. The hand continues to grapple the target until the target uses an action to break the grapple on its turn, the spell ends, or you use your bonus action to use a different effect with the hand.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 163 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Minor Shadow Illusion (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: minor illusion cantrip
When you create the image of an object in an unoccupied space using the minor illusion cantrip, you can fill it with fibers of shadowstuff, causing it to become partially real. No matter what form the semi-real object takes, it still must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. It has AC 10 and 5 hit points, and it weighs 5 pounds. You can only have one semi-real illusion at a time. While this semi-real object exists, the cantrip requires your concentration. The illusion can't replicate a creature, but it can deal damage to a creature within its 5-foot cube. If the illusion is of an object that can deal damage, a creature that enters the object's 5-foot cube or begins its turn there must make an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature takes 1d6 damage of a type appropriate to the illusion. This damage increases by 1d6 when you reach 5th level (2d6), 11th level (3d6), and 17th level (4d6). This damage can't trigger Warmage Edge or any warmage tricks.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 163 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Mystical Armor (HB)
spell.text:
You can cast the mage armor spell on yourself at will, without using a spell slot or spell components.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 163 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Mystical Athlete (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: quickstep or springheel cantrip
When you cast the quickstep cantrip, your speed increases by 20 feet instead of 10 feet. When you cast the springheel cantrip, your jumping distance increases by 20 feet instead of 10 feet. If you know both of these cantrips, you can cast both of them as part of the same bonus action.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 163 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Mystical Weaponmaster (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: force weapon or magic daggers cantrip
When you roll a 1 on the d20 for an attack roll with the force weapon or magic daggers cantrips, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 163 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Mystical Vision (HB)
spell.text:
You can cast the detect magic spell at will without expending a spell slot.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 163 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Phantom Hookshot (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: phantom grapnel cantrip
You can cast the phantom grapnel cantrip as a bonus action. If you do so, its range is reduced to 15 feet. When you cast the spell as an action, creatures are pulled an extra 10 feet toward you by the spell.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 163 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Rapid Fortification (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: mending cantrip
You can cast the mending cantrip as an action or a bonus action. If you cast it as an action, you can use one of the following effects:
• You can restore a single nonmagical object, such as a door, cart, or window, to pristine condition if at least half of its parts are present. This object can be no larger than 10 cubic feet, or 1 cubic foot if it is exceptionally complex (such as a clock).
• You can create simple fortifications, such as sealing a door shut, adding wooden planks to a window, or building a short stone wall (no larger than 10 cubic feet). You must have the materials present to use this ability.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 163 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Snake Eyes (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th level Warmage (Valda), House of Dice
If you roll a 1 or 2 on a Die of Fate, you keep the die instead of giving it to the GM.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 164 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Severe Cantrip (HB)
spell.text:
When a creature rolls a 1 on a saving throw against one of your warmage cantrips, it automatically fails the save and takes twice the number of damage dice dealt by the spell, as if you scored a critical hit. The additional damage only applies to the creature that rolled a 1.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 164 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Signature Focus (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 5th level Warmage (Valda)
When you finish a long rest, you can place a unique sigil on a simple or martial weapon, which becomes your signature focus until you use this ability again. This weapon becomes magical, and you can use it as a spellcasting focus for your warmage spells. Your signature focus is bonded to you, and gains a number of special abilities:
• As a bonus action, you can call your signature focus to your hand, as long as you are on the same plane of existence as it.
• You can add your Intelligence modifier, instead of your Strength or Dexterity modifier, to attack and damage rolls using your signature focus.
• Your signature focus gains a number of charges equal to your Intelligence modifier (a minimum of 1). When you deal damage to a creature with it or a cantrip cast through it, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra 1d8 force damage to that creature. Your focus regains all expended charges when you finish a long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 164 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Silent Cantrip (HB)
spell.text:
Once on each of your turns when you deal thunder damage to a hostile creature with a warmage cantrip, you can create a 15-foot-diameter sphere of magical silence (as per the silence spell), centered on yourself or the creature (your choice), which lasts until the start of your next turn.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 164 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Split Fire (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 5th level Warmage (Valda)
When you cast a warmage cantrip that requires a single spell attack roll, you can select multiple creatures and make a spell attack roll against each one. You can target a number of creatures equal to the number of damage dice the cantrip deals, and split your damage dice up amongst your targets, to a minimum of 1 die of damage per target. Each attack must target a different creature. For example, fire bolt deals 3d10 damage. You can choose to target three creatures and deal 1d10 damage to each creature, or you can target two creatures, dealing 1d10 damage to one creature and 2d10 damage to the other creature, or you can target one creature for 3d10 damage.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 164 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Static Cantrip (HB)
spell.text:
Whenever you deal lightning damage to a hostile creature with a warmage cantrip, you can sap part of the energy into a charge, which clings to your body until the start of your next turn. While charged, you can use your reaction when you take damage from a creature you can see within 5 feet of you to deal lightning damage equal to half your warmage level to the creature.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 164 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Warmage Trick: Unerring Strike (HB)
spell.text:
Prerequisite: 10th level Warmage (Valda), true strike cantrip
When you cast the true strike cantrip, you can concentrate on it for a number of rounds equal to your Intelligence modifier. You gain advantage on the first attack roll you make against the target on each of your turns while maintaining concentration on true strike.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 164 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Arcane Fighting Style: Blaster (HB)
spell.text:
You gain a +1 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your warmage spells.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 159 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Arcane Fighting Style: Deflector (HB)
spell.text:
When you have at least one hand free and a creature hits you with a spell attack or a ranged weapon attack, you can use your reaction to add your proficiency bonus to your Armor Class for that attack, potentially causing it to miss.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 160 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Arcane Fighting Style: Resistive (HB)
spell.text:
While you are wearing light armor or are under the effects of the mage armor spell, you gain a + 1 bonus to your Armor Class.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 160 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Arcane Fighting Style: Sniper (HB)
spell.text:
You gain a +1 bonus to ranged spell attack rolls. Additionally, your warmage cantrips ignore half cover.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 160 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Arcane Fighting Style: Striker (HB)
spell.text:
When you hit a creature with a cantrip that requires a melee attack and exceed the target's AC by 5 or more or score a critical hit, you can add your proficiency bonus to the damage roll.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 160 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Abate (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target can't take reactions until the end of your next turn.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 178 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Apathy (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, until the end of your next turn, the target becomes indifferent toward one creature of your choice that it is hostile toward. This indifference ends if the target is attacked or harmed by the creature to which it is indifferent. When the hex ends, the creature becomes hostile again, unless the GM rules otherwise.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 178 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Beckon Familiar (HB)
spell.text:
You can cast the find familiar spell as an action without expending a spell slot or material components. Once you cast this spell in this way, you can't do so again for 1 minute. You must have the Familiar feature to choose this hex.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 178 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Bleeding (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, each time this target takes damage, it loses an extra 1d4 hit points. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 178 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Charm (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is charmed by you until the end of your next turn. When the hex ends, the creature knows it was charmed by you.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 178 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Dire Familiar (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, you can bolster your familiar. For 1 minute, your familiar's hit point maximum and current hit points are increased by an amount equal to twice your witch level, and it gains a bonus to its damage rolls equal to your Charisma modifier. You can cast other hexes while this hex is in effect. Once you cast this hex, you can't cast it again until your familiar is dismissed, or until its duration expires. You must have the Familiar feature to choose this hex.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 178 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Disorient (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, whenever the target makes an attack roll before the end of your next turn, it must roll a d6 and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 178 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Doomward (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, choose one friendly creature other than yourself that you can see within 60 feet of you. If this creature is reduced to 0 hit points before the end of your next turn, but not killed outright, it drops to 1 hit point instead. This hex then ends and can't be used on the same creature again until you finish a short or long rest.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 178 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Duplicity (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, you can create an illusory duplicate of yourself composed of shadowstuff to confuse your enemies. When a creature attacks you, roll any die. On an odd number, the attack strikes the duplicate and misses, regardless of its roll, and the hex ends. On an even number, the attack targets you as normal. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 179 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Evil Eye (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you that can see you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target is frightened of you until the end of your next turn.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 179 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Fortune (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, choose one friendly creature other than yourself that you can see within 60 feet of you. The creature has advantage on saving throws until the end of your next turn.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 179 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Go Unseen (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, you and your familiar become invisible (as per the invisibility spell). The effect ends at the end of your next turn, or if you or your familiar attack or cast a spell. Once you cast this hex, you can't cast it again for 1 minute.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 179 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Hobble (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is reduced to 10 feet until the end of your next turn. If the creature is flying, it falls, unless it has the ability to hover or it is being held aloft by magic.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 179 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Knowing (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, you open your third eye and become intuitively aware of your surroundings. You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks until the end of your next turn. Additionally, choose one of the following pieces of information. You learn that piece of information for each creature within 30 feet of you.
• If a creature can speak a language
• If a creature is at or below half of its hit point maximum
• What a creature's lowest ability score is You can only learn one of these things about a creature, even if you cast this hex more than once.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 179 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Mire (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, you can transform the ground in a 30-foot radius centered on the point where you cast this hex into murky swamp, which is difficult terrain. You and your familiar are immune to this hex. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 179 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Misfortune (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you. Until the end of your next turn, whenever this creature rolls a 20 on a d20 roll, the roll instead becomes a 1.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 179 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Obfuscate (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, you create a 20-foot-radius sphere of fog centered on yourself. The sphere spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. This effect lasts until the end of your next turn or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 179 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Peacebond (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, you can lock weapons to their owners. The weapons and ammunition of each creature within 30 feet of you become locked in their sheaths, quivers, or holsters until the end of your next turn. During this time, a creature can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC, freeing its weapon on a success.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 179 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Pox (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, choose one creature you can see within 5 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target is poisoned until the end of your next turn.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 179 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Ruin (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the target's Armor Class decreases by 3, to a minimum of 10, until the end of your next turn.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 179 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Scurry (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, a nonmagical object you choose within 30 feet of you sprouts legs and runs away. You can't target an object that weighs more than 10 pounds, nor can you target one that is being worn as clothing or armor; however, you can target certain objects that are being carried, as long as they aren't affixed entirely around a creature's body or being held in a hand. For example, you can't target a creature's helmet or a sword it is wielding, but you can target a drawstring pouch it is wearing or a dagger that is sheathed at its side. The object animates, wriggles free of its owner (if it has one), sprouts two legs, and moves 20 feet in a direction you choose. At the start of each of your turns, you can choose which direction the object moves. The object has an AC of 10, if its AC wasn't already higher, and remains animated until the end of your next turn, or until it is picked up.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 180 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Shriek (HB)
spell.text:
As a bonus action, you can release a thunderous, blood-curdling screech. Each Large or smaller creature you choose within 5 feet of you is pushed 5 feet away from you.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 180 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Slumber (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target falls unconscious until it takes damage, or until the end of your next turn. Undead, creatures that are immune to being charmed, and creatures whose current hit points are greater than five times your witch level are immune to this effect.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 180 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Slur (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, choose one creature you can see within 60 feet of you to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target can't speak coherently until the end of your next turn. If the creature attempts to cast a spell that requires a verbal component, it must roll a d20. On an odd roll, the casting fails.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 180 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Tremors (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, you can create a miniature earthquake. Each creature on the ground within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 180 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Hex: Ward (HB)
spell.text:
As an action, choose one creature you can see other than yourself within 60 feet of you. Each time the creature takes damage before the end of your next turn, the damage it takes is reduced by 3.
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 180 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Grand Hex: Cauldron (HB)
spell.text:
You can brew potions in a bubbling cauldron using raw components scavenged from nature. To this end, you have a pool of alchemy points equal to half your witch level, rounded down. You regain all expended alchemy points when you finish a long rest. You can spend 10 minutes and expend any number of alchemy points to brew potions. These potions retain potency for 24 hours, after which they become inert. If a potion calls requires a saving throw, it uses your spell save DC. The potions available for you to brew are given on the Cauldron Potions table below.
Cauldron Potions: Potion | Alchemy Points Potion of Animal Friendship | 1 Potion of Growth | 1 Potion of Healing | 1 Potion of Water Breathing | 1 Oil of Slipperiness | 2 Philter of Love | 2 Potion of Greater Healing | 2 Potion of Heroism | 2 Potion of Resistance | 2 Potion of Clairvoyance | 3 Potion of Diminution | 3 Potion of Gaseous Form | 3
Source: Valda's Spire of Secrets p. 180 (Homebrew)

spell.name: Grand Hex: Coven (HB)
spell.text:
You can induct others into your insidious coven. By performing a special ritual over the course of 8 hours, which can be done during a long rest, you can intermingle your cursed magic with a willing creature that has the Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature. This creature enters into your coven. You can have up to two creatures other than yourself in your coven at a time. While two or more members of your coven are within 30 feet of one another, they gain the ability to cast additional spells, as shown on the Coven Spellcasting table. Additionally, members of your coven gain access to a shared pool of five spell slots—one of each level, from 1st to 5th level—which they can use to cast spells as normal.
